t

ta 1.1

pron. that ✓

Grammar pron, base
Meaning that
Sanskrit ta

Examples

ekam'antaṃ nisinnā kho tā bhikkhuniyo āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavocuṃ

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

idha cunda ekacco anabhijjhālu hoti. yaṃ taṃ parassa paravitt'ūpakaraṇaṃ taṃ anabhijjhitā hoti, aho vata yaṃ parassa taṃ mamassā'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
ta 2.1

letter. (gram) letter t; 24th letter of the alphabet; dental sibilant ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter t; 24th letter of the alphabet; dental sibilant
Sanskrit ta

Example

463, 532. māna kitānaṃ va tattaṃ vā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 463
ta 3.1

suffix. (gram) primary suffix used to form past participles and nouns ✓

Grammar suffix
Meaning (gram) primary suffix used to form past participles and nouns
Sanskrit ta

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabhaggato vā parisaggato vā ñātimajjhagato vā pūgamajjhagato vā rājakulamajjhagato vā abhinīto sakkhipuṭṭho

AN 3.28 gūthabhāṇīsuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ akataṃ asaṅkhataṃ

UD 73 tatiya nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ
taka

nt. kind of medicinal resin ✗
takāra

masc. (gram) letter t; 24th letter of the alphabet; dental sibilant [ta + kāra] ~

Grammar masc, letter, comp
Meaning (gram) letter t; 24th letter of the alphabet; dental sibilant
Construction ta + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (ta + kāra)
Synonym takāratta, tatta
Sanskrit takāra
takāratta

nt. (gram) letter t; 24th letter of the alphabet; dental sibilant; lit. t letter state [ta + kāra + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, letter, comp
Meaning (gram) letter t; 24th letter of the alphabet; dental sibilant; lit. t letter state
Construction ta + kāra + tta
takāra + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Synonym takāra, tatta
Sanskrit takāra +

Example

māna kita'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ abbhāsagatānaṃ vakāra takārattaṃ hoti vā yathāsaṅkhyaṃ. vīmaṃsati, tikicchati. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? cikicchati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 463
takka 1.1

masc. thought; thinking; reasoning; logic; speculation; conjecture [√takk + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from takketi
Meaning thought; thinking; reasoning; logic; speculation; conjecture
Root Family √takk
Root √takk･8 *e (think)
Construction √takk + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym kappa, pavitakka
Sanskrit tarka
Sanskrit Root √tark 10 (think)

Examples

yo kho, bhikkhave, ariyacittassa anāsavacittassa ariyamaggasamaṅgino ariyamaggaṃ bhāvayato takko vitakko saṅkappo appanā byappanā cetaso abhiniropanā vacīsaṅkhāro, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, sammāsaṅkappo ariyo anāsavo lok'uttaro maggaṅgo.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ

kasmā nu saccāni vadanti nānā,
pavādiyāse kusalā vadānā,
saccāni sutāni bahūni nānā,
udāhu te takkam'anussaranti.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
takka 2.1

masc. buttermilk ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning buttermilk
Sanskrit takra

Example

sukkan'ti dasa sukkāni, nīlaṃ pītakaṃ lohitakaṃ odātaṃ takkavaṇṇaṃ dakavaṇṇaṃ telavaṇṇaṃ khīravaṇṇaṃ dadhivaṇṇaṃ sappivaṇṇaṃ.

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhisikkhāpadaṃ
takkagāha

masc. grasping with reasoning; choosing with thought ✗
takkaggāha

masc. grasping onto an idea ✗
takkana

nt. act of rational thinking, reasoning [√takk] ✗
takkapaṇḍitajātaka

nt. Jātaka 63 (JA 63) ✗
takkapariyāhata

adj. logically forged; hammered out by reasoning; beaten together by speculation [takka + pariyāhata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning logically forged; hammered out by reasoning; beaten together by speculation
Construction takka + pariyāhata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (takkena + pariyāhata)
Commentary (DNa) takkapariyāhatan'ti takkena pariyāhataṃ, tena tena pariyāyena takketvā'ti attho.
Sanskrit tarka + parāhata

Example

takkapariyāhataṃ samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ deseti vīmaṃs'ānucaritaṃ sayaṃpaṭibhānaṃ. yassa ca khv'āssa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
takkara 1

adj. who does that; doing that; acting accordingly [tad + kara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who does that; doing that; acting accordingly
Construction tad + kara
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (taṃ + kara)
Commentary (ANa) takkarassā'ti yo tathākārī hoti.
Sanskrit tatkara

Examples

bahum'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno,
na takkaro hoti naro pamatto,
gopo'va gāvo gaṇayaṃ paresaṃ,
na bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

DHP 19 yamakavaggo

takkapariyāhataṃ samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ deseti vīmaṃs'ānucaritaṃ sayaṃpaṭibhānaṃ. yassa ca khv'āssa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
takkara 2

masc. thief ✗
takkalajātaka

nt. Jātaka 446 (JA 446) ✗
takkavaḍḍhana

nt. increasing speculation; proliferating ideas; (comm) increasing thought of sensual pleasures etc. [takka + vaḍḍhana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning increasing speculation; proliferating ideas; (comm) increasing thought of sensual pleasures etc.
Construction takka + vaḍḍhana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (takkānaṃ + vaḍḍhana)
Commentary (SNa) sabbaṃ taṃ takkavaḍḍhanan'ti sabbaṃ taṃ kāmavitakk'ādivaḍḍhanaṃ.
Sanskrit tarka + vardhana

Example

ye me pubbe viyākaṃsu,
huraṃ gotamasāsanā,
icc'āsi iti bhavissati,
sabbaṃ taṃ itih'ītihaṃ,
sabbaṃ taṃ takkavaḍḍhanaṃ,
n'āhaṃ tattha abhiramiṃ.

SNP 63 hemaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 8
takkavaṇṇa

adj. butter-milk coloured [takka + vaṇṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning butter-milk coloured
Construction takka + vaṇṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (takka + vaṇṇa)
Sanskrit takra + varṇa

Example

sukkan'ti dasa sukkāni, nīlaṃ pītakaṃ lohitakaṃ odātaṃ takkavaṇṇaṃ dakavaṇṇaṃ telavaṇṇaṃ khīravaṇṇaṃ dadhivaṇṇaṃ sappivaṇṇaṃ.

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhisikkhāpadaṃ
takkasilā

fem. name of city in Gandāra, where was well known university ✗
takkahetu

masc. logical reasoning; lit. because of logic [takka + hetu] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning logical reasoning; lit. because of logic
Construction takka + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (takkassa + hetu)
Commentary (ANa) mā takkahetū'ti takkaggāhena'pi mā gaṇhittha.
Sanskrit tarka + hetu

Example

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
takkāriyajātaka

nt. Jātaka 481 (JA 481) ✗
takkārī

fem. tree; pea tree, sesbania sesban ✗
takkāsaya

masc. tendency to thought; habitual thought; underlying thought [takka + āsaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning tendency to thought; habitual thought; underlying thought
Construction takka + āsaya
Compound kammadhāraya (takka + āsaya)
Sanskrit tarka + āśraya

Example

okkhittacakkhu na ca pādalolo,
jhān'ānuyutto bahujāgarassa,
upekkham'ārabbha samāhit'atto,
takk'āsayaṃ kukkucciy'ūpachinde.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
takkāhata

nt. application of logic; lit. struck by thought [takka + āhata] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning application of logic; lit. struck by thought
Construction takka + āhata
takkika

masc. logician; philosopher; lit. thinker [√takk + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, from takketi
Meaning logician; philosopher; lit. thinker
Root Family √takk
Root √takk･8 *e (think)
Construction √takk + ika
Derivative kita (ika)
Commentary (UDa) evaṃ obhāsitam'eva takkikānan'ti yathā tena khajjūpanakena sūriy'uggamanato pure'y'eva obhāsitaṃ hoti, evaṃ takketvā vitakketvā parikappanamattena diṭṭhīnaṃ gahaṇato takkikā'ti laddhanāmehi titthiyehi obhāsitaṃ attano samayatejena dīpetvā adhiṭṭhitaṃ tāva
Sanskrit tārkika
Sanskrit Root √tark 10 (think)

Example

evaṃ obhāsitam'eva takkikānaṃ,
yāva sammāsambuddhā loke n'uppajjanti,
na takkikā sujjhanti na c'āpi sāvakā,
duddiṭṭhī na dukkhā pamuccare'ti.

UD60 uppajjantisuttaṃ
takkita

pp. thought, reasoned [√takk] ✗
takkitvā

abs. (+acc) having thought (about); having reflected (on) [√takk + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of takketi, trans (+acc)
Meaning having thought (about); having reflected (on)
Root Family √takk
Root √takk･8 *e (think)
Construction √takk + itvā
Synonym anuvitakketvā, cintayitvāna, cintetvā, vitakketvā
Sanskrit tarkayitvā
Sanskrit Root √tark 10 (think)
takkī

adj. sophist, logician [√takk] ✗
takketi 1

pr. (+acc) thinks; reasons; considers [√takk + *e + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning thinks; reasons; considers
Root Family √takk
Root √takk･8 *e (think)
Base √takk + e > takke
Construction takke + ti
Synonym anucintayati
Sanskrit tarketi
Sanskrit Root √tark 10 (think)
takketi 2

pr. (+acc) trusts [√takk + *e + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning trusts
Root Family √takk
Root √takk･8 *e (think)
Base √takk + e > takke
Construction takke + ti
Sanskrit tarketi
Sanskrit Root √tark 10 (think)
takketvā

abs. having thought, having reasoned [√takk] ✗
takkenta

prp. (+acc) thinking; reasoning [√takk + *e + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of takketi, trans (+acc)
Meaning thinking; reasoning
Root Family √takk
Root √takk･8 *e (think)
Base √takk + e > takke
Construction takke + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit tarkayat
Sanskrit Root √tark 10 (think)

Example

so lābhasakkāraṃ jigucchanto pabbajjaṃ anupagantvā, pahomi c'āhaṃ lābh'ālābh'ādīsu nibbikāro hotun'ti attānaṃ takkento, visesato paraparibhavasahanādipaṭipadaṃ pūrento upekkhāpāramiṃ matthakaṃ pāpessāmī'ti

CPa 3.15 mahālomahaṃsacariyāvaṇṇanā
takkesi

aor. thought, reasoned [√takk] ✗
takkola

nt. kind of perfume ✗
takriyā

fem. doing that [ta + kriyā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning doing that
Construction ta + kriyā
tagara

nt. crape jasmine; milk flower; flower of Tabernaemontana divaricata ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning crape jasmine; milk flower; flower of Tabernaemontana divaricata
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tabernaemontana_divaricata
Sanskrit tagara

Examples

na pupphagandho paṭivātam'eti,
na candanaṃ tagaramallikā,
satañ'ca gandho paṭivātam'eti,
sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.

DHP 54 pupphavaggo

tagarañ'ca palāsena,
yo naro upanayhati,
pattā'pi surabhi vāyanti,
evaṃ dhīr'ūpasevanā.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ
tagaracandana

nt. jasmine and sandalwood [tagara + candana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning jasmine and sandalwood
Construction tagara + candana
Compound dvanda (tagara ca candana ca)
Sanskrit tagara + candana

Example

appamatto ayaṃ gandho,
yv'āyaṃ tagaracandanaṃ,
yo ca sīlavataṃ gandho,
vāti devesu uttamo.

DHP4 pupphavaggo
tagaracandanī

adj. belonging to tagara and sandalwood powder ✗
tagaramallikā

fem. (the scent of) tagara and jasmine ✗
tagarasikhī

masc. name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. jasmine crest [tagara + sikhī] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. jasmine crest

taggarasikhī

masc. name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. jasmine crest [taggara + sikhī] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. jasmine crest
Construction taggara + sikhī
taggaruka

adj. bent thereon ✗
taggha

ind. truly; surely; definitely; most certainly [tad + gha] ✓

Grammar ind, emph
Meaning truly; surely; definitely; most certainly
Construction tad + gha
Synonym aho, ekantena, kira, khu, kho, nuna, nūna, vo, sudaṃ, ssa, have, hi
Commentary (MNa) tagghā'ti ek'aṃs'atthe nipāto. ek'aṃsena mayaṃ, bhante'ti vuttaṃ hoti. (ANa) tagghā'ti ek'aṃsena.
Sanskrit taḥ + gha

Examples

taggha taṃ, bhagini, accayo accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yā tvaṃ evam'akāsi.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ

taggha taṃ, bhikkhu, accayo accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo tvaṃ sāriputtaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhi

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
taṅkhaṇa

masc. that moment; that point in time [taṃ + khaṇa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning that moment; that point in time
Construction taṃ + khaṇa
taṅkhaṇaññeva

sandhi. at exactly that moment in time; suddenly ✗
taṅkhaṇadhotaparisuddha

adj. at the moment when washed and clean [taṅkhaṇa + dhota + parisuddha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning at the moment when washed and clean
Construction taṅkhaṇa + dhota + parisuddha
taṅkhaṇānurūpa

adj. suitable for that moment; appropriate for that point in time [taṅkhaṇa + anurūpa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning suitable for that moment; appropriate for that point in time
Construction taṅkhaṇa + anurūpa
Compound catutthī tappurisa (taṅkhaṇāya + anurūpa)
Commentary (VINt) taṅkhaṇ'ānurūpāyā'ti yādisī tadā tassa ajjhāsayappavatti, tadanurūpāyā'ti attho.
taṅkhaṇika

adj. just for that time, for a short time; temporary ✗
taṅkhaṇikā

fem. temporary sexual partner; lit. related to that moment [taṃ + khaṇa + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning temporary sexual partner; lit. related to that moment
Construction taṃ + khaṇa + ikā
taṅkhaṇa + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Commentary (VIN 1.2.5) antamaso taṅkhaṇikāyapī'ti muhuttikā bhavissasi.
Sanskrit tam + kṣaṇa +

Example

yo pana bhikkhu sañcarittaṃ samāpajjeyya itthiyā vā purisamatiṃ purisassa vā itthimatiṃ, jāyattane vā jārattane vā, antamaso taṅ'khaṇikāya'pi, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 5 sañcarittasikkhāpadaṃ
taṅkhantika

adj. with that belief; accepting that [taṃ + khantika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with that belief; accepting that
Construction taṃ + khantika
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (taṃ + khantika)
Variant taṃkhantika
Sanskrit tam + kṣānti + ka
taca 1

masc. skin ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning skin
Sanskrit tvaca

Examples

āraddhavīriyo viharati, kāmaṃ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ, yaṃ taṃ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṃ, na taṃ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

yo uppatitaṃ vineti kodhaṃ,
visaṭaṃ sappavisaṃ'va osadhehi,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1
taca 2

masc. bark ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning bark
Sanskrit tvaca

Examples

tassa papaṭikā'pi pāripūriṃ gacchati taco'pi pheggu'pi sāro'pi pāripūriṃ gacchati

AN 7.65 hirīottappasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkamm'eva sāraṃ atikkamma phegguṃ atikkamma tacaṃ atikkamma papaṭikaṃ, sākhāpalāsaṃ chetvā ādāya pakkameyya sāran'ti maññamāno.

tacagandha

masc. scent of bark ✗

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
tacapariyosāna

adj. limited by skin ✗

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning reached the inner bark
Construction taca + patta
Commentary (DNa) tacappattā'ti papaṭikato abbhantaraṃ tacaṃ pattā
tacamaṃsāvalepana

adj. with a plastering of flesh and skin ✗
tacas 1

masc. skin (human or animal) ✗
tacas 2

masc. bark; rind; peel ✗
tacasara

tacasāra

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning reed; bamboo; lit. hardwood skin
Construction taca + sāra
Compound kammadhāraya (taca + sāra)
Commentary (SNa) tacasāraṃ'va sam'phalan'ti yathā tacasāraṃ veḷuṃ vā naḷaṃ vā attano phalaṃ hiṃsati vināseti, evaṃ hiṃsanti vināsentī'ti.
Sanskrit tvaca

Example

lobho doso ca moho ca,
purisaṃ pāpacetasaṃ,
hiṃsanti attasambhūtā,
tacasāraṃ'va sam'phalan'ti

SN 3.2 purisasuttaṃ
tacasārajātaka

nt. Jātaka 368 (JA 368) ✗
tacoṭṭhaṭa

adj. covered with skin ✗
tacotthata

adj. covered with skin [taco + atthata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning covered with skin
Construction taco + atthata
Commentary (DNa) tacotthatā'ti tacena pariyonaddhā niguḷhā.
taccha 1

adj. truthful; true; authentic; real [tatha + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from tatha
Meaning truthful; true; authentic; real
Construction tatha + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change thy > cch
Antonym ataccha
Synonym saccika
Variant tatiya, tathiya
Commentary (DNa) tacchā'ti yāthāvā.
Sanskrit tathya

Examples

idha, potaliya, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇ'ārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho vaṇṇ'ārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.

AN 4.100 potaliyasuttaṃ

yam'pi jaññā rahovādaṃ bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ tassa'pi sikkheyya avacanāya.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
taccha 2

nt. truth; reality; as it is [tatha + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from tatha
Meaning truth; reality; as it is
Construction tatha + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change thy > cch
Antonym ataccha
Variant tatiya, tathiya
Sanskrit tathya

Example

sutvān'ahaṃ vīram'akāmakāmiṃ,
ogh'ātigaṃ puṭṭhum'akāmam'āgamaṃ,
santipadaṃ brūhi sahajanetta,
yathātacchaṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11
tacchaka

masc. carpenter; woodworker; lit. cutter [√tacch + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from tacchati
Meaning carpenter; woodworker; lit. cutter
Root Family √tacch
Root √tacch･1 a (cut, chop)
Construction √tacch + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Commentary (DHPa) tacchakā'pi nemiādīnaṃ atthāya tacchantā dāruṃ namayanti attano ruciyā ujuṃ vā vaṅkaṃ vā karonti.
Sanskrit takṣaka
Sanskrit Root √takṣ √tvakṣ 1, 2, 5 (fashion)

Example

udakañ'hi nayanti nettikā,
usukārā namayanti tejanaṃ,
dāruṃ namayanti tacchakā,
attānaṃ damayanti paṇḍitā.

DHP 80 paṇḍitavaggo
tacchakā

masc. group of nāgas; lit. cutter [√tacch + aka + ā] ~

Grammar masc pl, from tacchati
Meaning group of nāgas; lit. cutter
Root Family √tacch
Root √tacch･1 a (cut, chop)
Construction √tacch + aka + ā
tacchaka + ā
Sanskrit takṣaka
Sanskrit Root √takṣ √tvakṣ 1, 2, 5 (fashion)
tacchati 1

pr. (+acc) does carpentry work; planes [√tacch + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning does carpentry work; planes
Root Family √tacch
Root √tacch･1 a (cut, chop)
Base √tacch + a > taccha
Construction taccha + ti
Commentary (NIDD1a) vāsiyā taccheyyun'ti yadi ekaṃ bāhaṃ vaḍḍhakī vāsiyā tacchetvā tacchetvā tanuṃ kareyyuṃ.
Sanskrit takṣati
Sanskrit Root √takṣ √tvakṣ 1, 2, 5 (fashion)

Example

tena kho pana samayena samīti yānakāraputto rathassa nemiṃ tacchati. tam'enaṃ paṇḍuputto ājīvako purāṇayānakāraputto paccupaṭṭhito hoti.

Base √tacch + a > taccha
Construction taccha + ti
Sanskrit takṣati
Sanskrit Root √takṣ √tvakṣ 1, 2, 5 (fashion)

Example

tesaṃ āyasmā sāriputto iminā dhammapariyāyena hadayā hadayaṃ maññe aññāya tacchati.

taccheti

pr. (+acc) chops; cuts off; shapes with an axe [√tacch + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of tacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning chops; cuts off; shapes with an axe
Root Family √tacch
Root √tacch･1 *e (cut, chop)
Base √tacch + e > tacche (caus)
Construction tacche + ti
Sanskrit takṣayati
Sanskrit Root √takṣ √tvakṣ 1, 2, 5 (fashion)

Example

sākhāpalāsaṃ suvisodhitaṃ visodhetvā kuṭhārīhi taccheyya, kuṭhārīhi tacchetvā vāsīhi taccheyya, vāsīhi tacchetvā lekhaṇiyā likheyya, lekhaṇiyā likhitvā pāsāṇaguḷena dhoveyya, pāsāṇaguḷena dhovetvā nadiṃ patāreyya.

AN 4.196 sāḷhasuttaṃ
tacchetvā

abs. (+acc) having chopped; having cut off [√tacch + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of taccheti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having chopped; having cut off

Sanskrit takṣayitvā

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso yaṃ imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ tacchetvā ekajjhaṃ saṃhareyya, ekajjhaṃ saṃharitvā sūlaṃ kareyya

SN 56.36 pāṇasuttaṃ

sākhāpalāsaṃ suvisodhitaṃ visodhetvā kuṭhārīhi taccheyya, kuṭhārīhi tacchetvā vāsīhi taccheyya, vāsīhi tacchetvā lekhaṇiyā likheyya, lekhaṇiyā likhitvā pāsāṇaguḷena dhoveyya, pāsāṇaguḷena dhovetvā nadiṃ patāreyya.

tajja 1

adj. related to that; relevant; corresponding [tad + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ta
Meaning related to that; relevant; corresponding
Construction tad + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Sanskrit tadīya

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, ahosi te pubbe chando, ārāmaṃ gamissāmī'ti? tassa te ārāmagatassa yo tajjo chando so paṭippassaddho'ti? evaṃ, bho.

SN 51.15 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

katamo ca, bhikkhave, kāmānaṃ vipāko? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, kāmayamāno tajjaṃ tajjaṃ attabhāvaṃ abhinibbatteti puññabhāgiyaṃ vā apuññabhāgiyaṃ vā, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, kāmānaṃ vipāko.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
tajja 2

adj. suitable; appropriate; lit. related to that [tad + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ta
Meaning suitable; appropriate; lit. related to that
Construction tad + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Synonym anukūla, anucchavi, anucchavika, anurūpa, upiya, kappa, tathārūpa, tadanurūpa, paṭirūpa, patirūpa, patirūpī, pattayutta, yutta, yuttaka, yuttarūpa, sāmaggiya, sāruppa
Sanskrit tadīya

Example

anekehi sambhārehi samāraddhā vadati, seyyath'idaṃ, doṇiñ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca daṇḍañ'ca paṭicca upadhāraṇe ca paṭicca tantiyo ca paṭicca koṇañ'ca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjaṃ vāyāmaṃ paṭicca ev'āyaṃ, bhante, vīṇā nāma anekasambhārā mahāsambhārā.

tajjita 1

pp. (+instr) frightened (by); startled (by); in fear (of) [√tajj + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of tajjeti (+instr)
Meaning frightened (by); startled (by); in fear (of)
Root Family √tajj
Root √tajj･8 *e (frighten, threaten)
Construction √tajj + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym ubbigga, saṃvijita
Sanskrit tarjita
Sanskrit Root √tarj 1 (threaten)

Examples

yadā balākā sucipaṇḍaracchadā,
kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā,
palehiti ālayam'ālay'esinī,
tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti maṃ.

TH 196 sappakattheragāthā

mige anto paviṭṭhe dvāraṃ pidahiṃsu. migo manusse disvā kampamāno maraṇabhayatajjito antonivesanaṅgaṇe ādhāvati paridhāvati.

lok'āmis'ādhimuttassa kho, sunakkhatta, purisapuggalassa tappatirūpī c'eva kathā saṇṭhāti, tadanudhammañ'ca anuvitakketi, anuvicāreti, tañ'ca purisaṃ bhajati, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati

tañca 2

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning but that
Construction taṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit tam + ca

Example

ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ bhagavā etadavoca, api nu te, gahapati, kule dānaṃ dīyatī'ti? dīyati me, bhante, kule dānaṃ. tañ'ca kho lūkhaṃ kaṇājakaṃ biḷaṅgadutiyan'ti.

AN 9.20 velāmasuttaṃ

Meaning that and his

Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit tam + ca + asya

Examples

tañ'hi tassa sakaṃ hoti,
tañ'ca ādāya gacchati,
tañ'c'assa anugaṃ hoti,
chāyā'va anapāyinī.

yassa kassaci piḷandhanavikatiyā ākaṅkhati, yadi muddikāya yadi kuṇḍalāya yadi gīveyyakāya yadi suvaṇṇamālāya, tañ'c'assa atthaṃ anubhoti.

Meaning but that field; but that dimension

Sanskrit tam + ca + āyatana

Example

tadeva nāma cakkhuṃ bhavissati te rūpā tañ'c'āyatanaṃ no paṭisaṃvedissati. tadeva nāma sotaṃ bhavissati te saddā tañ'c'āyatanaṃ no paṭisaṃvedissati.

Sanskrit tam + ca + ayam

Example

upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

VIN PAT NP 7 tatuttarisikkhāpadaṃ

ñāṇavādañ'ca, āvuso, bhikkhu vadamāno bhāvanāvādañ'ca, jānām'imaṃ dhammaṃ, passām'imaṃ dhammaṃ, bhāvitakāyo'mhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño'ti. tañ'ce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho n'ābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati

Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit tam + ca + eva

Example

ahu kho me taṃ, āvuso sāriputta, pubbe aviddasuno pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ, idañ'ca pan'āyasmato sāriputtassa dhammadesanaṃ sutvā tañ'c'eva pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ pahīnaṃ, dhammo ca me abhisamito'ti.

taññeva

Meaning that very; the self same
Construction taṃ + eva
taññevettha

sandhi. in this regard; in this case; lit. that just here [taṃ + eva + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + adv
Meaning in this regard; in this case; lit. that just here
Construction taṃ + eva + ettha
Commentary (SNa) taññ'ev'ettha paṭibhātū'ti tuyh'ev'esā anusiṭṭhipakāsanā upaṭṭhātū'ti.
Sanskrit tam + eva + atra

Examples

ekam'antaṃ ṭhito kho kassapo devaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, bhikkhuṃ bhagavā pakāsesi, no ca bhikkhuno anusāsan'ti. tena hi kassapa, taññ'ev'ettha paṭibhātū'ti.

SN 2.1 paṭhamakassapasuttaṃ

tena hi, gahapati, taññ'ev'ettha paṭipucchissāmi, yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsi.

AN 3.73 ājīvakasuttaṃ
tañhi

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning that truly; that most certainly; that indeed
Construction taṃ + hi
Sanskrit tam + hi

Examples

atha ca pana tvaṃ, moghapurisa, attanā duggahitena amhe c'eva abbhācikkhasi, attānañ'ca khanasi, bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavasi. tañ'hi te, moghapurisa, bhavissati dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāyā'ti.

yaṃ na kayirā na taṃ vade,
akarontaṃ bhāsamānaṃ,
parijānanti paṇḍitā.

taṭataṭāyamāna

nt. tray, porringer ✗

PAT PK dhammayuttika-pubbakicca
taṇḍula 1

masc. dehusked rice; (comm) grain from grass ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning dehusked rice; (comm) grain from grass
Commentary (DNa) taṇḍulā'ti sāli'ādīnañ'c'eva tiṇajātīnañ'ca taṇḍulā.
Notes (MW) grain (after threshing and winnowing)
Sanskrit taṇḍula

Examples

tam'enaṃ cakkhumā puriso muñcitvā paccavekkheyya ime sālī ime vīhī ime muggā ime māsā ime tilā ime taṇḍulā'ti

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, muggehi yāpema ... tilehi yāpema ... taṇḍulehi yāpemā'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
taṇḍula 2

nt. dehusked rice [taṇḍula] ✗
taṇḍulacuṇṇa

nt. powdered rice [taṇḍula + cuṇṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning powdered rice
Construction taṇḍula + cuṇṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇḍula + cuṇṇa)
Sanskrit taṇḍula + cūrṇa

Example

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, muggehi yāpema ... tilehi yāpema ... taṇḍulehi yāpemā'ti. te taṇḍulam'pi khādanti, taṇḍulacuṇṇam'pi khādanti, taṇḍul'odakam'pi pivanti, anekavihitam'pi taṇḍulavikatiṃ paribhuñjanti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
taṇḍuladhovana

nt. rice rinsings; rice washing water [taṇḍula + dhovana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rice rinsings; rice washing water
Construction taṇḍula + dhovana
taṇḍulanāḷijātaka

nt. Jātaka 5 (JA 5) ✗
taṇḍulapaṭibhasta

nt. bag of rice grains; (comm) broken rice grains [taṇḍula + paṭibhasta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bag of rice grains; (comm) broken rice grains
Construction taṇḍula + paṭibhasta
Commentary (MNt) taṇḍulapaṭibhastānī'ti taṇḍulakhaṇḍāni. muggapaṭibhastakaḷāyapaṭibhastesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit taṇḍula + prati + bhastrā
taṇḍulapaṭhibasta

nt. bag of rice in return? ✗
taṇḍulapālidvāra

nt. (comm) name of one of the smaller entrance gates in Rājagaha; lit. rice row door; rice guard door [taṇḍulapāli + dvāra] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (comm) name of one of the smaller entrance gates in Rājagaha; lit. rice row door; rice guard door
Construction taṇḍulapāli + dvāra
Commentary (MNa) taṇḍulapālidvārāyā'ti rājagahassa kira dvattiṃsamahādvārāni catusaṭṭhikhuddakadvārāni, tesu ekaṃ taṇḍulapālidvāraṃ nāma, taṃ sandhāy'evam'āha.
taṇḍulapphala

adj. producing dehusked grain [taṇḍula + phala] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning producing dehusked grain
Construction taṇḍula + phala
Commentary (DNa) taṇḍulapphalo'ti suparisuddhaṃ paṇḍaraṃ taṇḍulam'eva phalati.
taṇḍulamuṭṭhi

masc. handful of rice ✗
taṇḍulavāhasata

nt. one hundred cartloads of dehusked rice [taṇḍula + vāha + sata] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one hundred cartloads of dehusked rice
Construction taṇḍula + vāha + sata
Commentary (MNa) taṇḍulavāhasatānī'ti ettha dve sakaṭāni eko vāho'ti veditabbo.
taṇḍulavikati

fem. rice preparation; rice concoction [taṇḍula + vikati] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning rice preparation; rice concoction
Construction taṇḍula + vikati
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇḍulānaṃ + vikati)
Sanskrit taṇḍula + vikṛti

Example

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, muggehi yāpema ... tilehi yāpema ... taṇḍulehi yāpemā'ti. te taṇḍulam'pi khādanti, taṇḍulacuṇṇam'pi khādanti, taṇḍul'odakam'pi pivanti, anekavihitam'pi taṇḍulavikatiṃ paribhuñjanti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
taṇḍulahoma

nt. rice oblation ✗
taṇḍulika

masc. rice-merchant [taṇḍula] ✗
taṇḍulodaka

nt. rice water [taṇḍula + udaka] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rice water
Construction taṇḍula + udaka
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇḍula + udaka)
Synonym odanakañjiya, kañjiya
Sanskrit taṇḍula + udaka

Example

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, muggehi yāpema ... tilehi yāpema ... taṇḍulehi yāpemā'ti. te taṇḍulam'pi khādanti, taṇḍulacuṇṇam'pi khādanti, taṇḍul'odakam'pi pivanti, anekavihitam'pi taṇḍulavikatiṃ paribhuñjanti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
taṇha

adj. (+dat or +loc) with craving (for); having desire (for); lit. with thirst [√tas + ṇhā + ā + a] ~

Grammar adj, from taṇhā (+dat or +loc)
Meaning with craving (for); having desire (for); lit. with thirst
Root Family √tas
Root √tas･6 ṇhā (thirst)
Base √tas + ṇhā > taṇhā
Construction taṇhā + ā + a
taṇhā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇaj
Sanskrit Root √tṛṣ 4 (be thirsty)
taṇhakkhaya

masc. wearing away of craving; depletion of desire; extinction of longing [taṇhā + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away of craving; depletion of desire; extinction of longing
Construction taṇhā + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇhāya + khaya)
Variant taṇhākkhaya
Commentary (SNa) taṇhakkhaye vimuttan'ti taṇhakkhayasaṅkhāte nibbāne tadārammaṇāya vimuttiyā vimuttaṃ.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇākṣaya

Examples

ime kho, āvuso, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvitā bahulīkatā taṇhakkhayāya saṃvattantī'ti

SN 52.7 taṇhakkhayasuttaṃ

ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
taṇhakkhayarata

adj. delighted with the wearing away of craving; taking pleasure in the depletion of desire [taṇhakkhaya + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning delighted with the wearing away of craving; taking pleasure in the depletion of desire
Construction taṇhakkhaya + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (taṇhakkhaye + rata)
Commentary (DHPa) taṇhakkhayarato'ti arahatte c'eva nibbāne ca abhirato hoti, taṃ patthayamāno viharati. (JAa) taṇhakkhayarato'ti nibbānarato. nibbānañ'hi āgamma taṇhā khīyati, tasmā taṃ taṇhakkhayo'ti vuccati. tattha rato hoti abhirato. sammāsambuddhasāvako'ti buddhassa savanante jāto bahussuto yogāvacarapuggalo.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇākṣaya + rata

Example

api dibbesu kāmesu,
ratiṃ so n'ādhigacchati,
taṇhakkhayarato hoti,
sammāsambuddhasāvako.

DHP14 buddhavaggo
taṇhakkhayavimutti 1

fem. liberation by wearing away of craving; release through depletion of desire; freedom by extinction of longing [taṇhā + khaya + vimutti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning liberation by wearing away of craving; release through depletion of desire; freedom by extinction of longing
Construction taṇhā + khaya + vimutti
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṇhakkhayena + vimutti)
Variant taṇhākkhayavimutti
Commentary (ITIa) taṇhakkhayavimuttino arahato
Sanskrit tṛṣṇākṣaya + vimukti

Example

yo vejayantapāsāde,
sakkaṃ so paripucchati,
api āvuso jānāsi,
taṇhakkhayavimuttiyo,
tassa sakko viyākāsi,
pañhaṃ puṭṭho yathātathaṃ.

TH 263 mahāmoggallānattheragāthā
taṇhakkhayavimutti 2

adj. who is liberated by the wearing away of craving; who is released through the depletion of desire; who is freed by the extinction of longing [taṇhakkhaya + vimutti] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is liberated by the wearing away of craving; who is released through the depletion of desire; who is freed by the extinction of longing
Construction taṇhakkhaya + vimutti
Commentary (ITIa) tato eva taṇhakkhayasaṅkhāte nibbāne vimuttattā taṇhakkhayavimuttino arahato.
taṇhakkhayasukha

nt. comfort from wearing away craving; pleasure of the depletion of desire; happiness from the extinction of longing [taṇhakkhaya + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning comfort from wearing away craving; pleasure of the depletion of desire; happiness from the extinction of longing
Construction taṇhakkhaya + sukha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇhakkhayassa + sukha)
Commentary (UDa) taṇhakkhayasukhassā'ti yaṃ āgamma taṇhā khīyati, taṃ nibbānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā taṇhāya ca paṭipassambhanavasena pavattaphalasamāpattisukhaṃ taṇhakkhayasukhaṃ nāma, tassa taṇhakkhayasukhassa.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇākṣaya + sukha

Example

yañ'ca kāmasukhaṃ loke,
yañ'c'idaṃ diviyaṃ sukhaṃ,
taṇhakkhayasukhass'ete,
kalaṃ n'āgghanti soḷasin'ti.

UD12 rājasuttaṃ
taṇhakkhayasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.26 (SN46.26) ✗
taṇhakkhayasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 52.7 (SN52.7) ✗
taṇhakkhayādhimutta

adj. habituated to the destruction of craving; established in desirelessness; firmly entrenched in the extinction of longing [taṇhā + khaya + adhimutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning habituated to the destruction of craving; established in desirelessness; firmly entrenched in the extinction of longing
Construction taṇhā + khaya + adhimutta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (taṇhakkhayaṃ + adhimutta)
Variant taṇhākkhayādhimutta
Sanskrit tṛṣṇākṣaya + adhimukta

Example

taṇhakkhay'ādhimuttassa,
asammohañ'ca cetaso,
disvā āyatan'uppādaṃ,
sammā cittaṃ vimuccati.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā
taṇhagata

adj. (+loc) obsessed with craving (for); immersed in craving (for); lit. craving gone [taṇhā + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning obsessed with craving (for); immersed in craving (for); lit. craving gone
Construction taṇhā + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (taṇhaṃ + gata)
Commentary (SNPa) taṇhagatan'ti taṇhāya gataṃ abhibhūtaṃ, nipātitan'ti adhippāyo.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + gata

Example

passāmi loke pariphandamānaṃ,
pajaṃ imaṃ taṇhagataṃ bhavesu,
hīnā narā maccumukhe lapanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
taṇhacchida

adj. who has cut craving [taṇhā + chida] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has cut craving
Construction taṇhā + chida
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (taṇhaṃ + chida)
Commentary (NIDD2) taṇhacchidan'ti. taṇhā'ti rūpataṇhā … dhammataṇhā. sā taṇhā buddhassa bhagavato chinnā ucchinnā samucchinnā vūpasantā paṭippassaddhā abhabbuppattikā ñāṇagginā daḍḍhā. tasmā buddho taṇhacchido.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + chida

Example

taṇhacchidassa buddhassa,
vītadhūmassa anupalittassa,
āhuneyyassa yakkhassa,
uttamapuggalassa atulassa,
mahato yas'aggapattassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmī'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
taṇhadhipanna

adj. in the power of, assailed by, craving ✗
taṇhamabbuyha

sandhi. uprooting desire; pulling out craving [taṇhaṃ + abbuyha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, fem + ger
Meaning uprooting desire; pulling out craving
Construction taṇhaṃ + abbuyha
Sanskrit tṛṣṇām + āvṛhya

Examples

nikkhipitvā garuṃ bhāraṃ,
aññaṃ bhāraṃ anādiya,
samūlaṃ taṇham'abbuyha,
nicchāto parinibbuto'ti.

SN 22.22 bhārasuttaṃ

chetvā naddhiṃ varattañ'ca,
icchā lobhañ'ca pāpakaṃ,
samūlaṃ taṇham'abbuyha,
evaṃ yātrā bhavissatī'ti.

SN 1.29 catucakkasuttaṃ
taṇhasaṃyojana

nt. fatter of craving ✗
taṇhā arati ragā

idiom. names of the three daughters of Death; lit. craving, non-delight and lust ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + fem + fem
Meaning names of the three daughters of Death; lit. craving, non-delight and lust
Variant taṇhā arati rāgā
Commentary (DHPa) athassa taṇhā aratī ragā'ti imā tisso dhītaro
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + arati + rāgā

Examples

disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca,
n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ,
kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ,
pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

atha kho taṇhā ca arati ca ragā ca māradhītaro yena māro pāpimā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu.

SN 4.25 māradhītusuttaṃ
taṇhā 1

fem. (+dat or +loc) craving (for); wanting; desire (for); lit. thirst [√tas + ṇhā + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from tasati (+dat or +loc)
Meaning craving (for); wanting; desire (for); lit. thirst
Root Family √tas
Root √tas･6 ṇhā (thirst)
Base √tas + ṇhā > taṇhā
Construction taṇhā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Synonym tasiṇā, tasinā
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā
Sanskrit Root √tṛṣ 4 (be thirsty)

Examples

nandisaṃyojano loko,
vitakkassa vicāraṇaṃ,
taṇhāya vippahānena,
nibbānaṃ iti vuccati.

SNP 68 udaya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 13

evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, phasso kho, āvuso, eko anto, phassasamudayo dutiyo anto, phassanirodho majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.

Example

bālo puttataṇhāya c'eva dhanataṇhāya ca haññati vihaññati dukkhayati

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

atha kho taṇhā ca arati ca ragā ca māradhītaro yena māro pāpimā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu.

SN 4.25 māradhītusuttaṃ
taṇhā 4

fem. thirst [√tas + ṇhā + ā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from tasati
Meaning thirst
Root Family √tas
Root √tas･6 ṇhā (thirst)
Base √tas + ṇhā > taṇhā
Construction taṇhā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Synonym pipāsā
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā
Sanskrit Root √tṛṣ 4 (be thirsty)
taṇhākāya

masc. group of cravings ✗
taṇhākāyā

masc. classes of craving; categories of desire [taṇhā + kāya + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning classes of craving; categories of desire
Construction taṇhā + kāya + ā
taṇhākāya + ā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇhānaṃ + kāyā)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + kāya

Example

katamā ca, bhikkhave, taṇhā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, taṇhākāyā, rūpataṇhā, saddataṇhā, gandhataṇhā, rasataṇhā, phoṭṭhabbataṇhā, dhammataṇhā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, taṇhā.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
taṇhākkhaya

masc. wearing away of craving; depletion of desire; extinction of longing [taṇhā + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away of craving; depletion of desire; extinction of longing
Construction taṇhā + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇhāya + khaya)
Variant taṇhakkhaya
Sanskrit tṛṣṇākṣaya

Examples

etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānan'ti

MN 64 mahāmālukyasuttaṃ

sabb'ābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ,
sabbesu dhammesu anūpalittaṃ,
sabbañ'jahaṃ taṇhākkhaye vimuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ naraṃ ekavihārī'ti brūmī'ti.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ
taṇhākkhayagāmī

adj. leading to the depletion of desire; going to the extinction of craving [taṇhākkhaya + gāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the depletion of desire; going to the extinction of craving
Construction taṇhākkhaya + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (taṇhākkhayaṃ + gāmī)
Commentary (SNa) taṇhākkhayassa paccayattā taṇhakkhayaṃ.
taṇhākkhayavimutti

fem. liberation by wearing away of craving; release through depletion of desire; freedom by extinction of longing [taṇhā + khaya + vimutti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning liberation by wearing away of craving; release through depletion of desire; freedom by extinction of longing
Construction taṇhā + khaya + vimutti
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṇhākkhayena + vimutti)
Variant taṇhakkhayavimutti
Sanskrit tṛṣṇākṣaya + vimukti

Example

yo vejayantapāsāde,
sakkaṃ so paripucchati,
api vāsava jānāsi,
taṇhākkhayavimuttiyo,
tassa sakko viyākāsi,
pañhaṃ puṭṭho yathātathaṃ.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
taṇhākkhayavimuttī

adj. freed by the wearing away of craving; liberated by the depletion of desire; released by the extinction of longing [taṇhākkhaya + vimuttī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning freed by the wearing away of craving; liberated by the depletion of desire; released by the extinction of longing
Construction taṇhākkhaya + vimuttī
Commentary (ANa) taṇhākkhayavimuttino'ti taṇhākkhayavimuttisaṅkhātāya arahattaphalavimuttiyā samannāgatassa.
taṇhākkhayasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 52.7 (SN52.7) ✗
taṇhākkhayādhimutta

adj. habituated to the destruction of craving; established in desirelessness; firmly entrenched in extinction of longing [taṇhākkhaya + adhimutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning habituated to the destruction of craving; established in desirelessness; firmly entrenched in extinction of longing
Construction taṇhākkhaya + adhimutta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (taṇhākkhayaṃ + adhimutta)
Variant taṇhakkhayādhimutta
Commentary (ANa) taṇhākkhayante uppannattā taṇhākkhayo
Sanskrit tṛṣṇākṣaya + adhimukta

Example

so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti, nekkhamm'ādhimutto hoti, pavivek'ādhimutto hoti, abyāpajj'ādhimutto hoti, taṇhākkhay'ādhimutto hoti, upādānakkhay'ādhimutto hoti, asammoh'ādhimutto hoti.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
taṇhāgata 1

adj. under the influence of craving ✗
taṇhāgata 2

nt. sort of craving ✗
taṇhāchanda

masc. desire; craving ✗
taṇhājatika

adj. born from craving ✗
taṇhājātika

adj. born from craving [taṇhā + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from craving
Construction taṇhā + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇhā + jātika)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + jātīya

Examples

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro upādānā. kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro upādānā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro āhārā kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro āhārā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
taṇhājāla

nt. net of craving; snare of desire [taṇhā + jāla] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning net of craving; snare of desire
Construction taṇhā + jāla
taṇhādāsa

adj. enslaved by craving; being a slave of desire [taṇhā + dāsa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enslaved by craving; being a slave of desire
Construction taṇhā + dāsa
Commentary (MNa) taṇhādāso'ti taṇhāya dāso.
taṇhādāsabya

nt. slavery to craving [taṇhā + dāsabya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning slavery to craving
Construction taṇhā + dāsabya
taṇhādiṭṭhi

fem. desire and view; craving and belief [taṇhā + diṭṭhi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning desire and view; craving and belief
Construction taṇhā + diṭṭhi
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + dṛṣṭi
taṇhādiṭṭhilepa

masc. stain of craving and view ✗
taṇhādutiya

adj. with craving as companion; accompanied by desire [taṇhā + dutiya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with craving as companion; accompanied by desire
Construction taṇhā + dutiya
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇhā + dutiya)
Commentary (ANa) taṇhādutiyo'ti ayañ'hi satto anamatagge saṃsāravaṭṭe saṃsaranto na ekako'va saṃsarati, taṇhaṃ pana dutiyikaṃ labhanto'va saṃsarati. tena vuttaṃ, taṇhādutiyo'ti.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + dvitīya

Example

taṇhādutiyo puriso,
dīgham'addhāna saṃsaraṃ,
itthabhāv'aññathābhāvaṃ,
saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
taṇhādosa

adj. spoiled by craving; ruined by desire; corrupted by craving [taṇhā + dosa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning spoiled by craving; ruined by desire; corrupted by craving
Construction taṇhā + dosa
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇhā eva dosa)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + doṣa

Example

tiṇadosāni khettāni,
taṇhādosā ayaṃ pajā.
tasmā hi vītataṇhesu,
dinnaṃ hoti mahapphalaṃ.

DHP 359 taṇhāvaggo
taṇhādhipateyya

adj. overpowered by craving; dominated by desire [taṇhā + adhipateyya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning overpowered by craving; dominated by desire
Construction taṇhā + adhipateyya
Commentary (NIDD1a) taṇh'ādhipateyyo'ti chand'ādhipativasena, taṇhā adhipatito āgatā'ti vā taṇh'ādhipateyyo, taṇh'ādhipati vā etassa atthī'ti taṇh'ādhipateyyo.
taṇhādhipanna

adj. slave to craving; overpowered by craving; victim of desire [taṇhā + adhipanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning slave to craving; overpowered by craving; victim of desire
Construction taṇhā + adhipanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṇhāya + adhipanna)
Commentary (ANa) taṇhādhipannā'ti taṇhāya adhipannā ajjhotthaṭā, taṇhaṃ vā adhipannā ajjhogāḷhā.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + abhipanna

Examples

ye keci kāmesu asaññatā janā,
avītarāgā idha kāmabhogino,
punappunaṃ jātijar'ūpagāmi te,
taṇh'ādhipannā anusotagāmino.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ

taṇh'ādhipanne manuje pekkhamāno,
santāpajāte jarasā parete,
tasmā tuvaṃ piṅgiya appamatto,
jahassu taṇhaṃ apunabbhavāyā'ti.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16
taṇhānigghātana

nt. destruction of craving, crushing of desire ✗
taṇhānidāna

adj. having craving as origin [taṇhā + nidāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having craving as origin
Construction taṇhā + nidāna
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇhā + nidāna)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + nidāna

Examples

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro upādānā. kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro upādānā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro āhārā kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro āhārā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
taṇhānirodha

masc. ending of craving; cessation of desire [taṇhā + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of craving; cessation of desire
Construction taṇhā + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇhāya + nirodha)
Commentary (MNa) taṇhānirodhā'ti taṇhāya khayanirodhena.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + nirodha

Examples

channaṃ tv'eva, phagguna, phass'āyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā phassanirodho, phassanirodhā vedanānirodho, vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ

kathaṃ pan'āvuso, āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti na hotī'ti? avijjāvirāgā kho, āvuso, vijj'uppādā taṇhānirodhā, evaṃ āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti na hotī'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
taṇhānirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the ending of craving; leading to the cessation of desire [taṇhānirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the ending of craving; leading to the cessation of desire
Construction taṇhānirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (taṇhānirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + nirodha + gāmin

Example

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako taṇhañ'ca pajānāti, taṇhāsamudayañ'ca pajānāti, taṇhānirodhañ'ca pajānāti, taṇhānirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
taṇhānirodhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.27 (SN46.27) ✗
taṇhānusaya

masc. underlying tendency towards craving; dormant desire; lit. thirst sleeping alongside [taṇhā + anusaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning underlying tendency towards craving; dormant desire; lit. thirst sleeping alongside
Construction taṇhā + anusaya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (taṇhāya + anusaya)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + anuśaya

Example

yathā'pi mūle anupaddave daḷhe,
chinno'pi rukkho puna'r'eva rūhati,
evam'pi taṇh'ānusaye anūhate,
nibbattatī dukkham'idaṃ punappunaṃ.

DHP 338 taṇhāvaggo
taṇhāpaccaya

adj. caused by craving ✗
taṇhāpaccayā

ind. dependent on craving; due to desire; lit. from condition of thirst [taṇhā + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of taṇhāpaccaya
Meaning dependent on craving; due to desire; lit. from condition of thirst
Construction taṇhā + paccaya + ā
taṇhāpaccaya + ā
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + pratyayāt

Examples

evaṃ maṃ avadantaṃ yo evaṃ puccheyya, kiṃpaccayā nu kho, bhante, taṇhā'ti, esa kallo pañho. tatra kallaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ, vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ

vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
taṇhāpañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 38.10 (SN38.10) ✗
taṇhāpabhava

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning produced by craving; generated by desire
Construction taṇhā + pabhava
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇhā + pabhava)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + prabhava

Examples

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro upādānā. kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro upādānā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro āhārā kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro āhārā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
taṇhāpīti

fem. delight of craving [taṇhā + pīti] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning delight of craving
Construction taṇhā + pīti
taṇhābhavaparikkhīṇa

adj. exhausted craving for becoming; consumed craving for existence [taṇhā + bhava + parikkhīṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning exhausted craving for becoming; consumed craving for existence
Construction taṇhā + bhava + parikkhīṇa
Commentary (SNPa) yo idha loke chadvārikaṃ taṇhaṃ jahitvā ghar'āvāsena anatthiko anāgāro hutvā paribbajati, taṇhāya c'eva bhavassa ca parikkhīṇattā taṇhābhavaparikkhīṇaṃ tam'ahaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ vadāmī'ti attho.
taṇhābhibhūta

adj. overcome by thirst; thirsty [taṇhā + abhibhūta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning overcome by thirst; thirsty
Construction taṇhā + abhibhūta
Commentary (VISMa) taṇhāya samādhissa ujupaṭipakkhattā sā samathapaṭipadāya paripanthinī'ti āha taṇh'ābhibhūtassa hi dukkhā paṭipadā hotī'ti.
taṇhāmānadiṭṭhi

fem. craving, comparing and belief; desire, conceit and view [taṇhā + māna + diṭṭhi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning craving, comparing and belief; desire, conceit and view
Construction taṇhā + māna + diṭṭhi
taṇhāmānadiṭṭhivasena

ind. due to craving, conceit and belief [taṇhā + māna + diṭṭhi + vasena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to craving, conceit and belief
Construction taṇhā + māna + diṭṭhi + vasena
taṇhāmūlaka

adj. having craving as its root ✗
taṇhāmūlakasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.23 (AN9.23) ✗
taṇhāyati

pr. (denominative from taṇhā) thirsts, has a craving [√tas] ✗
taṇhārata

adj. taking pleasure in craving; delighting in desire [taṇhā + rata] ~

Grammar adj, comp

taṇhārāma

adj. enjoying craving; taking pleasure in desire [taṇhā + ārāma] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enjoying craving; taking pleasure in desire
Construction taṇhā + ārāma
taṇhālatā

fem. creeper of craving; tendrils of desire [taṇhā + latā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning creeper of craving; tendrils of desire
Construction taṇhā + latā
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇhā + latā)
Commentary (THa) taṇhālataṃ ... taṇhāsaṅkhātalataṃ.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + latā

Example

kadā nu'haṃ bhayajananiṃ dukh'āvahaṃ,
taṇhālataṃ bahuvidh'ānuvattaniṃ,
paññāmayaṃ tikhiṇam'asiṃ gahetvā,
chetvā vase tam'pi kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
taṇhālepa

masc. coating of craving; smear of lust ✗
taṇhālepādi

nt. coating of craving, etc. ✗
taṇhāvagga

masc. Chapter 24 of the Dhammapada (DHP 24) ✗
taṇhāvicarita

nt. roaming about of craving; activity of desire [taṇhā + vicarita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning roaming about of craving; activity of desire
Construction taṇhā + vicarita
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇhāya + vicarita)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + vicarita

Example

aṭṭhārasa kho pan'imāni, bhikkhave, taṇhāvicaritāni ajjhattikassa upādāya, aṭṭhārasa taṇhāvicaritāni bāhirassa upādāya.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
taṇhāvicaritadhamma

masc. characteristic of wandering craving [taṇhāvicarita + dhamma] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning characteristic of wandering craving
Construction taṇhāvicarita + dhamma
taṇhāvicaritavasena

ind. due to roaming about of craving; due to wandering desire [taṇhā + vicarita + vasena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to roaming about of craving; due to wandering desire
Construction taṇhā + vicarita + vasena
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + vicarita + vaśena
taṇhāsaṅkhaya

masc. extinction of craving; destruction of craving [taṇhā + saṅkhaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning extinction of craving; destruction of craving
Construction taṇhā + saṅkhaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇhāya + saṅkhaya)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + saṃkṣaya

Examples

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā aññāsikoṇḍañño bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ paccavekkhamāno.

UD 66 taṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ

kittāvatā nu kho bhante bhikkhu saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutta

adj. liberated through the extinction of craving [taṇhāsaṅkhaya + vimutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning liberated through the extinction of craving
Construction taṇhāsaṅkhaya + vimutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṇhāsaṅkhayena + vimutta)
Commentary (ANa) taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hotī'ti taṇhāsaṅkhaye nibbāne taṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā vimuttacittatāya taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto nāma saṃkhittena kittāvatā hoti. yāya paṭipattiyā taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti, tam'eva khīṇ'āsavassa bhikkhuno pubbabhāgapaṭipadaṃ saṃkhittena desethā'ti pucchati.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + saṃkṣaya + vimukta

Example

kittāvatā nu kho bhante bhikkhu saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutti

fem. liberation through the extinction of craving [taṇhāsaṅkhaya + vimutti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning liberation through the extinction of craving
Construction taṇhāsaṅkhaya + vimutti
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṇhāsaṅkhayena + vimutti)
Commentary (MNa) imaṃ kho me tumhe, bhikkhave, saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ dhārethā'ti, bhikkhave, imaṃ saṃkhittena desitaṃ mayhaṃ, taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttidesanaṃ tumhe niccakālaṃ dhāreyyātha mā pamajjeyyātha. desanā hi ettha vimuttipaṭilābhahetuto vimuttī'ti vuttā.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + saṃkṣaya + vimukti

Examples

yathā kathaṃ pana kho, kosiya, bhagavā saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ abhāsi? sādhu mayam'pi etissā kathāya bhāgino assāma savanāyā'ti.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ

imaṃ kho me tumhe, bhikkhave, saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ dhāretha, sātiṃ pana bhikkhuṃ kevaṭṭaputtaṃ mahātaṇhājālataṇhāsaṅghāṭappaṭimukkan'ti.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
taṇhāsaṅkhayasutta

nt. Udāna 66 (UD 66) ✗
taṇhāsama

adj. like craving; equal to desire [taṇhā + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like craving; equal to desire
Construction taṇhā + sama
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṇhāya + sama)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + sama

Example

n'atthi rāgasamo aggi,
n'atthi dosasamo gaho,
n'atthi mohasamaṃ jālaṃ,
n'atthi taṇhāsamā nadī.

DHP 251 malavaggo
taṇhāsamudaya 1

masc. source of craving; arising of desire [taṇhā + samudaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of craving; arising of desire
Construction taṇhā + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇhāya + samudaya)
Antonym taṇhānirodha
Commentary (MNa) taṇhāsamudayā āhārasamudayo'ti purimataṇhāsamudayā paṭisandhikānaṃ āhārānaṃ samudayo nibbatto hotī'ti attho.
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + samudaya

Example

taṇhāsamudayā āhārasamudayo, taṇhānirodhā āhāranirodho, ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo āhāranirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyath'idaṃ, sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto, sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
taṇhāsamudaya 2

adj. having craving as source; arising from desire [taṇhā + samudaya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having craving as source; arising from desire
Construction taṇhā + samudaya
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (taṇhāya + samudaya)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + samudaya

Examples

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro upādānā. kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro upādānā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ

ime ca, bhikkhave, cattāro āhārā kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā? ime cattāro āhārā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
taṇhāsambhūta

adj. produced by craving; proceeding from craving [taṇhā + sambhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning produced by craving; proceeding from craving
Construction taṇhā + sambhūta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṇhāya + sambhūta)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + sambhūta

Example

āhārasambhūto ayaṃ, bhagini, kāyo āhāraṃ nissāya āhāro pahātabbo. taṇhāsambhūto ayaṃ, bhagini, kāyo taṇhaṃ nissāya taṇhā pahātabbā.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ
taṇhāsammudita

adj. finding joy in craving ✗
taṇhāsalla

nt. arrow of craving; dart of desire [taṇhā + salla] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning arrow of craving; dart of desire
Construction taṇhā + salla
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇhā + salla)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + śalya

Examples

taṃ me taṇhāsallaṃ pahīnaṃ, apanīto avijjāvisadoso, sammā nibbān'ādhimutto'ham'asmī'ti.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

maccun'ābbhāhato loko,
jarāya parivārito.
taṇhāsallena otiṇṇo,
icchādhūpāyito sadā'ti.

SN 1.66 attahatasuttaṃ
taṇhāsaṃyojana

adj. fettered by craving; bound by desire [taṇhā + saṃyojana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning fettered by craving; bound by desire
Construction taṇhā + saṃyojana
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṇhāya + saṃyojana)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + saṃyojana

Examples

iti kho, ānanda, kammaṃ khettaṃ, viññāṇaṃ bījaṃ, taṇhā sneho. avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ hīnāya dhātuyā viññāṇaṃ patiṭṭhitaṃ evaṃ āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti hoti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ

pubbā koṭi na paññāyati avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ.

SN 48.50 āpaṇasuttaṃ
taṇhāsaṃyojanasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 15 (ITI 15) ✗
taṇhāsutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.63 (SN1.63) ✗
taṇhāsutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 18.8 (SN18.8) ✗
taṇhāsutta 3

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 26.8 (SN26.8) ✗
taṇhāsutta 4

taṇhāsutta 5

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.170 (SN45.170) ✗
taṇhāsutta 6

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.199 (AN4.199) ✗
taṇhāsutta 7

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.106 (AN6.106) ✗
taṇhāsutta 8

nt. Itivuttaka 58 (ITI 58) ✗
taṇhāsota

masc. current of craving; stream of desire [taṇhā + sota] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning current of craving; stream of desire
Construction taṇhā + sota
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (taṇhāya + sota)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + srotas

Example

diṭṭhibandhanabaddhā te,
taṇhāsotena vuyhare,
taṇhāsotena vuyhantā,
na te dukkhā pamuccare.

VISM 2.19 paccayapariggaha kathā
taṇhīyati

pr. has thirst for [√tas] ✗
taṇhupādinna

adj. grasped with craving; clung to by desire [taṇhā + upādinna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning grasped with craving; clung to by desire
Construction taṇhā + upādinna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṇhāya + upādinna)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + upādā

Example

kiṃ pan'imassa mattaṭṭhakassa kāyassa taṇh'upādinnassa ahan'ti vā maman'ti vā asmī'ti vā? atha khv'āssa no't'ev'ettha hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
taṇhuppāda

adj. giving rise to craving [taṇhā + uppāda] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning giving rise to craving
Construction taṇhā + uppāda
taṇhuppādasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.9 (AN4.9) ✗
taṇhuppādasutta 2

nt. Itivuttaka 105 (ITI 105) ✗
taṇhūpanisa

adj. with craving as pre-condition [taṇhā + upanisa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with craving as pre-condition
Construction taṇhā + upanisa
taṇhūpādāna

adj. having craving as fuel; fuelled by desire [taṇhā + upādāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having craving as fuel; fuelled by desire
Construction taṇhā + upādāna
Compound kammadhāraya (taṇhā eva upādāna)
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā + upādāna

Example

yasmiṃ kho, vaccha, samaye imañ'ca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, satto ca aññataraṃ kāyaṃ anupapanno hoti, tam'ahaṃ taṇh'ūpādānaṃ vadāmi. taṇhā hi'ssa, vaccha, tasmiṃ samaye upādānaṃ hotī'ti.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
tata

pp. spread out; extended; expanded [√tan + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of tanoti
Meaning spread out; extended; expanded
Root Family √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction √tan + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change nt > t
Synonym patthaṭa
Sanskrit tata
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Example

iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
tatiya 1.1

ordin. third (3rd) [ti + tiya] ✓

Grammar ordin of ti
Meaning third (3rd)
Construction ti > ta + tiya
Derivative taddhita (tiya)
Phonetic Change i > a
Variant tatiyā, tatīya
English Cognate third
Sanskrit tṛtīya

Examples

ambho purisa na tvaṃ addasa manussesu tatiyaṃ devadūtaṃ pātubhūtan'ti? so evam'āha nāddasaṃ bhante'ti

AN 3.36 devadūtasuttaṃ

so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
tatiya 1.2

masc. (gram) third consonant of each vagga; g, j, ḍ, d, b [ti + tiya] ✓

Grammar masc, from ti
Meaning (gram) third consonant of each vagga; g, j, ḍ, d, b
Construction ti > ta + tiya
Derivative taddhita (tiya)
Phonetic Change i > a
Variant tathiya, taccha
English Cognate third
Sanskrit tṛtīya

Examples

461, 464. dutiyacatutthānaṃ paṭhamatatiyā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 461

abbhāsagatānaṃ dutiyacatutthānaṃ paṭhamatatiyā honti. ciccheda, bubhukkhati, babhūva, dadhāti.

tatiyakaṃ

ind. occurring for the third time [ti + tiya + ka + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, in comps, from tatiya
Meaning occurring for the third time
Construction ti > ta + tiya + ka + aṃ
tatiyaka + aṃ
Phonetic Change i > a
Sanskrit tṛtīyaka

Example

no ce aggiṃ paricareyyāsi, pañjaliko ādiccaṃ namasseyyāsi. no ce pañjaliko ādiccaṃ namasseyyāsi, sāyatatiyakaṃ udakaṃ oroheyyāsī'ti

tatiyakukkuṭārāmasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.20 (SN45.20) ✗

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.57 (SN1.57) ✗
tatiyajjhāna

nt. third stage of meditation [tatiya + jhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning third stage of meditation
Construction tatiya + jhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (tatiya + jhāna)
Sanskrit tṛtīya + dhyāna

Examples

atha kho bhagavā paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajji, paṭhamajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajji, dutiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajji, tatiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā catutthaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajji.

DN 16.37 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi tatiyajjhānasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū tatiyajjhānasamāpattiyā na lābhino'ti. so tāya tatiyajjhānasamāpattiyā attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
tatiyajjhānasamāpatti

fem. attainment of the third stage of meditation [tatiya + jhāna + samāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning attainment of the third stage of meditation
Construction tatiya + jhāna + samāpatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tatiyajjhānassa + samāpatti)
Sanskrit tṛtīya + dhyāna + samāpatti

Example

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi tatiyajjhānasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū tatiyajjhānasamāpattiyā na lābhino'ti. so tāya tatiyajjhānasamāpattiyā attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

tatiyampi

sandhi. for the third time [tatiyaṃ + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning for the third time
Construction tatiyaṃ + api
Sanskrit tṛtīyam + api

Examples

tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante pacchime yāme, uddhaste aruṇe, nandimukhiyā rattiyā uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.19 (AN5.19) ✗
tatiyaṃ

ind. third time [ti + tiya + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of tatiya
Meaning third time
Construction ti > ta + tiya + aṃ
tatiya + aṃ
Phonetic Change i > a
English Cognate third
Sanskrit tṛtīyam

Examples

tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante pacchime yāme, uddhaste aruṇe, nandimukhiyā rattiyā uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ
tatiyā 1

ordin. third (3rd) [ti + tiya + ā] ✓

Grammar ordin, fem nom sg and pl of tatiya
Meaning third (3rd)
Construction ti > ta + tiya + ā
tatiya + ā
Phonetic Change i > a
Variant tatiya, tatīya
Sanskrit tṛtīyā, tṛtīyāḥ

Example

kabaḷīṅkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
tatiyā 2

fem. (gram) instrumental case ✗
tatiyāgatisutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.19 (AN4.19) ✗
tatiyātappurisa

masc. (gram) case compound in the instrumental case ✗
tatiyādhammasutta 1

tatiyānattasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.145 (SN22.145) ✗
tatiyānāgatabhayasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.79 (AN5.79) ✗
tatiyāniccasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.139 (SN22.139) ✗
tatiyānudhammasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.41 (SN22.41) ✗
tatiyābhabbaṭṭhānasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.94 (AN6.94) ✗
tatiyābhinibbhidā

fem. third break-through [tatiyā + abhinibbhidā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning third break-through
Construction tatiyā + abhinibbhidā
Compound kammadhāraya (tatiyā + abhinibbhidā)
Notes see paṭhamābhinibbhidā
Sanskrit tṛtīya + abhinirbheda

Example

ayam'assa tatiy'ābhinibbhidā hoti kukkuṭacchāpakass'eva aṇḍakosamhā.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
tatiyābhisandasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 55.43 (SN55.43) ✗
tatiyāvaṇṇārahasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.238 (AN5.238) ✗
tatiyāvibhatti

fem. (gram) declension of the instrumental case; lit. third declension [tatiyā + vibhatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning (gram) declension of the instrumental case; lit. third declension
Construction tatiyā + vibhatti
Compound kammadhāraya (tatiyā + vibhatti)
Sanskrit tṛtīyā + vibhakti

Example

kattari ca tatiyāvibhatti hoti.

kaccāyana kārakakappa 288
tatiyāssādasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.28 (SN22.28) ✗
tatīya

ordin. third (3rd) [ti + tiya] ✓

Grammar ordin of ti
Meaning third (3rd)
Construction ti > ta + tiya
Derivative taddhita (tiya)
Phonetic Change i > a
with metrically lengthened ī
Variant tatiya, tatiyā
Sanskrit tṛtīya

Example

cattāri ṭhānāni naro pamatto,
āpajjati paradār'ūpasevī,
apuññalābhaṃ na nikāmaseyyaṃ,
nindaṃ tatīyaṃ nirayaṃ catutthaṃ.

DHP 309 nirayavaggo
tatuṭṭhāya

ger. arising from that; appearing from that [tato + uṭṭhāya] ✓

Grammar ger, comp vb
Meaning arising from that; appearing from that
Construction tato + uṭṭhāya
Variant taduṭṭhāya
Sanskrit tatas + utthāya

Example

ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sāni kammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.

DHP 240 malavaggo
tatuttari 1

ind. more than that [tato + uttari] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning more than that
Construction tato + uttari
Antonym natatuttari
Variant tatuttariṃ, taduttari
Commentary (VVt) tato catumāsato uttari atirekaṃ tatuttari, tatuttari na hotī'ti natatuttari, natatuttarī'ti saññā assa atthī'ti natatuttarisaññī
Sanskrit tatas + uttarin

Examples

tato ce uttari sādiyeyyā'ti tat'uttari viññāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṃ. paṭilābhena nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.1.7 tatuttarisikkhāpadaṃ

tato ce uttari paṭigaṇheyyā'ti tat'uttari paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.4.4 kāṇamātusikkhāpadaṃ
tatuttari 2

ind. higher than that; greater than that [tato + uttari] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning higher than that; greater than that
Construction tato + uttari
Variant tatuttariṃ, taduttari
Sanskrit tatas + uttarin

Example

puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, ariyasāvako devat'ānussatiṃ bhāveti, santi devā cātumahārājikā, santi devā tāvatiṃsā, santi devā yāmā, santi devā tusitā, santi devā nimmānaratino, santi devā paranimmitavasavattino, santi devā brahmakāyikā, santi devā tat'uttari.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
tatuttaritā

fem. being more than that; excess ✗
tatuttarisaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as more than that [tatuttari + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as more than that
Construction tatuttari + saññī
Commentary (VVt) tato catumāsato uttari atirekaṃ tatuttari, tatuttari na hotī'ti natatuttari, natatuttarī'ti saññā assa atthī'ti natatuttarisaññī
tatuttarisikkhāpada

nt. rule about (taking) more (robes) than that; Nissaggiya 7 [tatuttari + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about (taking) more (robes) than that; Nissaggiya 7
Construction tatuttari + sikkhāpada
tatuttariṃ

ind. more than that [tato + uttari + iṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning more than that
Construction tato + uttari + iṃ
tatuttari + iṃ
Variant tatuttari, taduttari
Commentary (THa) tat'uttarin'ti tato tayato upari
Sanskrit tatas + uttarin

Example

yathā brahmā tathā eko,
yathā devo tathā duve,
yathā gāmo tathā tayo,
kolāhalaṃ tat'uttarin'ti.

TH 178 yasojattheragāthā
tato aparena samayena

idiom. then at another time; later; lit. with another time from that ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + adj + masc
Meaning then at another time; later; lit. with another time from that
Commentary (VIN 1.2.8) tato aparena samayenā'ti yasmiṃ khaṇe anuddhaṃsito hoti taṃ khaṇaṃ taṃ layaṃ taṃ muhuttaṃ vītivatte.

Examples

tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā āpanno visuddh'āpekkho evaṃ vadeyya ajānam'evaṃ āvuso avacaṃ jānāmi, apassaṃ passāmi

VIN PAT PA 4 uttarimanussadhammasikkhāpadaṃ

tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā amūlakañ'c'eva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti, bhikkhu ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 8 duṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
tato amutra

idiom. step by step; stage by stage; lit. from there to there ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + adv
Meaning step by step; stage by stage; lit. from there to there
Sanskrit tatas + amutra

Example

yato kho, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu idha sakasaññī hoti, so tato amutra tato amutra anupubbena saññ'aggaṃ phusati. tassa saññ'agge ṭhitassa evaṃ hoti, cetayamānassa me pāpiyo, acetayamānassa me seyyo.

DN 9.3 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, sahetukasaññuppādanirodhakathā
tato 1

pron. from that; therefrom; from him [ta + to] ✓

Grammar pron, abl sg of ta
Meaning from that; therefrom; from him
Construction ta + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Sanskrit tatas

Example

tañ'ce aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā bahūhi cīvarehi abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, santar'uttaraparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tato cīvaraṃ sāditabbaṃ. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 7 tatuttarisikkhāpadaṃ
tato ce uttari

idiom. if more than that ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + ind + adv
Meaning if more than that
Variant tato ce uttariṃ
Sanskrit tatas + ced + uttarin

Examples

tañ'ce aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā bahūhi cīvarehi abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, santar'uttaraparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tato cīvaraṃ sāditabbaṃ. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 7 tatuttarisikkhāpadaṃ

catukkhattuṃ pañcakkhattuṃ chakkhattu'paramaṃ tuṇhībhūto uddissa tiṭṭhamāno taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, icc'etaṃ kusalaṃ. tato ce uttari vāyamamāno taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
tato 2

pron. (comparative) than that; more than that; lit. from that [ta + to] ✓

Grammar pron, abl sg of ta
Meaning (comparative) than that; more than that; lit. from that
Construction ta + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Sanskrit tatas

Examples

diso disaṃ yaṃ taṃ kayirā,
verī vā pana verinaṃ,
micchāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ,
pāpiyo naṃ tato kare.

DHP 42 cittavaggo

yo vā pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ antamaso gadduhanamattam'pi mettacittaṃ bhāveyya … idaṃ tato mahapphalataraṃ.

SN 20.4 okkhāsuttaṃ
tato tato 1

idiom. from this or that; on account of this or that; lit. from that from that ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + adv
Meaning from this or that; on account of this or that; lit. from that from that
Antonym yato yato
Notes see tato tato 2
Sanskrit tatas + tatas

Example

yato yato mano nivāraye,
na dukkham'eti naṃ tato tato,
sa sabbato mano nivāraye,
sa sabbato dukkhā pamuccati.

SN 1.24 manonivāraṇasuttaṃ
tato tato 2

idiom. at exactly that time; right then; lit. from that from that ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + adv
Meaning at exactly that time; right then; lit. from that from that
Antonym yato yato
Notes see tato tato 1
Sanskrit tatas + tatas

Example

na brāhmaṇass'etadakiñci seyyo,
yadā nisedho manaso piyehi,
yato yato hiṃsamano nivattati,
tato tato sammati'm'eva dukkhaṃ.

DHP 390 brāhmaṇavaggo
tato nidānaṃ

idiom. because of that ✗
tato nimittaṃ

idiom. because of that ✗
tato paraṃ 1

idiom. then after that; then next; from then on ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + prep
Meaning then after that; then next; from then on
Sanskrit tatas + param

Examples

evaṃ taṃ puggalaṃ karuṇāyitvā tato paraṃ eten'eva upāyena piyapuggale, tato majjhatte, tato verimhī'ti anukkamena karuṇā pavattetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

tato paraṃ, pañcah'ākārehi anodhisopharaṇā sattah'ākārehi odhisopharaṇā dasah'ākārehi disāpharaṇā'ti ayaṃ vikubbanā, sukhaṃ supatī'tiādayo ānisaṃsā ca mettāyaṃ vuttanayen'eva veditabbā'ti.

Meaning more than that
Sanskrit tatas + param
tato 3

ind. from there; from that; from then [ta + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of ta
Meaning from there; from that; from then
Construction ta + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Sanskrit tatas

Examples

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.

DHP 1 yamakavaggo

atha kho āyasmā rāhulo, ko n'ajja bhagavatā sammukhā ovādena ovadito gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisissatī'ti tato paṭinivattitvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
tato 4

ind. therefore; thereupon; thereby; because of that; after that; lit. from that [ta + to] ✓

Meaning therefore; thereupon; thereby; because of that; after that; lit. from that

Derivative taddhita (to)
Synonym tassa, tena
Sanskrit tatas

Examples

tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena, tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha, tato tvaṃ bāhiya n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena

pare ca na vijānanti,
mayam'ettha yamāmase,
ye ca tattha vijānanti,
tato sammanti medhagā.

Synonym atha
Sanskrit tatas

tato viveko dutiyo pakāsito.

tatonidānaṃ

Meaning because of that; on that account; for that reason; lit. from that reason

Sanskrit tatonidāna

Examples

so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ.

DN 2.19 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
tatonimittaṃ

ind. because of that; on that account; for that reason; lit. from that sign [tato + nimitta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of tatonimitta
Meaning because of that; on that account; for that reason; lit. from that sign

tatonimitta + aṃ

Synonym tatonidānaṃ, tāvatā, tena
Sanskrit tatas + nimitta

Example

kadā nu'haṃ dubbacanena vutto,
tatonimittaṃ vimano na hessaṃ,
atho pasattho'pi tatonimittaṃ,
tuṭṭho na hessaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.

tatta 1.1

vāc'ābhikaṅkhāmi sutaṃ pavassa.

tatto

ind. accurately ✗
tattha 1

ākiñcaññaṃ nissito hitvā m'aññaṃ,
saññāvimokkhe parame'dhimutto,

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
tattha 2

ind. in that regard; in that case; regarding that matter [ta + ttha] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from ta
Meaning in that regard; in that case; regarding that matter
Construction ta + ttha
Derivative taddhita (ttha)
Variant tatra
Sanskrit tatra

Examples

MN 64 mahāmālukyasuttaṃ

rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, upādāniyo dhammo, yo tattha chandarāgo, taṃ tattha upādānaṃ.

SN 22.121 upādāniyasuttaṃ
tattha tattha 1

idiom. right there; here and now; lit. there and there ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + ind
Meaning right there; here and now; lit. there and there
Antonym yattha yattha
Sanskrit tatra + tatra

Examples

etadānuttariyaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇānaṃ yadidaṃ tattha tattha yathābhūtañāṇaṃ. etasmā c'āhaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇā aññaṃ ñāṇaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā n'atthī'ti vadāmi

AN 10.22 adhivuttipadasuttaṃ

so yena yena icchati tena tena gacchati. yattha yattha icchati tattha tattha tiṭṭhati. yattha yattha icchati tattha tattha nisīdati. yattha yattha icchati tattha tattha nipajjati.

Examples

yo ca tesaṃ tattha tattha,
jānāti anudhammataṃ,
catupañhassa kusalo,
āhu bhikkhuṃ tathāvidhaṃ.

ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca. taṃ kissa hetu? abhikkantā h'esā, potaliya, yadidaṃ tattha tattha kālaññutā'ti.

AN 4.100 potaliyasuttaṃ
tattha tattha 3

idiom. here and there; lit. there and there ✓

Meaning here and there; lit. there and there

Example

atha aggi divārattiṃ,
tattha tattha pakāsati,
sambuddho tapataṃ seṭṭho,
esā ābhā anuttarā'ti.

Antonym yattha yattheva

Examples

yasobhogasamappito,
yaṃ yaṃ padesaṃ bhajati,
tattha tatth'eva pūjito.

gacchatha, tātā, pabbatapādaṃ pavisitvā jīvantā subhikkhakāle mama santikaṃ āgantu'kāmā āgacchatha, anāgantu'kāmā tattha tatth'eva jīvathā'ti.

Meaning there I saw

tatth'addasaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ bhūmibhāgaṃ, pāsādikañ'ca vanasaṇḍaṃ, nadiñ'ca sandantiṃ setakaṃ supatitthaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ, samantā ca gocaragāmaṃ.

tatthaparinibbāyī
