Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of tadubhaya
Meaning because of both those things
Construction tad + ubhaya + ena
tadubhaya + ena
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Sanskrit taḥ + ubhena

Example

tassa imissā ca asappāyakiriyāya, asuci visadoso apanīto saupādiseso tadubhayena vaṇo puthuttaṃ gaccheyya.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
tadūpikā

adj. fit for that, appropriate for that ✗

tadeva

sandhi. just that; the same thing; that very thing; that itself [tad + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning just that; the same thing; that very thing; that itself
Construction tad + eva
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Antonym yadeva
Synonym sāva
Sanskrit taḥ + eva

Examples

yadattanī passati ānisaṃsaṃ,
diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
tadeva so tattha samuggahāya,
nihīnato passati sabbamaññaṃ.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

yadeva tvaṃ, rāhula, kāyena kammaṃ kattukāmo ahosi, tadeva te kāyakammaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
tadevassa

sandhi. just that of his [tad + eva + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pron
Meaning just that of his
Construction tad + eva + assa
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Sanskrit tam + eva + asya

Example

evam'eva pan'āyaṃ bhavaṃ poṭṭhapādo yaññad'eva samaṇo gotamo bhāsati, taṃ tadev'assa abbhanumodati, evam'etaṃ bhagavā evam'etaṃ, sugatā'ti.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā
tadevāhaṃ

sandhi. just that I; that very thing I [tad + eva + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pron
Meaning just that I; that very thing I
Construction tad + eva + ahaṃ
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Sanskrit taḥ + eva + aham

Example

yattha ca pana na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati tadev'āhaṃ vadāmi, idañ'hi na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjatī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
tadevekaccesu

sandhi. in some specific; in a certain; lit. that just in some [tad + eva + ekaccesu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pron
Meaning in some specific; in a certain; lit. that just in some
Construction tad + eva + ekaccesu
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Sanskrit taḥ + eva + ekatayeṣu

Example

idha, bhikkhave, tadev'ekaccesu janapadesu, pātī'ti sañjānanti, pattan'ti sañjānanti, vittan'ti sañjānanti, sarāvan'ti sañjānanti, dhāropan'ti sañjānanti, poṇan'ti sañjānanti, pisīlavan'ti sañjānanti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
taddiguṇa

adj. twice that, double that ✗
taddīpaka

adj. explaining that; illustrating that [tad + dīpaka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning explaining that; illustrating that
Construction tad + dīpaka
taddhita

masc. (gram) secondary derivative affix added to nouns to form derived nouns and adjectives; lit. good for him [ta + hita] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) secondary derivative affix added to nouns to form derived nouns and adjectives; lit. good for him
Construction ta + [d] + hita
Phonetic Change +d
Compound catutthī tappurisa (tassa + hita)
Sanskrit taddhita

Examples

tesaṃgahaṇena samāsataddhita-ākhyātakitakānaṃ vibhattipaccayapad'akkhar'āgamā ca lopā honti. vāsiṭṭho, venateyyo

kaccāyana samāsakappa 317

evaṃ liṅga, sabbanāma, pada, upasagga, nipāta, taddhita, ākhyāta, kammappavacanīy'ādisaññā ca.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
taddhitanāma

nt. (gram) derivative from noun ✗
tanana

nt. range [√tan] ✗
tanaya

masc. son, offspring ✗
tanādi

nt. (gram) √tan etc.; group 7 roots which take the conjugational sign o and yira [tan + ādi] ✓

Grammar nt, root group, comp
Meaning (gram) √tan etc.; group 7 roots which take the conjugational sign o and yira
Construction tan + ādi
Compound kammadhāraya (tan + ādi)
Sanskrit tan + ādi

Example

451, 520. tanādito o yirā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 451
tanādigaṇa

masc. (gram) √tan etc. group; group 7 roots which take the conjugational sign o and yira [tanu + ādi + gaṇa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) √tan etc. group; group 7 roots which take the conjugational sign o and yira
Construction tanu + ādi + gaṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (tanādi + gaṇa)
Sanskrit tan + ādi + gaṇa

Example

gaṇato te aṭṭhavidhā bhū'v'ādigaṇo rudh'ādigaṇo div'ādigaṇo sv'ādigaṇo kiy'ādigaṇo gah'ādigaṇo tan'ādigaṇo cur'ādigaṇo cā'ti.

saddanīti padamālā savikaraṇākhyātavibhāga
tani

aor. extended, stretched [√tan] ✗
tanu 1

adj. thin [√tan + u] ✓

Grammar adj, from tanoti
Meaning thin
Root Family √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction √tan + u
Derivative kita (u)
Sanskrit tanu
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Example

manujassa sadā satīmato,
mattaṃ jānato laddhabhojane,
tanu tassa bhavanti vedanā,
saṇikaṃ jīrati āyupālayan'ti.

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ
tanu 2

adj. reduced; decreased; diminished; lit. thin [√tan + u] ✓

Grammar adj, from tanoti
Meaning reduced; decreased; diminished; lit. thin
Root Family √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction √tan + u
Derivative kita (u)
Synonym tanubhūta
Sanskrit tanu
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Example

tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato yo yobbane yobbanamado so sabbaso vā pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
tanu 3

adj. delicate; refined; lit. thin [√tan + u] ~

Construction √tan + u

Synonym muduka, sukumāra, sukhumāla

tanuka

adj. small; few; lit. thin [√tan + u + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from tanu
Meaning small; few; lit. thin
Root Family √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction √tan + u + ka
tanu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym appaka
Variant tanu tassa
Sanskrit tanuka
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Examples

andhabhūto ayaṃ loko,
tanuko-ettha vipassati,
sakuṇo jālamutto'va,
appo saggāya gacchati.

DHP 174 lokavaggo

manujassa sadā satīmato,
mattaṃ jānato laddhabhojane,
tanukassa bhavanti vedanā,
saṇikaṃ jīrati āyupālayan'ti.

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ
tanukata

adj. made thin, reduced ✗
tanukaraṇa

nt. making thin, reduction ✗
tanukaṃ

ind. little ✗
tanuja

masc. son, offspring ✗
tanujā

fem. daughter ✗
tanutara

adj. thinner [√tan] ✗
tanutā

fem. thinness, diminution, reduction [√tan] ✗
tanutta 1

nt. reduction; diminution; decrease; lit. thinness; thin state [√tan + u + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from tanu
Meaning reduction; diminution; decrease; lit. thinness; thin state
Root Family √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction √tan + u + tta
tanu + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Synonym hāna
Commentary (DNa) tanuttā'ti pariyuṭṭhānamandatāya ca kadāci karahaci uppattiyā ca tanubhāvā.
Sanskrit tanutva
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Examples

santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā sakadāgāmino saki'd'eva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhass'antaṃ karissanti, evarūpā'pi, bhikkhave, santi bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

ye te bhikkhū tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā sakadāgāmino sakiṃ'd'eva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhassantaṃ karissanti, te'pi tiriyaṃ mārassa sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ gamissanti.

MN 34 cūḷagopālakasuttaṃ
tanutta 2

nt. small amount; paucity; lit. thinness; thin state [√tan + u + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from tanu
Meaning small amount; paucity; lit. thinness; thin state
Root Family √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction √tan + u + tta
tanu + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Commentary (DNa) tanuttā'ti pariyuṭṭhānamandatāya ca kadāci karahaci uppattiyā ca tanubhāvā.
Sanskrit tanutva
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)
tanupattapalāsa

adj. with thin foliage; sparsely-leaved [tanu + patta + palāsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with thin foliage; sparsely-leaved
Construction tanu + patta + palāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (tanu + pattapalāsa)
Antonym bahalapattapalāsa
Commentary (MNa) tanupattapalāso'ti na abbhapaṭalaṃ viya tanupaṇṇo, viraḷapaṇṇattaṃ panassa sandhāya idaṃ vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit tanupattra + palāśa

Example

seyyathā'pi, sāriputta, rukkho visame bhūmibhāge jāto tanupattapalāso kabaracchāyo. atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito ekāyanena maggena tam'eva rukkhaṃ paṇidhāya.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
tanupasannakheḷa

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thin, transparent saliva
Construction tanu + pasanna + kheḷa
Antonym bahalakheḷa
tanubhāva

masc. thinness, diminution, reduction ✗
tanubhūta

adj. reduced; decreased; diminished; thinned out; lit. become thin [tanu + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning reduced; decreased; diminished; thinned out; lit. become thin
Construction tanu + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (tanu + bhūta)
Synonym tanu
Sanskrit tanu + bhūta

Example

atha kho bhagavā tassa aḍḍhamāsassa accayena paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi, kiṃ nu kho, ānanda, tanubhūto viya bhikkhusaṅgho'ti?

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ
tanuya

adj. few; not many; lit. thin [√tan + u + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from tanu
Meaning few; not many; lit. thin
Root Family √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction √tan + u + ka > ya
tanu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change k > y
Synonym appa
Commentary (SNa) tanuyā'ti tanukā, hiriyā akusale dhamme nisedhetvā carantā khīṇ'āsavā nāma appakā'ti attho.
Sanskrit tanuka
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Example

hirīnisedhā tanuyā,
ye caranti sadā satā,
antaṃ dukkhassa pappuyya,
caranti visame saman'ti.

tanuyā

tanoti

pr. (+acc) stretches; extends [√tan + o + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning stretches; extends
Root Family √tan
Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Base √tan + o > tano
Construction tano + ti
Sanskrit tanoti, tanute
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Example

tanu'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato o yira'icc'ete paccayā honti kattari. tanoti, tanohi, karoti, karohi, kayirati, kayirāhi.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 451
tanta 1

nt. thread; string; twine; lit. stretched [√tan + ta] ✓

Meaning thread; string; twine; lit. stretched

Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction √tan + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym sutta
Sanskrit tantra
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu sāmaṃ suttaṃ viññāpetvā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 26 suttaviññattisikkhāpadaṃ

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ

tantaka

nt. thread ?; loom ? ✗

Construction tanta + vāya

VIN PAT NP 26 suttaviññattisikkhāpadaṃ

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpeyya, tatra ce so bhikkhu pubbe appavārito tantavāye upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya

VIN PAT NP 27 mahāpesakārasikkhāpadaṃ
tantākulakajāta

adj. like a tangled ball of thread [tanta + ākulaka + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a tangled ball of thread
Construction tanta + ākulaka + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (tantākulaka + jāta)
Commentary (ANa) tantākulakajāto'ti tantaṃ viya ākulajāto. yathā nāma dunnikkhittaṃ mūsikacchinnaṃ pesakārānaṃ tantaṃ tahiṃ tahiṃ ākulaṃ hoti, idaṃ aggaṃ idaṃ mūlan'ti aggena vā aggaṃ, mūlena vā mūlaṃ samānetuṃ dukkaraṃ hoti, evaṃ sattā imāya taṇhāya pariyonaddhā ākulabyākulā na sakkonti attano nissaraṇamaggaṃ ujuṃ kātuṃ.
Sanskrit tantra + ākula + jāta

Example

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
tantāvuta

adj. woven on the loom [tanta + āvuta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning woven on the loom
Construction tanta + āvuta

Meaning (of a musical instrument) string

Root √tan･7 o (stretch, extend)
Construction √tan + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Sanskrit tanti
Sanskrit Root √tan 8 (stretch)

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, yadā te vīṇāya tantiyo accāyatā honti, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṃ samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

anekehi sambhārehi samāraddhā vadati, seyyath'idaṃ, doṇiñ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca daṇḍañ'ca paṭicca upadhāraṇe ca paṭicca tantiyo ca paṭicca koṇañ'ca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjaṃ vāyāmaṃ paṭicca ev'āyaṃ, bhante, vīṇā nāma anekasambhārā mahāsambhārā.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
tanti 2

Example

diṭṭhā hi mayā sucittitā,
sombhā dārukapillakāni vā,
tantīhi ca khīlakehi ca,
vinibaddhā vividhaṃ panaccakā.

tanti 4

fem. secret text [√tan] ✗
tantikhīlaka

masc. (of a marionette) strings and handle [tanti + khīlaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (of a marionette) strings and handle
Construction tanti + khīlaka
Compound dvanda (tanti ca khīlaka ca)
Commentary (THIa) tamh'uddhaṭe tantikhīlake'ti sannivesavisiṭṭharacanāvisesayuttaṃ upādāya rūpakasamaññā tamhi tantimhi khīlake ca ṭhānato uddhaṭe
Sanskrit khīla + tanti

Example

tamh'uddhaṭe tantikhīlake,
vissaṭṭhe vikale parikrite,
na vindeyya khaṇḍaso kate,
kimhi tattha manaṃ nivesaye.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, kusalo tvaṃ pubbe agāriyabhūto vīṇāya tantissare'ti?

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
tandi

fem. laziness; sloth; tiredness [√tand + i] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr
Meaning laziness; sloth; tiredness
Root Family √tand
Root √tand･1 a (be slow, lazy)
Construction √tand + i
Derivative kita (i)
Antonym atandi
Variant tandī
Commentary (SNa) tandī'ti atisīt'ādipaccayā uppannaṃ āgantukakāy'ālasiyaṃ. (VIBH) tattha katamā tandī? yā tandī tandiyanā tandimanakatā ālasyaṃ ālasyāyanā ālasyāyitattaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati tandī.
Sanskrit tandrī
Sanskrit Root √tand √tandr 1 (be weary)

Example

kadā nu maṃ tandi khudā pipāsā,
vāt'ātapā kīṭasarīsapā vā,
na bādhayissanti na taṃ giribbaje,
atth'atthiyaṃ taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
tandiṭṭhika

adj. having that view; holding that opinion; with that belief [taṃ + diṭṭhi + ka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having that view; holding that opinion; with that belief
Construction taṃ + diṭṭhi + ka
tandiṭṭhi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Variant taṃdiṭṭhika
Sanskrit tam + dṛṣṭika
tandita

adj. weary, lazy, inactive [√tand] ✗
tandī

fem. laziness; sloth; tiredness [√tand + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr
Meaning laziness; sloth; tiredness
Root Family √tand
Root √tand･1 a (be slow, lazy)
Construction √tand + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Antonym atandī
Variant tandi
Commentary (SNa) tandī'ti aticchāt'ādivasena āgantukālasiyaṃ. (VIBH) tattha katamā tandī? yā tandī tandiyanā tandimanakatā ālasyaṃ ālasyāyanā ālasyāyitattaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati tandī.
Sanskrit tandrī
Sanskrit Root √tand √tandr 1 (be weary)

Examples

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thīnamiddhaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, arati tandī vijambhikā bhattasammado cetaso ca līnattaṃ

AN 1.13 nīvaraṇappahānavaggo

niddaṃ tandiṃ vijambhitaṃ,
aratiṃ bhattasammadaṃ,
vīriyena naṃ paṇāmetvā,
ariyamaggo visujjhatī'ti.

tannissita 1

adj. dependent on that; supported by that; based on that [taṃ + nissita] ~

Construction taṃ + nissita

Commentary (MNa) tan'nissitaṃ hoti viññāṇan'ti viññāṇaṃ vipassanānissitaṃ hoti. (SNa) tan'nissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hotī'ti taṇhānissitaṃ kammaviññāṇaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit tam + niśrita
tannissita 2

adj. included in that ✗
tanhīyi

aor. had thirst for [√tas] ✗
tapa

adj. hot; warm [√tap + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from tapati
Meaning hot; warm
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction √tap + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit tapa
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati tap'od'ārāme. atha kho āyasmā samiddhi rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya yena tap'odā ten'upasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṃ.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
tapacaraṇa

nt. ascetic practice [tapa + caraṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning ascetic practice
Construction tapa + caraṇa
Synonym dhuta, dhutaguṇa, dhutaṅga, dhūta
tapati 1

pr. shines; radiates; glows; blazes [√tap + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning shines; radiates; glows; blazes
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Base √tap + a > tapa
Construction tapa + ti
Synonym ābhāti, daddallati, dibbati, pakāseti, bhāsati, sobhati
Sanskrit tapati
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma maṇi veḷuriyo subho jātimā aṭṭh'aṃso suparikammakato paṇḍukambale nikkhitto bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve ādicco nabhaṃ abbhussakkamāno sabbaṃ ākāsagataṃ tamagataṃ abhivihacca bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ
tapati 2

pr. burns; harms [√tap + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning burns; harms
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Base √tap + a > tapa
Construction tapa + ti
Sanskrit tapati
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)
tapadhana

adj. whose wealth is self-control, ascetic ✗
tapana

nt. shining, brightness [√tap] ✗
tapanīya 1

adj. tormenting; torturous; causing remorse; lit. to be burned [√tap + anīya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of tapati
Meaning tormenting; torturous; causing remorse; lit. to be burned
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction √tap + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Antonym atapanīya
Sanskrit tapanīya
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Example

tapanīyāni kammāni,
yāni dhammehi ārakā,
tāni ārocayissāmi,
taṃ suṇātha yathā tathaṃ.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
tapanīya 2

nt. purified gold; lit. to be burned [√tap + anīya] ✓

Grammar nt, ptp of tapati
Meaning purified gold; lit. to be burned
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction √tap + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Commentary (THIa) tapanīyakatā'va dhītikā'ti rattasuvaṇṇena vicaritā dhītalikā viya
Sanskrit tapanīya
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Example

tapanīyakatā'va dhītikā,
vicarasi cittalat'eva accharā,
kāsikasukhumehi vaggubhi,
sobhasī suvasanehi n'ūpame.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
tapanīya 3

ptp. should be tortured; should be tormented; to be purified by fire; lit. to be burned [√tap + anīya] ~

Grammar ptp of tapati
Meaning should be tortured; should be tormented; to be purified by fire; lit. to be burned
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction √tap + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)
tapanīyakata

adj. made of purified gold [tapanīya + kata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning made of purified gold
Construction tapanīya + kata
Compound kammadhāraya (tapanīya + kata)
Commentary (THIa) tapanīyakatā'va dhītikā'ti rattasuvaṇṇena vicaritā dhītalikā viya
Sanskrit tapanīya + kṛta

Example

tapanīyakatā'va dhītikā,
vicarasi cittalat'eva accharā,
kāsikasukhumehi vaggubhi,
sobhasī suvasanehi n'ūpame.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
tapanīyasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 2.3 (AN2.3) ✗
tapanīyasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.141 (AN10.141) ✗
tapanīyasutta 3

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.185 (AN10.185) ✗
tapanīyasutta 4

nt. Itivuttaka 30 (ITI 30) ✗
tapanta

prp. shining; blazing; radiating; illuminating [√tap + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of tapati, intrans
Meaning shining; blazing; radiating; illuminating
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Base √tap + a > tapa
Construction tapa + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym obhāsayanta, jotayanta, daddaḷhamāna, virocamāna, sobhamāna
Sanskrit tapat
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Examples

atha aggi divārattiṃ,
tattha tattha pakāsati,
sambuddho tapataṃ seṭṭho,
esā ābhā anuttarā'ti.

SN 1.26 pajjotasuttaṃ

padumaṃ yathā kokanadaṃ sugandhaṃ,
pāto siyā phullam'avītagandhaṃ,
aṅgīrasaṃ passa virocamānaṃ,
tapantam'ādiccam'iv'antalikkhe'ti.

SN 3.12 pañcarājasuttaṃ
tapantamādiccamivantalikkhe

sandhi. blazing like the sun in the sky [tapantaṃ + ādiccaṃ + iva + antalikkhe] ✓

Grammar sandhi, prp + masc + ind + adv
Meaning blazing like the sun in the sky
Construction tapantaṃ + ādiccaṃ + iva + antalikkhe
Commentary (SNa) evam'eva bhagavantaṃ aṅgīrasaṃ tapantaṃ ādiccam'iva antalikkhe virocamānaṃ passā'ti ayam'ettha saṅkhep'attho.
Sanskrit tapantam + ādityam + iva + antarikṣe

Example

padumaṃ yathā kokanadaṃ sugandhaṃ,
pāto siyā phullam'avītagandhaṃ,
aṅgīrasaṃ passa virocamānaṃ,
tapantam'ādiccam'iv'antalikkhe'ti.

SN 3.12 pañcarājasuttaṃ
tapabrahmacārī

masc. practitioner of self-mortification ✗
tapamāna

prp. shining [√tap] ✗
tapavana

nt. place suitable for religious practices ✗
tapas 1

masc. spiritual practice; religious practice; lit. burning [√tap + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, from tapati
Meaning spiritual practice; religious practice; lit. burning
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction √tap + as
Derivative kita (as)
Commentary (SNa) tapo'ti indriyasaṃvara-dhutaṅgaguṇa-vīriya-dukkarakārikānaṃ nāmaṃ, idha pana ṭhapetvā dukkarakārikaṃ sabbā'pi kilesasantāpikā paṭipadā vaṭṭati.
Notes tapo in comps
Sanskrit tapas
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Examples

khantī paramaṃ tapo titikkhā,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ vadanti buddhā,
na hi pabbajito par'ūpaghātī,
na samaṇo hoti paraṃ viheṭhayanto.

DHP 184 buddhavaggo

saddhā bījaṃ tapo vuṭṭhi,
paññā me yuganaṅgalaṃ,
hirī īsā mano yottaṃ,
sati me phālapācanaṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
tapas 2

masc. self-mortification; ascetic practice; austerity; lit. burning [√tap + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, from tapati
Meaning self-mortification; ascetic practice; austerity; lit. burning
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction √tap + as
Derivative kita (as)
Synonym tapopakkama
Commentary (SNa) lūkhaṃ tapan'ti pañc'ātapatāpanaṃ kaṇṭakaseyy'ādikaṃ tapaṃ. (SNt) lūkhaṃ tapan'ti attakilamath'ānuyogaṃ.
Notes tapo in comps
Sanskrit tapas
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Examples

taṇh'ādhipannā vatasīlabaddhā,
lūkhaṃ tapaṃ vassasataṃ carantā,
cittañ'ca nesaṃ na sammā vimuttaṃ,
hīn'attharūpā na pāraṅ'gamā te.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ

imāya ca, kassapa, mattāya iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṃ vā abhavissa brahmaññaṃ vā dukkaraṃ sudukkaraṃ, n'etaṃ abhavissa kallaṃ vacanāya, dukkaraṃ sāmaññaṃ dukkaraṃ brahmaññan'ti.

tapas 3

masc. heat; warmth [√tap] ✗
tapassa

masc. name of a lay disciple ~

Meaning name of a lay disciple
Commentary (ANa) ito paresu tapusso'ti dvevācik'upāsako.

Grammar fem, abstr, from tapassī

AN 8.11 verañjasuttaṃ

pañcavedā sataṃ samaṃ,
tapassī brāhmaṇā caraṃ,
cittañ'ca nesaṃ na sammā vimuttaṃ,
hīn'attharūpā na pāraṅ'gamā te.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ
tapassī 2

adj. devoted to religious austerities [√tap] ✗
tapassubhallikā

masc. name of two laymen; great disciples of the Buddha; foremost in first taking refuge in the Buddha [tapassu + bhallika + ā] ~

Meaning name of two laymen; great disciples of the Buddha; foremost in first taking refuge in the Buddha

tapassubhallika + ā

Commentary (VINa) tena kho pana samayena tapussabhallikā vāṇijā'ti tapusso ca bhalliko cā'ti dve bhātaro vāṇijā.
tapi

aor. shined [√tap] ✗

n'āhaṃ, gahapati, sabbaṃ tapaṃ tapitabban'ti vadāmi, na ca pan'āhaṃ gahapati, sabbaṃ tapaṃ na tapitabban'ti vadāmi, n'āhaṃ gahapati, sabbaṃ samādānaṃ samāditabban'ti vadāmi, na pan'āhaṃ gahapati, sabbaṃ samādānaṃ na samāditabban'ti vadāmi

tapokamma

nt. ascetic practice; self-mortification [tapo + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning ascetic practice; self-mortification
Construction tapo + kamma
Compound kammadhāraya (tapo + kamma)
Synonym tapopakkama
Sanskrit tapo + karman

Example

ahesuṃ kho, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ yāvatakaṃ tuyhaṃ kasiṇaṃ āyu tāvatakaṃ tesaṃ tapokammam'eva ahosi.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
tapokammasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 4.1 (SN4.1) ✗

tapoguṇa

masc. qualities of an ascetic; quality of austerity [tapo + guṇa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning qualities of an ascetic; quality of austerity
Construction tapo + guṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (tapo + guṇa)
Sanskrit tapas + guṇa

Example

app'eva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan'ti bhikkhubhāvā cāveyyaṃ, samaṇadhammā cāveyyaṃ, sīlakkhandhā cāveyyaṃ, tapoguṇā cāveyyaṃ.

VIN 1.2.8 duṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ
tapojigucchā

fem. abhorrent ascetic practice; extreme self-torture [tapo + jigucchā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning abhorrent ascetic practice; extreme self-torture
Construction tapo + jigucchā
Compound kammadhāraya (tapo + jigucchā)
Commentary (SNa) tapojigucchāyā'ti kāyakilamathatapena pāpajigucchanena.
Sanskrit tapo + jugupsā

Examples

tapojigucchāya susaṃvut'atto,
vācaṃ pahāya kalahaṃ janena,
samosavajjā virato saccavādī,
na hi nūna t'ādisaṃ karoti pāpan'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

tapojigucchāya āyuttā,
pālayaṃ pavivekiyaṃ,
rūpe ca ye niviṭṭhāse,
devalok'ābhinandino,
te ve samm'ānusāsanti,
paralokāya mātiyā'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
tapojigucchāallīna

adj. who clings to extreme self-torture; who is attached to abhorrent ascetic practice [tapojigucchā + allīna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who clings to extreme self-torture; who is attached to abhorrent ascetic practice
Construction tapojigucchā + allīna
Compound sattamī tappurisa (tapojigucchāsu + allīna)
Sanskrit tapo + jugupsā + ālīna

Example

sīlavisuddhiṃ kho ahaṃ, sāḷha, aññataraṃ sāmaññ'aṅgan'ti vadāmi. ye te, sāḷha, samaṇabrāhmaṇā tapojigucchāvādā tapojigucchāsārā tapojigucchāallīnā viharanti, abhabbā te oghassa nittharaṇāya.

AN 4.196 sāḷhasuttaṃ
tapojigucchāvāda

adj. who advocates extreme self-torture [tapojigucchā + vāda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who advocates extreme self-torture
Construction tapojigucchā + vāda
Compound kammadhāraya (tapojigucchā + vāda)
Sanskrit tapo + jugupsā + vāda

Example

sīlavisuddhiṃ kho ahaṃ, sāḷha, aññataraṃ sāmaññ'aṅgan'ti vadāmi. ye te, sāḷha, samaṇabrāhmaṇā tapojigucchāvādā tapojigucchāsārā tapojigucchāallīnā viharanti, abhabbā te oghassa nittharaṇāya.

AN 4.196 sāḷhasuttaṃ
tapojigucchāsāra

adj. who hold extreme self-torture to be the essence [tapojigucchā + sāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who hold extreme self-torture to be the essence
Construction tapojigucchā + sāra
Compound kammadhāraya (tapojigucchā + sāra)
Sanskrit tapo + jugupsā + sāra

Example

sīlavisuddhiṃ kho ahaṃ, sāḷha, aññataraṃ sāmaññ'aṅgan'ti vadāmi. ye te, sāḷha, samaṇabrāhmaṇā tapojigucchāvādā tapojigucchāsārā tapojigucchāallīnā viharanti, abhabbā te oghassa nittharaṇāya.

AN 4.196 sāḷhasuttaṃ
tapojigucchāhetu

ind. by means of abhorrent ascetic practice; by means of extreme self-torture [tapo + jigucchā + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning by means of abhorrent ascetic practice; by means of extreme self-torture
Construction tapo + jigucchā + hetu
Commentary (ANa) tapojigucchāhetū'ti dukkarakārikasaṅkhātena tapena pāpajigucchanahetu.
Sanskrit tapo + jugupsā + hetu

Example

santi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā dvayena oghassa nittharaṇaṃ paññapenti, sīlavisuddhihetu ca tapojigucchāhetu ca. idha, bhante, bhagavā kim'āhā'ti?

AN 4.196 sāḷhasuttaṃ
tapoda 1

nt. hot spring; thermal spring; lit. hot water [tapa + uda] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning hot spring; thermal spring; lit. hot water
Construction tapa + uda
Phonetic Change u > o
Compound kammadhāraya (tapa + uda)
Commentary (SNa) tap'od'ārāme'ti tap'odassa tatt'odakassa rahadassa vasena evaṃ laddhanāme ārāme.
Sanskrit tapoda (bsk)

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati tap'od'ārāme. atha kho āyasmā samiddhi rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya yena tap'odā ten'upasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṃ.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ

DN 8.5 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
tapopakkamakathā

fem. discussion about practising self-mortification ✗

Construction tad > tap + paccanīka
Phonetic Change d > p
tappaccanīkakilesa

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning defilement opposed to that
Construction tad > tap + paccanīka + kilesa
Phonetic Change d > p
tappaccayā

ind. due to that; on account of that; because of that; lit. from condition of that [tad + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of tappaccaya
Meaning due to that; on account of that; because of that; lit. from condition of that
Construction tad > tap + paccaya + ā
tappaccaya + ā
Phonetic Change d > p
Synonym tannidānā
Sanskrit tad + pratyayāt

Examples

yaṃ vo kiccaṃ sarīrena,
taṃ karotha yadicchatha,
na me tappaccayā tattha,
doso pemañ'ca hehiti.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

sac'assa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpema, na tv'eva mayaṃ, bhante, tappaccayā

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
tappaṭipakkha

adj. contrary to that; opposed to that; opposite to that [tad + paṭipakkha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning contrary to that; opposed to that; opposite to that
Construction tad + paṭipakkha
Sanskrit tad + pratipakṣa
tappaṭipakkhabhūta

nt. state opposite to that [tappaṭipakkha + bhūta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning state opposite to that
Construction tappaṭipakkha + bhūta
Sanskrit tad + pratipakṣa + bhūta
tappaṇa

nt. satiation, refreshment [√tapp] ✗
tappati 1.1

pr. is burned; is consumed; is tormented [√tap + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of tapati, intrans
Meaning is burned; is consumed; is tormented
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 ya (burn, radiate heat)
Base √tap + ya > tappa (pass)
Construction tappa + ti
Phonetic Change y > p
Antonym nandati
Notes see tappati 2
Sanskrit tapyate
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Examples

yaṃ kuddho uparodheti,
sukaraṃ viya dukkaraṃ,
pacchā so vigate kodhe,
aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

atha pāpāni kammāni,
karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
sehi kammehi dummedho,
aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

DHP 136 daṇḍavaggo
tappati 2.1

pr. regrets; suffers remorse; lit. is burned [√tapp + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning regrets; suffers remorse; lit. is burned
Root Family √tapp
Root √tapp･1 a (regret)
Base √tapp + a > tappa
Construction tappa + ti
Synonym anutapati, anutappati
Notes originally passive of √tap see tappati 1
Sanskrit tapyate
Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)

Example

akataṃ dukkaṭaṃ seyyo,
pacchā tappati dukkaṭaṃ,
katañ'ca sukataṃ seyyo,
yaṃ katvā n'ānutappati.

DHP 314 nirayavaggo
tappatirūpī

adj. relevant to that; related to that; pertinent to that; suitable for that [ta + patirūpī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning relevant to that; related to that; pertinent to that; suitable for that
Construction ta + patirūpī
Compound catutthī tappurisa (tassa + patirūpī)
Synonym tatrupāya
Sanskrit taḥ + pratirūpa

Example

lok'āmis'ādhimuttassa kho, sunakkhatta, purisapuggalassa tappatirūpī c'eva kathā saṇṭhāti, tadanudhammañ'ca anuvitakketi, anuvicāreti, tañ'ca purisaṃ bhajati, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
tappana

nt. mortification [√tap] ✗

adj. leading towards that [taṃ + pabbhāra] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading towards that
Construction taṃ + pabbhāra
tappamāna

prp. being heated; being warmed [√tap] ✗
tappayati

pr. (+acc) satiates; satisfies; pleases [√tapp + *aya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning satiates; satisfies; pleases
Root Family √tapp
Root √tapp･8 *aya (satisfy)
Base √tapp + aya > tappaya
Construction tappaya + ti
Synonym ārādheti, sampavāreti
Sanskrit Root √tṛp 4, 5, 6 (be pleased)
tappara

adj. devoted to; lit. that other [taṃ + para] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to; lit. that other
Construction taṃ + para
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (taṃ + para)
Sanskrit tatpara

Example

evaṃ vilapamānaṃ taṃ,
ānandaṃ āha gotamī,
sutasāgaragambhīra,
buddh'opaṭṭhānatappara.

API 17 mahāpajāpatigotamītherīapadānaṃ
tapparāyaṇa

adj. having that as one's goal; focussed on that [tad + parāyaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having that as one's goal; focussed on that
Construction tad + parāyaṇa
Phonetic Change dp > pp
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (tad + parāyaṇa)
Commentary (NIDD2) tapparāyaṇan'ti ākiñcaññ'āyatanamayaṃ tapparāyaṇaṃ kammaparāyaṇaṃ vipākaparāyaṇaṃ kammagarukaṃ paṭisandhigarukaṃ. atha vā, bhagavā jānāti, ayaṃ puggalo rūpaparāyaṇo … n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasamāpattiparāyaṇo'ti, dhimuttaṃ tapparāyaṇaṃ. (SNPa) tapparāyaṇan'ti tam'mayaṃ.
Sanskrit tad + parāyaṇa

Example

viññāṇaṭṭhitiyo sabbā, (posālāti bhagavā)
abhijānaṃ tathāgato,
tiṭṭhantam'enaṃ jānāti,
vimuttaṃ tapparāyaṇaṃ.

KN 5 posālamāṇavapucchā

Construction tad + pasāsati

masc. means of removing that ✗
tappita

pp. satiated, satisfied, pleased [√tapp] ✗

VIN 2.5.6.6 jotikasikkhāpadaṃ

Grammar inf of tappati, pass, intrans

Root √tap･1 ya (burn, radiate heat)
Base √tap + ya > tappa (pass)
Construction tappa + ituṃ
Phonetic Change y > p
Sanskrit tap

visibban'āpekkho'ti tappitu'kāmo.

VIN 2.5.6.6 jotikasikkhāpadaṃ
tappiya 1

Construction tad + purisa

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning detailed explanation of that; commentary on that
Construction tad > tab + vaṇṇanā
Phonetic Change d > b
tabbahula

adj. that frequently; that often [tad + bahula] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning that frequently; that often
Construction tad > tab + bahula
Phonetic Change ṃ > b
Compound kammadhāraya (tad + bahula)
Commentary (MNa) tabbahulavihārino'ti kāmapaṭibāhanena tam'eva paṭipadaṃ bahulaṃ katvā viharantassa.
Sanskrit tadbahula

Example

tassa evaṃpaṭipannassa tabbahulavihārino āyatane cittaṃ pasīdati. sampasāde sati etarahi vā āneñjaṃ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
tabbahulavihārī

adj. frequently living in that state; doing that a lot [tabbahula + vihārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning frequently living in that state; doing that a lot
Construction tabbahula + vihārī
Compound kammadhāraya (tabbahula + vihārī)
Commentary (MNa) tabbahulavihārino'ti kāmapaṭibāhanena tam'eva paṭipadaṃ bahulaṃ katvā viharantassa. (ANa) tabbahulavihārī'ti tena jhānena bahulaṃ viharanto.
Sanskrit tadbahulavihārin

Examples

tassa evaṃpaṭipannassa tabbahulavihārino āyatane cittaṃ pasīdati. sampasāde sati etarahi vā āneñjaṃ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ

so tadassādeti, taṃ nikāmeti, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati. tattha ṭhito tadadhimutto tabbahulavihārī aparihīno kālaṃ kurumāno brahmakāyikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

aṭṭhakavaggo 10
tamakhanda

masc. great darkness ✗
tamagata

nt. darkness [tamas + gata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning darkness
Construction tamas + gata
Compound kammadhāraya (tamas + gata)

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve ādicco nabhaṃ abbhussakkamāno sabbaṃ ākāsagataṃ tamagataṃ abhivihacca bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ
tamañña

sandhi. someone else; somebody else; lit. that other ✗
tamaññe

sandhi. other people (say) that; lit. those others [taṃ + aññe] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning other people (say) that; lit. those others
Construction taṃ + aññe
Sanskrit tam + anye

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, brāhmaṇā, bhikkhu lokassa antam'āgamma, lokassa ante viharati. tam'aññe evam'āhaṃsu, ayam'pi lokapariyāpanno, ayam'pi anissaṭo lokamhā'ti. aham'pi hi, brāhmaṇā, evaṃ vadāmi, ayam'pi lokapariyāpanno, ayam'pi anissaṭo lokamhā'ti.

AN 9.38 lokāyatikasuttaṃ
tamañño

sandhi. someone else; another person; lit. that other [taṃ + añño] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning someone else; another person; lit. that other
Construction taṃ + añño
Sanskrit tam + anya

Examples

evaṃ vutte tam'añño evam'āha, na kho pana m'etaṃ, bho, evaṃ bhavissati. saññā hi, bho, purisassa attā. sā ca kho upeti'pi apeti'pi. yasmiṃ samaye upeti, saññī tasmiṃ samaye hoti.

DN 9.2 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, abhisaññānirodhakathā

aparo pañhaṃ puṭṭho katheti, tam'añño, suṭṭhu te pañho kathito, kattha te uggahito, pañhaṃ kathentena nāma evaṃ kathetabbo'ti vadati.

ANa 3.68 kathāvatthusuttavaṇṇanā
tamatagga

adj. very highest [tama + agga] ✓

Grammar adj, superl, comp
Meaning very highest
Construction tama + [t] + agga
Phonetic Change +t
Compound kammadhāraya (agga + tama)
Commentary (DNa) tama't'agge'ti tamaagge. majjhe takāro padasandhivasena vutto. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, ime aggatamā'ti tamataggā'ti. evaṃ sabbaṃ tamayogaṃ chinditvā ativiya agge uttamabhāve ete, ānanda, mama bhikkhū bhavissanti.
Sanskrit agra + tama

Example

tama't'agge mete, ānanda, bhikkhū bhavissanti ye keci sikkhākāmā'ti

SN 47.14 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
tamatagge

ind. in the highest degree; at the end of ignorance ✗

Grammar sandhi, pron + masc
Meaning that purpose; that benefit; that advantage
Construction taṃ + attha
Sanskrit taḥ + artha

Example

pasaṃsito vā pana tattha hoti,
akkhāya vādaṃ parisāya majjhe,
so hassatī uṇṇamatī ca tena,
pappuyya tam'atthaṃ yathā mano ahu.

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning follows him; sides with him
Construction taṃ + anuvattati
Commentary (VIN) tam'anuvatteyyā'ti yaṃdiṭṭhiko so hoti yaṃkhantiko yaṃruciko, sā'pi taṃdiṭṭhikā hoti taṃkhantikā taṃrucikā. (KVa) tam'anuvatteyyā'ti taṃ ukkhittakaṃ ukkhittakabhāve'y'eva ṭhitaṃ bhikkhuṃ yā bhikkhunī yaṃdiṭṭhiko so hoti, tāya diṭṭhiyā gahaṇabhāvena anuvatteyya.

tamanussaramāna

Grammar prp, comp vb
Meaning remembering that; recollecting that
Construction taṃ + anussaramāna
Compound comp verb (taṃ + anussaramāna)
Synonym tadanussaranta
Commentary (UDa) sā tam'anussaramāno'ti so taṃ sukhaṃ eta'r'ahi ukkaṇṭhanavasena anussaranto.
Sanskrit tam + anusmaramāṇa

Example

nissaṃsayaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā bhaddiyo kāḷīgodhāya putto anabhirato brahmacariyaṃ carati. yaṃ'sa pubbe agāriyabhūtassa rajjasukhaṃ, so tam'anussaramāno araññagato'pi rukkhamūlagato'pi suññ'āgāragato'pi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānesi, aho sukhaṃ, aho sukhan'ti!

Construction taṃ + abhikaṅkhati
tamas 1

masc. darkness; gloom ✓

Grammar masc, mano group
Meaning darkness; gloom
Antonym āloka
Notes tamo in comps
Sanskrit tamas

Examples

vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato āloko uppanno, yathā taṃ appamattassa ātāpino pahit'attassa viharato.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

sadevakassa lokassa,
yathā dissati cakkhumā,
sabbaṃ tamaṃ vinodetvā,
eko'va ratim'ajjhagā.

aṭṭhakavaggo 16

sadevakassa lokassa,

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

etesu dhammesu vineyya chandaṃ,
bhikkhu satimā suvimuttacitto,
kālena so sammā dhammaṃ parivīmaṃsamāno,
ekodibhūto vihane tamaṃ so'ti.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
tamas 3

masc. turbidity; murkiness [tamas] ✗
tamahaṃ

sandhi. him I; that I [taṃ + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning him I; that I
Construction taṃ + ahaṃ
Commentary (ANa) tam'ahan'ti taṃ sabbaṃ ahaṃ jānāmi.

sabb'ābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ,
sabbesu dhammesu anūpalittaṃ,
sabbañ'jahaṃ taṇhākkhaye vimuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ naraṃ ekavihārī'ti brūmī'ti.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ

yassa kho, brāhmaṇa, āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhav'ābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā tam'ahaṃ apagabbho'ti vadāmi.

AN 8.11 verañjasuttaṃ
tamāla

masc. tree Xantrochymus pictorius ✗
tamāsevati

pr. applies oneself to that; practices that; pursues that [taṃ + āsevati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning applies oneself to that; practices that; pursues that
Construction taṃ + āsevati
Compound comp verb (taṃ + āsevati)
Sanskrit tam + āśrayati

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, ānanda, etadahosi, sace kho ahaṃ kāmesu ādīnavaṃ disvā taṃ bahulaṃ kareyyaṃ, nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ adhigamma tam'āseveyyaṃ, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati yaṃ me nekkhamme cittaṃ pakkhandeyya pasīdeyya santiṭṭheyya vimucceyya etaṃ santan'ti passato.

AN 9.41 tapussasuttaṃ
tamāsevi

aor. applied oneself to that; practiced that; pursued that [taṃ + āsevi] ✓

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning applied oneself to that; practiced that; pursued that
Construction taṃ + āsevi
Compound comp verb (taṃ + āsevi)
Sanskrit tam + āsev

Example

so kho ahaṃ, ānanda, aparena samayena kāmesu ādīnavaṃ disvā taṃ bahulam'akāsiṃ, nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ adhigamma tam'āseviṃ. tassa mayhaṃ, ānanda, nekkhamme cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati etaṃ santan'ti passato.

AN 9.41 tapussasuttaṃ
tamāhu

sandhi. (+acc) they call that; lit. they said that [taṃ + āhu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + perf (+acc)
Meaning they call that; lit. they said that
Construction taṃ + āhu
Antonym yamāhu
Sanskrit tam + āhuḥ

Examples

tam'āhu sekhaṃ paṭipadaṃ,
atho saṃsuddhacāriyaṃ,
tam'āhu loke sambuddhaṃ,
dhīraṃ paṭipadantaguṃ.

AN 3.91 dutiya sikkhattayasuttaṃ

yo attano sīlavatāni jantu,
anānupuṭṭho'va paresa pāva,
anariyadhammaṃ kusalā tam'āhu,
yo ātumānaṃ sayam'eva pāva.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
tamupavhayati

pr. calls him; calls his name; lit. invokes him [taṃ + upavhayati] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning calls him; calls his name; lit. invokes him
Construction taṃ + upavhayati
Commentary (SNa) tam'upavhayethā'ti yena yañño paṭiyādito, so taṃ paramatthabrāhmaṇaṃ avhayeyya. indam'avhayāma, somam'avhayāma, varuṇam'avhayāma, īsānam'avhayāma, yāmam'avhayāmā'ti idaṃ pana avhānaṃ niratthakaṃ.
tamenaṃ

sandhi. that one; him; her; that thing; that person [taṃ + enaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning that one; him; her; that thing; that person
Construction taṃ + enaṃ
Sanskrit tam + enam

Examples

agamāsi kho, bhikkhave, so kummo taṃ padesaṃ. tam'enaṃ luddo papatāya vijjhi.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, ayaṃ te, ambho purisa, samatittiko telapatto antarena ca mahāsamajjaṃ antarena ca janapadakalyāṇiyā pariharitabbo.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ
tameva

sandhi. that very; that same; just him; only that [taṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning that very; that same; just him; only that
Construction taṃ + eva
Sanskrit tam + eva

Examples

ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sakakammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.

DHP 240 malavaggo

yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭheyyuṃ, upanisīdeyyuṃ, upanipajjeyyuṃ.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
tamevassa

sandhi. just that of him [taṃ + eva + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pron
Meaning just that of him
Construction taṃ + eva + assa
Variant tadevassa
Sanskrit tam + eva + asya

Example

y'āssa aparisuddhakāyasamācāratā na s'āssa tasmiṃ samaye manasi kātabbā. yā'pi'ssa aparisuddhavacīsamācāratā na sā'pi'ssa tasmiṃ samaye manasi kātabbā. yañ'ca kho so labhati kālena kālaṃ cetaso vivaraṃ cetaso pasādaṃ, tam'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye manasi kātabbaṃ.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
tamevūpekkhaṃ

sandhi. that very mental poise; that exact non-reactivity [taṃ + eva + upekkhā + aṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + fem
Meaning that very mental poise; that exact non-reactivity
Construction taṃ + eva + upekkhā + aṃ
Sanskrit tam + eva + upekṣā

Example

evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā y'āyaṃ upekkhā nānattā nānattasitā taṃ abhinivajjetvā, y'āyaṃ upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā yattha sabbaso lok'āmis'ūpādānā aparisesā nirujjhanti tam'ev'ūpekkhaṃ bhāveti.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
tamokāya

masc. mass of ignorance; mass of darkness [tamo + kāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mass of ignorance; mass of darkness
Construction tamo + kāya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tamaso + kāya)
Commentary (NIDD1a) tamokāyassa padālanan'ti avijjārāsissa viddhaṃsanaṃ.
Sanskrit tamas + kāya

Example

avijjāya tv'eva tamokāyassa asesavirāganirodho, santam'etaṃ padaṃ paṇītam'etaṃ padaṃ, yadidaṃ, sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṃ.

SN 48.50 āpaṇasuttaṃ
tamokkhandha

masc. mass of darkness; mountain of ignorance [tamo + khandha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mass of darkness; mountain of ignorance
Construction tamo + khandha
Variant tamokhandha
Commentary (SNa) tamokkhandho'ti avijjākkhandho.
tamokhandha

masc. mass of darkness; mountain of ignorance [tamo + khandha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mass of darkness; mountain of ignorance
Construction tamo + khandha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tamasā + khandha)
Variant tamokkhandha
Commentary (MNa) tamokhandhena āvuṭā'ti avijjārāsinā ajjhotthatā.
Sanskrit tamas + skandha

Example

paṭisotagāmiṃ nipuṇaṃ,
gambhīraṃ duddasaṃ aṇuṃ,
rāgarattā na dakkhanti,
tamokhandhena āvuṭā'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
tamojotiparāyana

adj. who is dark destined for light [tamo + jotiparāyana] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is dark destined for light
Construction tamo + jotiparāyana
Commentary (ANt) tamojotiparāyaṇo puññaphalāni anupajīvanto eva puññāni karotī'ti pubbakārī'ti vutto. puññaphalaṃ upajīvanto hi kataññupakkhe tiṭṭhati.
tamotamaparāyana

adj. who is dark destined for darkness [tamo + tamaparāyana] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is dark destined for darkness
Construction tamo + tamaparāyana
tamotamasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.85 (AN4.85) ✗
tamonuda

adj. who dispels the darkness; who removes ignorance [tamo + nuda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who dispels the darkness; who removes ignorance
Construction tamo + nuda
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (tamaṃ + nuda)
Commentary (ITIa) sakaparasantānesu tamasaṅkhātaṃ moh'andhakāraṃ nudi khipī'ti tamonudo.
Sanskrit tamonuda

Examples

tamonudaṃ pāragataṃ mahesiṃ,
taṃ pattipattaṃ vasimaṃ anāsavaṃ,
visan'taraṃ taṇhakkhaye vimuttaṃ,
taṃ ve muniṃ antimadehadhāriṃ,
mārañ'jahaṃ brūmi jarāya pāraguṃ.

ITI 38 vitakkasuttaṃ

gandhatelappadittena,
dīpena tamadhaṃsinā,
tilokadīpaṃ sambuddhaṃ,
pūjayāmi tamonudaṃ.

buddhavandana pūjāgāthā
tampi

sandhi. that too; he too; even that; just that; that very thing [taṃ + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning that too; he too; even that; just that; that very thing
Construction taṃ + api
Antonym yampi
Sanskrit tam + api

Examples

yam'p'idaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkham'asukhaṃ vā tam'pi suññaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā.

SN 35.85 suññatalokasuttaṃ

yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ, anuvicaritaṃ manasā tam'pi etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti samanupassati

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
tampissa

sandhi. that indeed for him; that indeed of that [taṃ + api + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pron
Meaning that indeed for him; that indeed of that
Construction taṃ + api + assa
Antonym yampissa
Sanskrit tam + api + asmai

Examples

yam'pi'ssa kām'ūpasaṃhitaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ, tam'pi'ssa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti. yam'pi'ssa kām'ūpasaṃhitaṃ sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, tam'pi'ssa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.

AN 5.176 pītisuttaṃ

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye bhikkhu vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati, yam'pi'ssa pemā pemaṃ jāyati tam'pi'ssa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti

tammaya

adj. (+loc) identified (with); lit. made of that [taṃ + maya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning identified (with); lit. made of that
Construction taṃ + maya
Antonym atammaya
Commentary (MNa) no ca tena tammayo'ti tena'pi c'āhaṃ parisuddhena sīlena na tammayo, na sataṇho, parisuddhasīlattāva nittaṇho'ham'asmī'ti dīpeti.
Sanskrit tanmaya

Example

byākaramāno, bhikkhave, tathāgato evaṃ byākareyya, ye vodātā cakkhusotaviññeyyā dhammā, saṃvijjanti te tathāgatassa, etaṃpatho'ham'asmi, etaṃgocaro, no ca tena tammayo'ti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
tammayaṃ

sandhi. we (worship) that [taṃ + mayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning we (worship) that
Construction taṃ + mayaṃ

Example

tam'mayaṃ bhagavantaṃ sadhammaṃ sasaṅghaṃ, imehi sakkārehi yath'ārahaṃ āropitehi abhipūjayāma

Thai

tamhā

pron. from that [ta + mhā] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt abl sg of ta
Meaning from that
Construction ta + mhā
Synonym tasmā
Sanskrit tasmāt

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno yaṃ nimittaṃ āgamma yaṃ nimittaṃ manasikaroto uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā vitakkā chand'ūpasaṃhitā'pi dos'ūpasaṃhitā'pi moh'ūpasaṃhitā'pi, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tamhā nimittā aññaṃ nimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ kusal'ūpasaṃhitaṃ.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sakamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā ciravippavuttho assa. so aññataraṃ purisaṃ passeyya tamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā acirapakkantaṃ.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
tamhi 1

pron. in it; in that [ta + mhi] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt loc sg of ta
Meaning in it; in that
Construction ta + mhi
Sanskrit tasmin

Examples

pāpañ'ce puriso kayirā,
na naṃ kayirā punappunaṃ,
na tamhi chandaṃ kayirātha,
dukkho pāpassa uccayo.

DHP 117 pāpavaggo

katamā ca, bhikkhave, jāti? yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhi tamhi sattanikāye jāti sañjāti okkanti abhinibbatti khandhānaṃ pātubhāvo āyatanānaṃ paṭilābho, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, jāti.

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
tamhi 2

pron. (gram) before that [ta + mhi] ~

Grammar pron, masc and nt loc sg of ta
Meaning (gram) before that
Construction ta + mhi
Synonym tasmiṃ
Sanskrit tasmin
tamhuddhaṭe

sandhi. when that is removed [tamhi + uddhaṭe] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pp
Meaning when that is removed
Construction tamhi + uddhaṭe
Commentary (THIa) tamh'uddhaṭe tantikhīlake'ti ... tamhi tantimhi khīlake ca ṭhānato uddhaṭe
Sanskrit te + uddhṛte

Example

tamh'uddhaṭe tantikhīlake,
vissaṭṭhe vikale parikrite,
na vindeyya khaṇḍaso kate,
kimhi tattha manaṃ nivesaye.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
taya

nt. triad; group of three [ti + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from ti
Meaning triad; group of three
Construction ti > tay + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Synonym tika
Sanskrit traya

Example

sahā'v'assa dassanasampadāya,
tayassu dhammā jahitā bhavanti,
sakkāyadiṭṭhi vicikicchitañ'ca,
sīlabbataṃ v'āpi yadatthi kiñci.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
tayassu

sandhi. exactly three [taya + ssu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning exactly three
Construction taya + ssu
Sanskrit traya + svid

Example

sahā'v'assa dassanasampadāya,
tayassu dhammā jahitā bhavanti,
sakkāyadiṭṭhi vicikicchitañ'ca,
sīlabbataṃ v'āpi yadatthi kiñci.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
tayā 1

pron. by you; with you [tvaṃ + ayā] ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd instr sg of tvaṃ
Meaning by you; with you
Construction tvaṃ + ayā
Variant te
Sanskrit tvayā

Examples

sabbattha te citta vaco kataṃ mayā,
bahūsu jātīsu na me'si kopito,
ajjhattasambhavo kataññutāya te,
dukkhe ciraṃ saṃsaritaṃ tayā kate.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

dujjānaṃ kho etaṃ, mahārāja, tayā gihinā kāmabhoginā puttasambādhasayanaṃ ajjhāvasantena kāsikacandanaṃ paccanubhontena mālāgandhavilepanaṃ dhārayantena jātarūparajataṃ sādiyantena, ime vā arahanto, ime vā arahattamaggaṃ samāpannā'ti.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
tayā 2

pron. from you; than you [tvaṃ + ayā] ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd abl sg of tvaṃ
Meaning from you; than you
Construction tvaṃ + ayā
Variant tvāya
Sanskrit tvasyāḥ

Examples

evam'pi kho ahaṃ, brahme, n'eva te samasamo abhiññāya, kuto nīceyyaṃ? atha kho aham'eva tayā bhiyyo.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

ahaṃ tava vas'ānugo siyaṃ,
yadi viharemase kānan'antare,
na hi m'atthi tayā piyattaro,
pāṇo kinnarimandalocane.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
tayāmhi

sandhi. by you I am [tayā + amhi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pr
Meaning by you I am
Construction tayā + amhi
Sanskrit tvayā + asmi

Examples

bahūni vassāni tay'āmhi yācito,
agāravāsena alaṃ nu te idaṃ,
taṃ dāni maṃ pabbajitaṃ samānaṃ,
kiṃkāraṇā citta tuvaṃ na yuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

nanu ahaṃ citta tay'āmhi yācito,
giribbaje citrachadā vihaṅgamā,
mahindaghosatthanit'ābhigajjino,
te taṃ ramessanti vanamhi jhāyinaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
tayi

pron. in you; on you [tvaṃ] ✗
tayidaṃ

sandhi. that so; that like this; exactly that [ta + idaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + adv
Meaning that so; that like this; exactly that
Construction ta + [y] + idaṃ
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit taḥ + idam

Examples

ta'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujan'āhitāya bahujan'āsukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.

AN 2.40 samacittavaggo

santi loke munayo,
janā vadanti ta'y'idaṃ kathaṃsu,
ñāṇ'ūpapannaṃ no muniṃ vadanti,
udāhu ve jīviten'ūpapannaṃ.

SNP 62 nanda māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 7
tayo 1

Meaning three (3)

yathā brahmā tathā eko,
yathā devo tathā duve,
yathā gāmo tathā tayo,
kolāhalaṃ tat'uttarin'ti.

tayo vihārā dibbo vihāro brahmā vihāro ariyo vihāro

tayo'me, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ. katame tayo?

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
tara 1

adj. crossing; going beyond; passing; surpassing [√tar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from tarati
Meaning crossing; going beyond; passing; surpassing
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym atiga
Sanskrit tara
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu,
mogharāja sadā sato,
att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca,
evaṃ maccutaro siyā,
evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ,
maccurājā na passatī'ti.

SNP 70 mogharāja māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 15

sabbadā sīlasampanno,
paññavā susamāhito,
āraddhavīriyo pahit'atto,
oghaṃ tarati duttaraṃ.

SN 2.15 candanasuttaṃ
tara 2

suffix. more; -er [√tar + a] ✓

Grammar suffix, compar adj, from tarati
Meaning more; -er
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit tara
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

amatamhi vijjamāne,
kiṃ tava pañcakaṭukena pītena,
sabbā hi kāmaratiyo,
kaṭukatarā pañcakaṭukena.

THI 73 sumedhātherīgāthā

ahañ'c'eva kho pana yādisake kāme ohāya agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito t'ādisake vā kāme pariyeseyyaṃ tato vā pāpiṭṭhatare, na m'etaṃ patirūpan'ti.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ
tara 3

adj. kind of; type of [√tar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from tarati
Meaning kind of; type of
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit tara
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

varam'assatarā dantā,
ājānīyā ca sindhavā,
kuñjarā ca mahānāgā,
attadanto tato varaṃ.

DHP 322 nāgavaggo

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ udakarahade mahākummakulaṃ ciranivāsī ahosi.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ
taraṅga

masc. wave; lit. going across [taraṃ + ga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wave; lit. going across
Construction taraṃ + ga
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (taraṃ + ga)
Synonym ūmi
Sanskrit taraṃga

Example

ākhyātasāgaram'ath'ajjatanītaraṅgaṃ,
dhātujjalaṃ vikaraṇ'āgamakālamīnaṃ,
lop'ānubandh'ariyam'atthavibhāgatīraṃ,
dhīrā taranti kavino puthubuddhināvā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa, paṭhamakaṇḍa
taraccha

masc. hyena ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning hyena
Sanskrit tarakṣu

Examples

sārambhaṃ nāma ... dīpīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, acchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, taracchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, yesaṃ kesañci tiracchānagatānaṃ pāṇānaṃ āsayo hoti, pubb'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, apar'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

catuppadānan'ti sīhā byagghā dīpi acchā taracchā kokā mahiṃsā hatthī.

NIDD1 16 sāriputta suttaniddeso
taracchavighāsa

masc. remains of a hyena kill; hyena's leftovers [taraccha + vighāsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning remains of a hyena kill; hyena's leftovers
Construction taraccha + vighāsa
taraṇa

nt. crossing; going across; going beyond [√tar + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from tarati
Meaning crossing; going across; going beyond
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.3.8) aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāyā'ti ṭhapetvā tiriyaṃ taraṇaṃ but (VINa) tiriyaṃ taraṇāyā'ti upayogatthe nissakkavacanaṃ.
Sanskrit taraṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 28 nāvābhiruhanasikkhāpadaṃ

buddho so bhagavā bodhāya dhammaṃ deseti, danto so bhagavā damathāya dhammaṃ deseti, santo so bhagavā samathāya dhammaṃ deseti, tiṇṇo so bhagavā taraṇāya dhammaṃ deseti, parinibbuto so bhagavā parinibbānāya dhammaṃ desetī'ti

MN 35 cūḷa saccakasuttaṃ
taraṇī

fem. ship, boat [√tar] ✗
taraṇīya

ptp. crossable [√tar] ✗
tarati 1

pr. (+acc) crosses; goes through [√tar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning crosses; goes through
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Base √tar + a > tara
Construction tara + ti
Commentary (SNa) tareyyā'ti ettha tebhūmakavaṭṭaṃ samatikkamanto nibbānaṃ paṭivijjhanto taratī'ti paṭivedhataraṇaṃ nāma vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit tarati
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6

eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
tarati 2

pr. is in a hurry [√tar] ✗
tarathetaṃ

sandhi. cross over this! go through this! [taratha + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + pron
Meaning cross over this! go through this!
Construction taratha + etaṃ

Example

yāya devā manussā ca,
sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti,
nirayamhi samappitā.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10
taranta

prp. crossing or passing over [√tar] ✗
taramāna 1.1

prp. (+acc) crossing; going through [√tar + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of tarati, trans (+acc)
Meaning crossing; going through
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Base √tar + a > tara
Construction tara + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Antonym ataramāna
Sanskrit taramāṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

gunnaṃ ce taramānānaṃ,
jimhaṃ gacchati puṅgavo,
sabbā tā jimhaṃ gacchanti,
nette jimhaṃ gate sati.

AN 4.70 adhammikasuttaṃ
taramāna 2.1

prp. hurrying; quickly [√tar + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of tarati, intrans
Meaning hurrying; quickly
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (hurry)
√ In Comps tar or ttar
Base √tar + a > tara
Construction tara + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Antonym ataramāna
Sanskrit tvaramāṇa
Sanskrit Root √tvar 1 (hasten)

Examples

ataramāno'va bhāseyya no taramāno'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ?

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

tatra, bhikkhave, taramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi kilamati, cittam'pi upahaññati, saro'pi upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi āturīyati, avisaṭṭham'pi hoti aviññeyyaṃ taramānassa bhāsitaṃ.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
taramānarūpa

adj. in a great hurry; hurrying quickly; hurriedly; lit. hurrying form [taramāna + rūpa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in a great hurry; hurrying quickly; hurriedly; lit. hurrying form
Construction taramāna + rūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (taramāna + rūpa)
Sanskrit tvara

Examples

atha kho bāhiyo dārucīriyo taramānarūpo jetavanā nikkhamitvā sāvatthiṃ pavisitvā addasa bhagavantaṃ sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carantaṃ

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

atha kho rāhu asurindo candimaṃ devaputtaṃ muñcitvā taramānarūpo yena vepacitti asurindo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā saṃviggo lomahaṭṭhajāto ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

SN 2.9 candimasuttaṃ
tarayati

pr. hurries past; flies by; races past quickly [√tar + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of tarati, intrans
Meaning hurries past; flies by; races past quickly
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 *aya (hurry)
√ In Comps tar or ttar
Base √tar + *aya > tāraya > taraya (caus, irreg)
Construction taraya + ti
Commentary (SNa) tarayanti rattiyo'ti rattiyo atikkamamānā puggalaṃ maraṇ'ūpagamanāya tarayanti sīghaṃ sīghaṃ gamayanti.
Sanskrit tvarayati
Sanskrit Root √tvar 1 (hasten)

Example

accenti kālā tarayanti rattiyo,
vayoguṇā anupubbaṃ jahanti,
etaṃ bhayaṃ maraṇe pekkhamāno,
puññāni kayirātha sukh'āvahānī'ti.

tarala

taritar

masc. who passes or crosses over [√tar] ✗
taritukāma

adj. (+acc) wanting to cross (over) [tarituṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+acc)
Meaning wanting to cross (over)
Construction tarituṃ + kāma

Sanskrit taritum + kāma

Example

seyyathā'pi, sāḷha, puriso nadiṃ taritu'kāmo tiṇhaṃ kuṭhāriṃ ādāya vanaṃ paviseyya. so tattha passeyya mahatiṃ sālalaṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ navaṃ akukkuccakajātaṃ.

AN 4.196 sāḷhasuttaṃ
tarituṃ

inf. (+acc) to cross; to cross over [√tar + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of tarati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to cross; to cross over
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar + ituṃ
Synonym tārituṃ
Sanskrit taritum
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sāḷha, bhabbo nu kho so puriso nadiṃ taritun'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante. taṃ kissa hetu? asu hi, bhante, sālalaṭṭhi bahiddhā suparikammakatā anto avisuddhā.

AN 4.196 sāḷhasuttaṃ

Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar + itvā
Sanskrit tīrtvā
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)
taru

masc. tree ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning tree
Synonym duma, mahiruha, pādapa, rukkha, viṭapī
Notes PED suggests from dāru
English Cognate tree
Sanskrit taru

Example

ropetva rukkhāni yathā phal'esī,
mūle taruṃ chettu tam'eva icchasi,
tath'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ karosi,
yaṃ maṃ aniccamhi cale niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
taruṇa 1

adj. young; immature [√tar + uṇa] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning young; immature
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar + uṇa
Derivative kita (uṇa)
Synonym komāraka
Sanskrit taruṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

tesaṃ'y'eva kho pana, bhikkhave, mahānāgānaṃ anusikkhamānā taruṇā bhiṅkacchāpā taṃ sarasiṃ ogāhetvā soṇḍāya bhisamuḷālaṃ abbuhetvā na suvikkhālitaṃ vikkhāletvā sakaddamaṃ asaṅkhāditvā ajjhoharanti.

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ iminā saṃkhittena ovādena ovaditvā pakkāmi. atha kho acirapakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.

VIN 1.2.3 duṭṭhullavācāsikkhāpadaṃ

s'āssa māluvālatā taruṇā mudukā lomasā vilambinī, sā taṃ sālaṃ upaniseveyya.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā

bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ licchavī sukhumālā mudutalāhatthapādā te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabimbohanāsu yāvasūriy'uggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.

SN 20.8 kaliṅgarasuttaṃ
tava 1

pron. to you; for you ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd dat sg of tvaṃ
Meaning to you; for you
Variant tuyhaṃ, te
Sanskrit tubhyam, te

Examples

yā me kaṅkhā pure āsi,
taṃ me byākāsi cakkhumā,
addhā munī'si sambuddho,
n'atthi nīvaraṇā tava.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci pāṇinā pahāraṃ dadeyya, leḍḍunā pahāraṃ dadeyya, daṇḍena pahāraṃ dadeyya, satthena pahāraṃ dadeyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
tava 2

pron. your; of you ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd gen sg of tvaṃ
Meaning your; of you
Variant tuyhaṃ, te
Sanskrit tava

Examples

kiṃ bhadante karitvāna,
ko vā ācariyo tava,
kassa sāsanam'āgamma,
labbhate taṃ asokatā.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

nānājanā janapadehi saṅgatā,
tava vīra vākyaṃ abhikaṅkhamānā,
tesaṃ tuvaṃ sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12
tavakaṇṇika

Meaning name of a lay disciple
Construction tava + kaṇṇika
Variant tapakaṇṇika
Commentary (ANa) tavakaṇṇiko'ti evaṃnāmako gahapati. tapakaṇṇiko'ti'pi pāḷi
tavagga

masc. (gram) t-series; group of dental consonants beginning with the letter t; t th d dh n [ta + vagga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) t-series; group of dental consonants beginning with the letter t; t th d dh n
Construction ta + vagga
Compound kammadhāraya (ta + vagga)
Sanskrit tavarga

Example

a kavagga hā kaṇṭhajā, i cavagga yā tālujā, u pavaggā oṭṭhajā, ṭavagga ra ḷā muddhajā, tavagga la sā dantajā, e kaṇṭhatālujo, o kaṇṭh'oṭṭhajo, vo dant'oṭṭhajo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
tave

suffix. (infinitive suffix) to ✓

Grammar suffix, inf
Meaning (infinitive suffix) to
Variant -tuṃ
Sanskrit tave

Examples

vārijo'va thale khitto,
okam'okata'ubbhato,
pariphandat'idaṃ cittaṃ,
māradheyyaṃ pahātave.

DHP 34 cittavaggo

atha tvaṃ pavitakkam'āgamā,
manasā diṭṭhigatāni cintayanto,
dhonena yugaṃ samāgamā,
na hi tvaṃ sakkhasi sampayātave'ti.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
taveva

sandhi. only your; your alone [tava + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning only your; your alone
Construction tava + eva
Sanskrit tava + eva

Examples

tvaññ'eva no citta karosi brāhmaṇo,
tvaṃ khattiyo rājadasī karosi,
vessā ca suddā ca bhavāma ekadā,
devattanaṃ v'āpi tav'eva vāhasā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

tav'eva hetū asurā bhavāmase,
tvaṃmūlakaṃ nerayikā bhavāmase,
atho tiracchānagatā'pi ekadā,
petattanaṃ v'āpi tav'eva vāhasā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
tasa

adj. moving; mobile; (comm) with craving; lit. shaking [√tas + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from tasati
Meaning moving; mobile; (comm) with craving; lit. shaking
Root Family √tas
Root √tas･1 a (tremble, fear)
√ In Comps ttas
Construction √tas + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym thāvara
Synonym jaṅgama, jaṅgala
Commentary (MNa) tasā vuccanti sataṇhā, thāvarā nittaṇhā. (KPa) tasantī'ti tasā, sataṇhānaṃ sabhayānañ'c'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tiṭṭhantī'ti thāvarā, pahīnataṇh'ābhayānaṃ arahataṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit trasta
Sanskrit Root √tras 1 (be terrified)

Examples

nidhāya daṇḍaṃ bhūtesu,
tasesu thāvaresu ca,
yo na hanti na ghāteti,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 405 brāhmaṇavaggo

ye keci pāṇabhūt'atthi,
tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā y'eva mahantā vā,
majjhimā rassakā aṇukathūlā.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
tasati 1

pr. (+gen) is afraid (of); fears [√tas + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+gen)
Meaning is afraid (of); fears
Root Family √tas
Root √tas･1 a (tremble, fear)
√ In Comps ttas
Base √tas + a > tasa
Construction tasa + ti
Synonym bhāyati, bheti
Sanskrit trasati
Sanskrit Root √tras 1 (be terrified)

Examples

sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa,
sabbe bhāyanti maccuno,
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā,
na haneyya na ghātaye.

DHP 129 daṇḍavaggo

sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa,
sabbesaṃ jīvitaṃ piyaṃ,
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā,
na haneyya na ghātaye.

DHP 130 daṇḍavaggo
tasati 2

pr. thirsts; is thirsty; craves [√tas + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning thirsts; is thirsty; craves
Root Family √tas
Root √tas･6 a (thirst)
Base √tas + a > tasa (irreg)
Construction tasa + ti
Variant taṇhīyati
Sanskrit tṛṣyati
Sanskrit Root √tṛṣ 4 (be thirsty)

Example

ko nu kho, bhante, tasatī'ti? no kallo pañho'ti bhagavā avoca, tasatī'ti ahaṃ na vadāmi.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ
tasathāvara

masc. frail and firm; moving and unmoving; animals and vegetables; unenlightened and enlightened; all living beings; (comm) with and without craving; lit. trembling and steady [tasa + thāvara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning frail and firm; moving and unmoving; animals and vegetables; unenlightened and enlightened; all living beings; (comm) with and without craving; lit. trembling and steady
Construction tasa + thāvara
Compound dvanda (tasāni ca thāvarāni ca)
Commentary (MNa) tasā vuccanti sataṇhā, thāvarā nittaṇhā. (KPa) tasantī'ti tasā, sataṇhānaṃ sabhayānañ'c'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tiṭṭhantī'ti thāvarā, pahīnataṇh'ābhayānaṃ arahataṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit trasta + sthāvara

Examples

theyyaṃ na kāre na musā bhaṇeyya,
mettāya phasse tasathāvarāni,
yadāvilattaṃ manaso vijaññā,
kaṇhassa pakkho'ti vinodayeyya.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

virato methunā dhammā,
hitvā kāme paropare,
aviruddho asāratto,
pāṇesu tasathāvare.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
tasanta

prp. trembling [√tas] ✗
tasara

nt. shuttle ✗
tasi

aor. trembled [√tas] ✗
tasiṇā

fem. craving; wanting; desire; lit. thirst [√tas + inā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from taṇhā
Meaning craving; wanting; desire; lit. thirst
Root Family √tas
Root √tas･6 ṇhā (thirst)
Construction √tas + inā

Synonym taṇhā
Variant tasinā
Sanskrit tṛṣṇā
Sanskrit Root √tṛṣ 4 (be thirsty)

Examples

tasiṇāya purakkhatā pajā,
parisappanti saso'va bādhito,
saṃyojanasaṅgasattakā,
dukkham'upenti punappunaṃ cirāya.

DHP 342 taṇhāvaggo

tasiṇāya purakkhatā pajā,
parisappanti saso'va bandhito.
tasmā tasiṇaṃ vinodaye,
bhikkhu ākaṅkha'virāgam'attano.

manussasaddo viya suyyati, jānissāma nan'ti saddānusārena gantvā taṃ purisaṃ disvā, yakkho bhavissatī'ti bhītatasitā sare sannayhiṃsu

tasita 2.1

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

puratthimāya ce'pi disāya puriso āgaccheyya ghamm'ābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito.

tasināsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.171 (SN45.171) ✗
tasmā 1

pron. from that [ta + smā] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt abl sg of ta
Meaning from that
Construction ta + smā
Synonym tamhā
Sanskrit tvasmāt

Examples

no ce āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇāti ten'eva dhammarāgena tāya dhammanandiyā pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā

MN 64 mahāmālukyasuttaṃ

aññāya ca pan'āhaṃ samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtikānaṃ dhammaṃ ev'āhaṃ tasmā dhammavinayā apakkanto'ti.

AN 3.65 sarabhasuttaṃ
tasmā 2

ind. therefore; that is why; lit. from that [ta + smā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of ta
Meaning therefore; that is why; lit. from that
Construction ta + smā
Antonym yasmā
Sanskrit tasmāt

Examples

kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, suñño loko'ti vuccatī'ti? yasmā ca kho, ānanda, suññaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā tasmā suñño loko'ti vuccati.

SN 35.85 suññatalokasuttaṃ

yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
tasmātiha

sandhi. therefore here; therefore in this regard [tasmā + iha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + adv
Meaning therefore here; therefore in this regard
Construction tasmā + [t] + iha
Phonetic Change +t
Commentary (VINt) tasmā't'ihā'ti tasmā icc'eva vuttaṃ hoti ... ti-kāra ha-kārā nipātā. ihā'ti vā imasmiṃ sāsane, ta-kāro padasandhivasena āgato.
Sanskrit tasmāt + iha

Examples

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ rūpaṃ, n'etaṃ mama, n'eso'ham'asmi, na m'eso attā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ

daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tasmā't'iha vo, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā no sati bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
tasmiṃ khaṇe

idiom. at that moment ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + masc, loc abs
Meaning at that moment
Synonym tena khaṇena
Sanskrit tasmin + kṣaṇe

Example

tasmiṃ khaṇe jeṭṭhapesakārassa bhariyā kenaci'd'eva karaṇīyena bārāṇasiṃ gacchantī te paccekabuddhe disvā vanditvā

DHPa 1.6.4 mahākappinatthera vatthu
tasmiṃ 1

pron. in that; in that person [ta + asmiṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, loc sg of ta
Meaning in that; in that person
Construction ta + asmiṃ
Sanskrit tasmin

Examples

sabbattha munī anissito,
na piyaṃ kubbati no'pi appiyaṃ,
tasmiṃ paridevamaccharaṃ,
paṇṇe vāri yathā na limpati.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6

tasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, yaññe n'eva gāvo haññiṃsu, na aj'eḷakā haññiṃsu, na kukkuṭasūkarā haññiṃsu, na vividhā pāṇā saṃghātaṃ āpajjiṃsu, na rukkhā chijjiṃsu yūpatthāya, na dabbhā lūyiṃsu barihisatthāya.

idiom. in that place ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + nt, loc abs
Meaning in that place

Example

evaṃ so tasmiṃ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
tasmiṃ 3

pron. (gram) before that [ta + asmiṃ] ~

Grammar pron, loc sg of ta, loc abs
Meaning (gram) before that
Construction ta + asmiṃ
Synonym tamhi
Sanskrit tasmin

idiom. then; on that occasion; at that time ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + masc, loc abs
Meaning then; on that occasion; at that time
Antonym yasmiṃ samaye
Sanskrit tasmin + samaye

Examples

SN 22.81 pālileyyasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
tasmiṃ 4

Grammar pron, loc sg of ta, loc abs
Meaning in that case; in that situation
Construction ta + asmiṃ
Sanskrit tasmin

Example

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ ūnavīsativassaṃ puggalaṃ upasampādeyya, so ca puggalo anupasampanno, te ca bhikkhū gārayhā, idaṃ tasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 65 ūnavīsativassasikkhāpadaṃ

Meaning under that; under him
Construction ta + asmiṃ
Sanskrit tasmin

Example

tasmiṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ carāma, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpannā

Thai

tasmiṃyeva

sandhi. in that very; in that exact [tasmiṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning in that very; in that exact
Construction tasmiṃ + [y] + eva
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit tasmin + eva

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva yasassa kulaputtassa tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti.

VIN 4.1.7 pabbajjākathā

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, tassā'y'eva kathāya pariyosāne, tasmiṃ'y'eva purimasmiṃ samādhinimitte ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṃ karomi samādahāmi, yena sudaṃ niccakappaṃ viharāmī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

idiom. in that very seat [tasmiṃ + eva + āsane] ✓

Meaning in that very seat
Construction tasmiṃ + [y] + eva + āsane
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit tasmin + eva + āsane

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva yasassa kulaputtassa tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti.

VIN 4.1.7 pabbajjākathā
tassa evamassa

idiom. the thought might occur to him; lit. to him this may be [tassa + evaṃ + assa] ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + ind + opt
Meaning the thought might occur to him; lit. to him this may be
Construction tassa + evaṃ + assa

Examples

tassa evam'assa, idaṃ kho parittaṃ gopade udakaṃ. sac'āhaṃ añjalinā vā pivissāmi bhājanena vā khobhessāmi'pi taṃ loḷessāmi'pi taṃ apeyyam'pi taṃ karissāmi.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

tassa evam'assa ahaṃ kho pubbe iṇaṃ ādāya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
tassa evaṃ hoti

idiom. he thought; it occurred to him; lit. it is like this to him ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + ind + pr
Meaning he thought; it occurred to him; lit. it is like this to him

Examples

tassa evaṃ hoti, sace maṃ koci kiñci vakkhati, ime me rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇissantī'ti.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

tassa evaṃ hoti, ucchijjissāmi nāmassu, vinassissāmi nāmassu, nassu nāma bhavissāmī'ti

tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti

Meaning of this or that; of whichever

puccha maṃ sabhiya pañhaṃ,

tassa tass'eva pañhassa,

taṇhā hi naṃ sibbati tassa tass'eva bhavassa abhinibbattiyā.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ
tassa 3

pron. when he; when it; lit. of that [ta + ssa] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt gen sg of ta, gen abs
Meaning when he; when it; lit. of that
Construction ta + ssa
Sanskrit tvasya

Examples

tassa sabbehi imehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi visuddham'attānaṃ samanupassato, vimuttam'attānaṃ samanupassato, pāmojjaṃ jāyati, pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedeti, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.

kāmaṃ kāmayamānassa,
tassa ce taṃ samijjhati,
addhā pītimano hoti,
laddhā macco yadicchati.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1
tassa 4

ind. therefore; thus; so; because of that; regarding that; lit. of that [ta + ssa] ✓
