Meaning therefore; thus; so; because of that; regarding that; lit. of that
Construction ta + ssa
Synonym tato, tathā
Sanskrit tvasya

Examples

tassa te, āvuso, alābhā, tassa te dulladdhaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamānena na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karosī'ti, idaṃ tasmiṃ mohanake pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 73 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ

tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
tassattho

sandhi. the meaning of that is [tassa + attho] ~

Grammar sandhi, pron + masc
Meaning the meaning of that is
Construction tassa + attho
Sanskrit tvasya + arthaḥ
tassapāpiyasakā

fem. proceeding of censure (against a monk accused of a serious offense who prevaricates or denies the offense; one of the methods of settling a case or dispute) ✗
tassapāpiyasakākamma

nt. formal act of the saṅgha authorizing censure ✗
tassapāpiyasakākammakata

adj. dealt with a tassapāpiyasakā formal act of the saṅgha ✗
tassapāpiyasikakammakata

adj. prosecutued with intractability; convicted of aggravated misconduct [tassapāpiyasikā + kammakata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning prosecutued with intractability; convicted of aggravated misconduct
Construction tassapāpiyasikā + kammakata
Sanskrit tatsvabhāvaiṣīya (bsk) + karma + kṛta

Example

tassapāpiyasikakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā aṭṭhasu dhammesu sammā vattitabbaṃ, na upasampādetabbo, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo, na bhikkhun'ovādakasammuti sāditabbā, sammaten'api bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā, na kāci saṅghasammuti sāditabbā, na kismiñci paccekaṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbo, na ca tena mūlena vuṭṭhāpetabbo.

AN 8.90 sammāvattanasuttaṃ
tassapāpiyasikā

fem. (vinaya) verdict of recalcitrance; intractability; lit. according to worse for him [tassa + pāpiya + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning (vinaya) verdict of recalcitrance; intractability; lit. according to worse for him
Construction tassa + pāpiya + [s] + ikā
tassapāpiya + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Phonetic Change +s
Commentary (ANa) pāp'ussannassa puggalassa niggaṇhan'atthaṃ tassapāpiyasikā paññattā.
Notes (BMC) acting for his further punishment
Sanskrit tatsvabhāvaiṣīya (bsk)

Example

uppann'uppannānaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ samathāya vūpasamāya sammukhāvinayo dātabbo, sativinayo dātabbo, amūḷhavinayo dātabbo, paṭiññāya kāretabbaṃ, yebhuyyasikā, tassapāpiyasikā, tiṇ'avatthārako'ti.

VIN PAT AS adhikaraṇasamathā
tassapi

sandhi. even his; his too [tassa + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning even his; his too
Construction tassa + api
Sanskrit tvasya + api

Example

yo ca khv'āyaṃ, gahapati, bhikkhu saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpanno, tassa'pi kāyasaṅkhāro niruddho paṭippassaddho, vacīsaṅkhāro niruddho paṭippassaddho, cittasaṅkhāro niruddho paṭippassaddho, āyu aparikkhīṇo, usmā avūpasantā, indriyāni vippasannāni.

SN 41.6 dutiyakāmabhūsuttaṃ
tassabbhantara

nt. inside of him [tassa + abbhantara] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning inside of him
Construction tassa + abbhantara
tassassu

sandhi. of that there would be [tassa + assu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + opt
Meaning of that there would be
Construction tassa + assu
Sanskrit tvasya + syuḥ

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gaṇḍo anekavassagaṇiko. tass'assu gaṇḍassa nava vaṇamukhāni nava abhedanamukhāni. tato yaṃ kiñci pagghareyya, asuci'y'eva pagghareyya, duggandhaṃ'y'eva pagghareyya, jegucchiyaṃ'y'eva pagghareyya.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, silāyūpo soḷasa kukkuko. tass'assu aṭṭha kukku heṭṭhā nemaṅ'gamā, aṭṭha kukku uparinemassa.

SN 56.40 vādatthikasuttaṃ
tassaṃ

pron. in that [ta + ssaṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, fem loc sg of ta
Meaning in that
Construction ta + ssaṃ
Sanskrit tasyām

Examples

tena kho pana samayena maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti. atha kho maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi taṃ parisaṃ etadavoca, mā ayyā evaṃ avacuttha.

SN 42.10 maṇicūḷakasuttaṃ

yadā, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ pātubhavati, na tassaṃ parisāyaṃ koci devo abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti.

DN 18.5 janavasabhasuttaṃ
tassā 1

pron. to her; for her; to that; for that [ta + ssā] ✓

Grammar pron, fem dat sg of ta
Meaning to her; for her; to that; for that
Construction ta + ssā
Synonym assā
Sanskrit tāyai

Example

tassā evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ
tassā 2

pron. of her; hers; of that [ta + ssā] ✓

Grammar pron, fem gen sg of ta
Meaning of her; hers; of that
Construction ta + ssā
Sanskrit tāyāḥ

Examples

ayaṃ me mātā, tassā me mātu ayaṃ mātā'ti, apariyādinnā'va bhikkhave, tassa purisassa mātumātaro assu, atha imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.

SN 15.1 tiṇakaṭṭhasuttaṃ

accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, y'āhaṃ evam'akāsiṃ. tassā me, bhante, ayyo ānando accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā'ti.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ
tassā rattiyā accayena

idiom. after the passing of that night; on the following day ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + fem + ind
Meaning after the passing of that night; on the following day

Examples

atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi, kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan'ti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

so tassā rattiyā accayena pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya yena tassa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā nivesanaṃ ten'upasaṅkamati, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdati.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
tassānubhāvena

sandhi. by the majesty of that ✗
tassānuyanta

adj. following him; subordinate to him [tassa + anuyanta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning following him; subordinate to him
Construction tassa + anuyanta
tassānuyutta

adj. devoted to him; obedient to him [tassa + anuyutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to him; obedient to him
Construction tassa + anuyutta
tassānusāsaniguṇābhirata

adj. taking pleasure in the divisions of that instruction [tassā + anusāsanī + guṇa + abhirata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking pleasure in the divisions of that instruction
Construction tassā + anusāsanī + guṇa + abhirata
tassāyeva

sandhi. of that very; of that exact; of that [tassā + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning of that very; of that exact; of that
Construction tassā + [y] + eva
Phonetic Change +y
Synonym tasseva
Sanskrit tāyāḥ + eva

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, dukkhanirodhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ? yo tassā'y'eva taṇhāya asesavirāganirodho cāgo paṭinissaggo mutti anālayo

DN 22.17 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, tassā'y'eva kathāya pariyosāne, tasmiṃ'y'eva purimasmiṃ samādhinimitte ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṃ karomi samādahāmi, yena sudaṃ niccakappaṃ viharāmī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
tassāruppa

adj. suitable for that; appropriate for that [tad + sāruppa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning suitable for that; appropriate for that
Construction tad + sāruppa
Synonym tadupiya
Commentary (MNa) tajjaṃ tassāruppan'ti tajjātikaṃ tadanucchavikaṃ, pañcannaṃ verānaṃ diṭṭhadhammakasamparāyikaādīnavappaṭisaṃyuttan'ti adhippāyo.
tassāhaṃ 1

sandhi. of him I; his I [tassa + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning of him I; his I
Construction tassa + ahaṃ
Sanskrit tasya + aham

Examples

accāraddhamhi vīriyamhi,
satthā loke anuttaro,
vīṇ'opamaṃ karitvā me,
dhammaṃ desesi cakkhumā,
tass'āhaṃ vacanaṃ sutvā,
vihāsiṃ sāsane rato.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā

eso hi bhagavā buddho,
nadiṃ nerañjaraṃ pati,
sabbadukkhappahānāya,
dhammaṃ deseti pāṇinaṃ,
tass'āhaṃ santikaṃ gacchaṃ,
so me satthā bhavissati.

THI 68 ekudāniyattheragāthā
tassāhaṃ 2

sandhi. to him I ✗
tassimāni

sandhi. for him these [tassa + imāni] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning for him these
Construction tassa + imāni
Sanskrit tvasmai + imāni

Example

tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti, seyyath'idaṃ, cakkaratanaṃ, hatthiratanaṃ, assaratanaṃ, maṇiratanaṃ, itthiratanaṃ, gahapatiratanaṃ, pariṇāyakaratanam'eva sattamaṃ.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
tassime

sandhi. for him these [tassa + ime] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning for him these
Construction tassa + ime
Sanskrit tvasmai + ime

Examples

so rūpaṃ viññāṇaṃ upeti upādiyati adhiṭṭhāti attā me'ti. tass'ime pañc'upādānakkhandhā upetā upādinnā dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

tass'ime dhammā aññam'aññaṃ vipaccanīkā gahitā dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
tassimesu

sandhi. when he (is seeing rise and fall) in these [tassa + imesu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron, gen abs
Meaning when he (is seeing rise and fall) in these
Construction tassa + imesu
Sanskrit tvasmai + eṣu

Example

tass'imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassino viharato yo'pi'ssa hoti pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu anusahagato asmī'ti, māno asmī'ti, chando asmī'ti anusayo asamūhato, so'pi samugghātaṃ gacchati.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
tassīdha

sandhi. for that one here; for whom here [tassa + idha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + adv
Meaning for that one here; for whom here
Construction tassa + idha
Sanskrit tvasmai + iha

Examples

sīm'ātigo brāhmaṇo tassa n'atthi,
ñatvā va disvā va samuggahītaṃ,
na rāgarāgī na virāgaratto,
tass'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītan'ti.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4

tass'īdha diṭṭhe va sute mute vā,
pakappitā n'atthi aṇū'pi saññā,
taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ diṭṭhim'anādiyānaṃ,
ken'īdha lokasmiṃ vikappayeyya.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5
tassuttarato

sandhi. north of which [tassa + uttarato] ~

Grammar sandhi, pron + adj
Meaning north of which
Construction tassa + uttarato
tassuddānaṃ

sandhi. summary; a short verse given at the end of each vagga listing the titles or topics of the relevant suttas; lit. tying up of that [tassa + uddānaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + nt
Meaning summary; a short verse given at the end of each vagga listing the titles or topics of the relevant suttas; lit. tying up of that
Construction tassa + uddānaṃ
Sanskrit tvasya + uddānam

Examples

tass'uddānaṃ
moḷiyaphaggun'ariṭṭhañ'ca nāmo,
andhavane kathipuṇṇaṃ nivāpo,
rāsikaṇerumahāgajanāmo,
sārūpamo puna piṅgalakoccho.

MN 30 cūḷasāropamasuttaṃ

tass'uddānaṃ
kandaranāgarasekhavato ca,
potaliyo puna jīvakabhacco,
upālidamatho kukkurābhayo,
bahuvedanīyāpaṇṇakato dasamo.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
tassetaṃ

sandhi. for him this [tassa + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning for him this
Construction tassa + etaṃ
Sanskrit tvasmai + etam

Example

tatr'āvuso, yv'āyaṃ puggalo sāṅgaṇo'va samāno atthi me ajjhattaṃ aṅgaṇan'ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, tass'etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, na chandaṃ janessati na vāyamissati na vīriyaṃ ārabhissati tass'aṅgaṇassa pahānāya

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
tasseva 1

sandhi. just for him; even for him; just that alone [tassa + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning just for him; even for him; just that alone
Construction tassa + eva
Sanskrit tvasmai + eva

Examples

tass'eva tena pāpiyo,
yo kuddhaṃ paṭikujjhati,
kuddhaṃ appaṭikujjhanto,
saṅgāmaṃ jeti dujjayaṃ.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ

tass'eva kho pana pubbe aviddasuno abhijjhā hoti chando sārāgo. sv'āssa pahīno hoti ucchinnamūlo tāl'āvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
tasseva 2

sandhi. of that very; of that exact; of the same [tassa + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning of that very; of that exact; of the same
Construction tassa + eva
Synonym tassāyeva
Sanskrit tvasya + eva

Examples

tass'eva sukhavedaniyassa phassassa nirodhā yaṃ tajjaṃ vedayitaṃ sukhavedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppannā sukhā vedanā sā nirujjhati, sā vūpasammatī'ti pajānāti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, poṭṭhapāda, puriso nisseṇiṃ kareyya pāsādassa ārohaṇāya tass'eva pāsādassa heṭṭhā.

DN 9.7 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, tayo attapaṭilābhā
tassevanti

sandhi. like this for him [tassa + evaṃ + iti] ~

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + ind
Meaning like this for him
Construction tassa + evaṃ + iti
Commentary (ANa) na tass'evan'ti maññare'ti mayaṃ evaṃsantā evaṃsabhāvā'ti tassa na maññare, na maññantī'ti attho.
tassevaṃ 1

sandhi. of this in this way [tassa + evaṃ] ~

Grammar sandhi, pron + adv
Meaning of this in this way
Construction tassa + evaṃ
tassevaṃ 2

sandhi. when he like this [tassa + evaṃ] ~

Grammar sandhi, pron + adv
Meaning when he like this
Construction tassa + evaṃ
tassesā

sandhi. this his; this of that [tassa + esā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning this his; this of that
Construction tassa + esā
Sanskrit tvasya + eṣā

Example

tass'esā bhoto gotamassa seyyā paññattā'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
tahaṃ

ind. there; in that place [ta + haṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from ta
Meaning there; in that place
Construction ta + haṃ
Derivative taddhita (haṃ)
Synonym tattha, tatra, tahiṃ
Commentary (VINa) yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ olokento'ti yo taṃtaṃdisābhāgaṃ pāsādaṃ kūṭ'āgāraṃ vīthiṃ olokento gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
Sanskrit tatra

Examples

okkhittacakkhunā antaraghare gantabbaṃ yugamattaṃ pekkhantena. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ olokento antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tahaṃ tahaṃ olokentā piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhanti, ākirante'pi atikkante'pi na jānanti

VIN 2.7.3 khambhakatavaggo
tahaṃ tahaṃ

idiom. here and there; all around ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + adv
Meaning here and there; all around
Commentary (VINa) yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ olokento'ti yo taṃtaṃdisābhāgaṃ pāsādaṃ kūṭ'āgāraṃ vīthiṃ olokento gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
Sanskrit tatra + tatra

Examples

okkhittacakkhunā antaraghare gantabbaṃ yugamattaṃ pekkhantena. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ olokento antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tahaṃ tahaṃ olokentā piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhanti, ākirante'pi atikkante'pi na jānanti

VIN 2.7.3 khambhakatavaggo
tahiṃ

ind. there; in that place [ta + hiṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from ta
Meaning there; in that place
Construction ta + hiṃ
Derivative taddhita (hiṃ)
Synonym tattha, tatra, tahaṃ
Sanskrit tahi, tahiṃ (bsk)

Example

varāhaeṇeyyavigāḷhasevite,
pabbhārakuṭṭe pakat'eva sundare,
nav'ambunā pāvusasitthakānane,
tahiṃ guhāgehagato ramissasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
taḷa

masc. lake; reservoir ✗
taḷāka

nt. lake; pond; pool; dam ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning lake; pond; pool; dam
Synonym pallala
Sanskrit taḍaga, taḍāga, talaka

Example

saṅgho pabbatam'iva attānam'ācarati, pabbatāyati. taḷākaṃ samuddam'iva attānam'ācarati, samuddāyati, saddo cicciṭam'iva attānam'ācarati, cicciṭāyati, vasiṭṭhassa apaccaṃ vāsiṭṭho. evam'aññe'pi yojetabbā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 432
taṃ kissa hetu

idiom. what’s the reason for that?; why is that? ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + pron + masc, interr
Meaning what’s the reason for that?; why is that?

Examples

assutavā, bhikkhave, puthujjano imasmiṃ cātumahābhūtikasmiṃ kāyasmiṃ nibbindeyyapi virajjeyyapi vimucceyyapi. taṃ kissa hetu?

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

evaṃ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na c'eva sampāyissanti, uttariñ'ca vighātaṃ āpajjissanti. taṃ kissa hetu? yathā taṃ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṃ.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
taṃ kiṃ maññatha

idiom. what do you think? ✗
taṃ kiṃ maññasi

idiom. what do you think about that?; what's your opinion on this? ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + pron + pr, interr
Meaning what do you think about that?; what's your opinion on this?

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇattho, bhante'ti.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇaphalaṃ paritte udakamallake pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ parittaṃ udakaṃ amunā loṇaphalena loṇaṃ assa apeyyan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
taṃ kutettha labbhā

idiom. how could I think that?; what can be gained from that?; what can be done about that?; what’s the use of that? [taṃ + kuto + ettha + labbhā] ✓

Grammar idiom, interr, pron + adv + adv + ind
Meaning how could I think that?; what can be gained from that?; what can be done about that?; what’s the use of that?
Construction taṃ + kuto + ettha + labbhā
Variant taṃ kuto lābhā
Commentary (ANa) taṃ kutettha labbhā'ti, taṃ anatthacaraṇaṃ mā ahosī'ti etasmiṃ puggale kuto labbhā, kena kāraṇena sakkā laddhuṃ, paro nāma parassa attano cittaruciyā anatthaṃ karotī'ti evaṃ cintetvā āghātaṃ paṭivineti. atha vā sac'āhaṃ kopaṃ kareyyaṃ, taṃ kopakaraṇaṃ ettha puggale kuto labbhā, kena kāraṇena laddhabban'ti attho. kuto lābhā'ti'pi pāṭho. sac'āhaṃ ettha kopaṃ kareyyaṃ, tasmiṃ me kopakaraṇe kuto lābhā lābhā, nāma ke siyun'ti attho. imasmiñ'ca atthe tan'ti nipātamattam'eva hoti

Example

taṃ kut'ettha labbhā yaṃ me paro anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā abhiratiṃ uppādeyya

SN 8.2 aratisuttaṃ
taṃ 1.1

pron. it; that [ta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, nt nom sg of ta
Meaning it; that
Construction ta + aṃ
Antonym yaṃ
Variant naṃ, tad
Sanskrit tam

Examples

idha cunda ekacco anabhijjhālu hoti. yaṃ taṃ parassa paravitt'ūpakaraṇaṃ taṃ anabhijjhitā hoti, aho vata yaṃ parassa taṃ mamassā'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

tañ'hi tassa sakaṃ hoti,
tañ'ca ādāya gacchati,
tañ'c'assa anugaṃ hoti,
chāyā'va anapāyinī.

SN 3.20 dutiyāputtakasuttaṃ
taṃ 1.2

pron. him; her; one; that person; that thing [ta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc fem and nt acc sg of ta
Meaning him; her; one; that person; that thing
Construction ta + aṃ
Antonym yaṃ
Variant naṃ
Sanskrit tam

Examples

taṃ brūmi upasanto'ti,
kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
ganthā tassa na vijjanti,
atarī so visattikaṃ.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ, yā samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadā taṃ paṭipajjissāma.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
taṃ 2.1

pron. you (object) [tvaṃ + aṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd acc sg of tvaṃ
Meaning you (object)
Construction tvaṃ + aṃ
Variant tavaṃ, tumha, tuvaṃ, tvaṃ
Sanskrit tvam

Examples

cittasmiṃ vasībhūt'āmhi,
iddhipādā subhāvitā,
sabbabandhanamutt'āmhi,
na taṃ bhāyāmi āvuso'ti.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ

satiyā taṃ nibandhissaṃ,
payutto te damessāmi,
vīriyadhuraniggahito,
na yito dūraṃ gamissase cittā'ti.

TH 206 vijitasenattheragāthā
taṃ yathā

idiom. (gram) for example; lit. like that ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + adv
Meaning (gram) for example; lit. like that
Sanskrit tam + yathā

Examples

atha sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ yāni yāni pubbakāni cha padāni, tāni tāni parassapadasaññāni honti. taṃ yathā? ti anti, si tha, mi ma.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 406

taṃ yathā? ti anti iti paṭhamapurisā, si tha iti majjhimapurisā, mi ma iti uttamapurisā. attanopadānampi te ante iti paṭhamapurisā, se vhe iti majjhimapurisā, e mhe iti uttamapurisā. evaṃ sabbattha.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 408
taṃaṭṭhakathāṭīkā

fem. that commentary and sub-commentary [taṃ + aṭṭhakathā + ṭīkā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning that commentary and sub-commentary
Construction taṃ + aṭṭhakathā + ṭīkā
taṃkhantika

adj. with that belief; accepting that [taṃ + khantika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with that belief; accepting that
Construction taṃ + khantika
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (taṃ + khantika)
Variant taṅkhantika
Sanskrit tam + kṣānti + ka

Example

anuvattakā'ti yaṃdiṭṭhiko so hoti yaṃkhantiko yaṃruciko te'pi taṃdiṭṭhikā honti taṃkhantikā taṃrucikā.

VIN 1.2.11 bhedānuvattakasikkhāpadaṃ
taṃcatuttha

adj. with that one as the fourth, consisting of that one and three others ✗
taṃjīvaṃtaṃsarīraṃsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 24.13 (SN24.13) ✗

Meaning that sub-commentary
Construction taṃ + ṭīkā
taṃdasama

adj. with that one as the tenth, consisting of that one and nine others ✗

adj. having that view; holding that opinion; with that belief [taṃ + diṭṭhi + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having that view; holding that opinion; with that belief
Construction taṃ + diṭṭhi + ka
taṃdiṭṭhi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Variant tandiṭṭhika
Commentary (NIDD1a) taṃdiṭṭhikā sāvakā hontī'ti tassa vacanaṃ suṇantā sāvakā'pi tathāladdhikā honti.
Sanskrit tam + dṛṣṭika

Example

anuvattakā'ti yaṃdiṭṭhiko so hoti yaṃkhantiko yaṃruciko te'pi taṃdiṭṭhikā honti taṃkhantikā taṃrucikā.

Meaning on that day
Construction taṃ + divasaṃ
taṃdukkha

adj. having, sharing, that unhappiness ✗

Construction taṃ + nidāna + ā
taṃnidāna + ā
Synonym tāya
taṃninna

adj. inclined towards him; drawn to him [taṃ + ninna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning inclined towards him; drawn to him
Construction taṃ + ninna
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (taṃ + ninna)
Commentary (ANa) taṃninnā'va gamissantī'ti taṃ tadeva bhagavato gataṭṭhānaṃ gamissanti, anubandhissanti'y'evā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit tam + nimna

Example

adhivāsetu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, adhivāsetu sugato, adhivāsanakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato. yena yen'eva dāni bhagavā gamissati taṃninnā'va gamissanti brāhmaṇagahapatikā negamā c'eva jānapadā ca.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ
taṃnissita

adj. dependent on that; supported by that; based on that [taṃ + nissita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on that; supported by that; based on that
Construction taṃ + nissita
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (taṃ + nissita)
Variant tannissita
Sanskrit tam + niśrita

Example

so evaṃ pajānāti, imañ'ce ahaṃ upekkhaṃ evaṃ parisuddhaṃ evaṃ pariyodātaṃ ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ upasaṃhareyyaṃ, tadanudhammañ'ca cittaṃ bhāveyyaṃ, evaṃ me ayaṃ upekkhā taṃnissitā tadupādānā ciraṃ dīgham'addhānaṃ tiṭṭheyya.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
taṃpañcama

adj. with that one as the fifth, consisting of that one and four others ✗
taṃpassa

sandhi. that too would be [taṃ + api + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + opt
Meaning that too would be
Construction taṃ + api + assa
Variant taṃ pissa, taṃ mamassa
Sanskrit tam + api + syāt

Example

yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tam'ahaṃ jānāmi ca na ca jānāmī'ti vadeyyaṃ, taṃp'assa t'ādisam'eva.

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ
taṃbhakkha

adj. eating that food [taṃ + bhakkha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning eating that food
Construction taṃ + bhakkha
Variant tabbhakkha, tambhakkha
taṃyevettha

sandhi. about this matter; lit. just that here [taṃ + eva + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning about this matter; lit. just that here
Construction taṃ + eva + ettha
Sanskrit tam + eva + atra

Example

tena hi, brāhmaṇa, taṃ'y'ev'ettha paṭipucchissāmi. yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsi. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, kusalo tvaṃ rājagahagāmissa maggassā'ti?

Compound tatiyā tappurisa (taṃsaññāya + paricita)

Example

taṃsadisa

taṃsaṃvattanika

adj. leading to that; conducive to that [taṃ + saṃvattanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to that; conducive to that
Construction taṃ + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (tassa + saṃvattanika)
Commentary (MNa) taṃsaṃvattanikan'ti tassa bhikkhuno saṃvattanikaṃ. yena vipākaviññāṇena so bhikkhu saṃvattati nibbattati, taṃ viññāṇaṃ.
Sanskrit tam + saṃvartanīya

Example

sampasāde sati etarahi vā āneñjaṃ samāpajjati paññāya vā adhimuccati kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā. ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati yaṃ taṃsaṃvattanikaṃ viññāṇaṃ assa āneñj'ūpagaṃ. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamā āneñjasappāyā paṭipadā akkhāyati.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
taṃsukha

adj. having, sharing, that happiness ✗

Meaning for that reason; because of that; lit. that cause
Construction taṃ + hetu
Sanskrit tam + hetu
tā 1.1

pron. they; those (females) [ta + ā] ✓

Grammar pron, fem nom pl of ta
Meaning they; those (females)
Construction ta + ā
Sanskrit tāḥ

Examples

gunnaṃ ce taramānānaṃ,
jimhaṃ gacchati puṅgavo,
sabbā tā jimhaṃ gacchanti,
nette jimhaṃ gate sati.

AN 4.70 adhammikasuttaṃ

so yā tā sālalaṭṭhiyo kuṭilā oj'āpaharaṇiyo tā chetvā bahiddhā nīhareyya, antovanaṃ suvisodhitaṃ visodheyya. yā pana tā sālalaṭṭhiyo ujukā sujātā tā sammā parihareyya.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
tā 2.1

suffix. (gram) state of; idea of; notion of; fact of ✓

Grammar suffix, fem, abstr
Meaning (gram) state of; idea of; notion of; fact of
Sanskrit tā

Examples

lokasamudayaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke n'atthitā sā na hoti. lokanirodhaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke atthitā sā na hoti.

SN 12.15 kaccānagottasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
tāṇa

nt. refuge; shelter; defence; protection; lit. protecting [√tā + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning refuge; shelter; defence; protection; lit. protecting
Root Family √tā
Root √tā･3 ya (protect, preserve)
√ In Comps ttā
Construction √tā + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Synonym tāṇatā, paṭisaraṇa
Variant tāna
Commentary (MNa) ettha ca tāya'ti rakkhatī'ti tāṇaṃ. (SNa) na santi tāṇā'ti tāṇaṃ leṇaṃ saraṇaṃ bhavituṃ samatthā nāma keci n'atthi.
Sanskrit trāṇa
Sanskrit Root √trā √trai 4 (rescue)

Examples

na santi puttā tāṇāya,
na pitā n'āpi bandhavā,
antaken'ādhipannassa,
n'atthi ñātīsu tāṇatā.

DHP 288 maggavaggo

upanīyati jīvitam'appam'āyu,
jar'ūpanītassa na santi tāṇā,
etaṃ bhayaṃ maraṇe pekkhamāno,
puññāni kayirātha sukh'āvahānī'ti.

SN 1.3 upanīyasuttaṃ
tāṇagāmī

adj. leading to protection; going to shelter [tāṇa + gāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to protection; going to shelter
Construction tāṇa + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (tāṇaṃ + gāmī)
Commentary (SNa) tāyan'aṭṭhena tāṇaṃ.
tāṇatā

fem. (+loc) refuge (in); shelter (in); defence (in); protection (in); lit. protection state [√tā + aṇa + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from tāṇa (+loc)
Meaning refuge (in); shelter (in); defence (in); protection (in); lit. protection state
Root Family √tā
Root √tā･3 ya (protect, preserve)
√ In Comps ttā
Construction √tā + aṇa + tā
tāṇa + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Synonym tāṇa, tāna, rakkhā
Commentary (MNt) ayañ'h'ettha attho, puttā vā pitā vā bandhavā vā antakena maccunā adhipannassa abhibhūtassa maraṇato tāṇāya na honti, tasmā n'atthi ñātīsu tāṇatā'ti. na hi ñātīnaṃ vasena maraṇato ārakkhā atthi
Sanskrit trāṇa +
Sanskrit Root √trā √trai 4 (rescue)

Example

na santi puttā tāṇāya,
na pitā n'āpi bandhavā,
antaken'ādhipannassa,
n'atthi ñātīsu tāṇatā.

DHP 288 maggavaggo
tāta

masc. father; brother; son ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning father; brother; son
Sanskrit tāta

Examples

atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uttaraṃ māṇavaṃ āmantesi, ayaṃ, tāta uttara, samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito videhesu cārikaṃ carati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

atha kho, bhikkhave, aññataro kummo aññataraṃ kummaṃ etadavoca, mā kho tvaṃ, tāta kumma, etaṃ padesaṃ agamāsī'ti.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ
tātā

masc. friends; dears ✓

Grammar masc, voc pl of tāta
Meaning friends; dears
Sanskrit tātāḥ

Example

gacchatha, tātā, pabbatapādaṃ pavisitvā jīvantā subhikkhakāle mama santikaṃ āgantu'kāmā āgacchatha, anāgantu'kāmā tattha tatth'eva jīvathā'ti.

DHPa 2.18.10 meṇḍakaseṭṭhi vatthu
tādi

adj. such; of such character; of such quality; like; kind of [ta + ādisa + i] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning such; of such character; of such quality; like; kind of
Construction ta + ādisa + i
tādisa + i > tādi
Derivative taddhita (i)
Phonetic Change isa > i (contraction)
Synonym evarūpa, tathārūpa, tādisa, tādisaka, tādisī, tādī
Sanskrit tādṛś

Examples

bāhitvā sabbapāpakāni,
vimalo sādhusamāhito ṭhit'atto,
saṃsāram'aticca kevalī so,
asito tādi pavuccate sa brahmā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

pathavisamo no virujjhati,
indakhīl'ūpamo tādi subbato,
rahado'va apetakaddamo,
saṃsārā na bhavanti tādino.

DHP 95 arahantavaggo
tāditā

fem. suchness; being such ✗
tādibhāva

masc. equipoise ✗
tādibhūmi

fem. basis for being such ✗
tādisa

adj. (+gen) such; like that (of); of such character; of such quality; kind (of) [ta + ādisa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+gen)
Meaning such; like that (of); of such character; of such quality; kind (of)
Construction ta + ādisa
Antonym aññādisa
Synonym evarūpa, tathārūpa, tādi, tādisikā, tādisī
Sanskrit tādṛśa

Examples

nidhīnaṃ'va pavattāraṃ,
yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ,
t'ādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
t'ādisaṃ bhajamānassa,
seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.

DHP 76 paṇḍitavaggo

tassa na t'ādiso vaṇṇo hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na t'ādiso saro hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na t'ādisaṃ padaṃ hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ
tādisaka

adj. of that kind; of such character; of such quality; like [ta + ādisa + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from tādisa
Meaning of that kind; of such character; of such quality; like
Construction ta + ādisa + ka
tādisa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Antonym yādisaka
Synonym tādi, tādisikā, tādī
Sanskrit tādṛśa

Examples

ahañ'c'eva kho pana yādisake kāme ohāya agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito t'ādisake vā kāme pariyeseyyaṃ tato vā pāpiṭṭhatare, na m'etaṃ patirūpan'ti.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ

yādisaṃ kurute mittaṃ,
yādisaṃ c'ūpasevati,
sa ve t'ādisako hoti,
sahavāso hi t'ādiso.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ
tādisameva

sandhi. just the same; exactly the same [tādisa + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning just the same; exactly the same
Construction tādisa + eva
Synonym tatheva
Sanskrit tādṛśa + eva

Examples

yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tam'ahaṃ jānāmi ca na ca jānāmī'ti vadeyyaṃ, taṃp'assa t'ādisam'eva.

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ

tassa sīghena javena dhāvato chavim'pi ḍayhati, cammam'pi ḍayhati, maṃsam'pi ḍayhati, nhārum'pi ḍayhati, aṭṭhīni'pi sampadhūpāyanti, ubbhataṃ t'ādisam'eva hoti.

MN 130 devadūtasuttaṃ
tādisaṃyeva

sandhi. exactly the same kind of; the very same [tādisaṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning exactly the same kind of; the very same
Construction tādisaṃ + [y] + eva
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit tādṛśa + eva

Example

idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa t'ādisaṃ'y'eva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, n'ānu'pi khāyati, kiṃ bahu'd'eva.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
tādisikā

adj. of that kind; of such character; of such quality; like that [ta + ādisa + ka + ikā] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, fem nom sg of tādisaka
Meaning of that kind; of such character; of such quality; like that
Construction ta + ādisa + ka + ikā
tādisaka + ikā
Antonym yādisikā
Synonym tādisa, tādisaka, tādisī
Sanskrit tādṛśī

Example

chandagāmino ca bhikkhū, dosagāmino ca bhikkhū, mohagāmino ca bhikkhū, bhayagāmino ca bhikkhū t'ādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti, ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī'ti.

VIN PAT SA 13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
tādisī

adj. (+gen) such; like that (of); of such character; of such quality; kind (of) [ta + ādisa + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, fem nom sg of tādisa (+gen)
Meaning such; like that (of); of such character; of such quality; kind (of)
Construction ta + ādisa + ī
tādisa + ī
Synonym tādi, tādisa, tādisikā, tādī
Sanskrit tādṛsī

Example

soḷas'ākārasampannā,
aṭṭh'aṅgasusamāgatā,
t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
upapajjati devalokaṃ manāpan'ti.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
tādisovassa

sandhi. it could be exactly like; it may have been just like [tādiso + eva + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind + opt, impers
Meaning it could be exactly like; it may have been just like
Construction tādiso + eva + assa
Sanskrit tādṛśa + eva + syāt

Example

tena kho pana, bhikkhu, samayena t'ādiso'v'assa kiṃsuko yathā'pi tassa purisassa dassanaṃ.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
tādī 1

adj. such; of such character; of such quality; like; kind of [ta + ādisa + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning such; of such character; of such quality; like; kind of
Construction ta + ādisa + ī
tādisa + ī > tādī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change isī > ī (contraction)
Synonym evarūpa, tathārūpa, tādi, tādisa, tādisaka, tādisī
Commentary (ITIa) tādinā'ti chaḷaṅg'upekkhāvasena sabbattha iṭṭh'ādīsu ekasabhāvatāsaṅkhātena tādilakkhaṇena tādinā.
Sanskrit tādṛś

Examples

yass'indriyāni samathaṅ'gatāni,
assā yathā sārathinā sudantā,
pahīnamānassa anāsavassa,
devā'pi tassa pihayanti tādino.

DHP 94 arahantavaggo

na kappayanti na purekkharonti,
dhammā'pi tesaṃ na paṭicchitāse,
na brāhmaṇo sīlavatena neyyo,
pāraṅ'gato na pacceti tādī'ti.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5
tādī 2

adj. the same; unmoved; unaffected; lit. such; like that [ta + ādisa + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning the same; unmoved; unaffected; lit. such; like that
Construction ta + ādisa + ī
tādisa + ī > tādī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change isī > ī (contraction)
Variant tādi
Commentary (ANa) tādī'y'eva tādī'ti tāditā nāma ekasadisatā. tathāgato ca yādiso lābh'ādīsu, t'ādiso'va alābh'ādīsu. tena vuttaṃ, lābhe'pi tādī, alābhe'pi tādī. yase'pi tādī, ayase'pi tādī.
Sanskrit tādṛś

Example

iti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgato diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu tādī'y'eva tādī. tamhā ca pana tādimhā añño tādī uttaritaro vā paṇītataro vā n'atthī'ti vadāmīti.

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ
tāna

nt. refuge; shelter; defence; protection; lit. protecting [√tā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning refuge; shelter; defence; protection; lit. protecting
Root Family √tā
Root √tā･3 ya (protect, preserve)
√ In Comps ttā
Construction √tā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym tāṇatā, paṭisaraṇa
Variant tāṇa
Sanskrit trāṇa
Sanskrit Root √trā √trai 4 (rescue)

Example

devapuragatānañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, devānaṃ etadahosi, bhīruttānagatena kho dāni mayaṃ etarahi attanā viharāma akaraṇīyā asurehī'ti. asurānam'pi, bhikkhave, etadahosi, bhīruttānagatena kho dāni devā etarahi attanā viharanti akaraṇīyā amhehī'ti.

AN 9.39 devāsurasaṅgāmasuttaṃ
tānassu

sandhi. they could be; they would be [tāni + assu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + opt
Meaning they could be; they would be
Construction tāni + assu
Commentary (SNa) tān'assū'ti tāni assu, tāni bhaveyyun'ti attho.
Sanskrit tvāṇi + syuḥ

Example

tān'assu kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni

MN 16 cetokhilasuttaṃ
tānāssu

sandhi. they would be [tāni + assu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + opt
Meaning they would be
Construction tāni + assu
Sanskrit tāni + syuḥ

Example

seyyathā'pi, mahānāma, kukkuṭiyā aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā tān'āssu kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
tāni 1

pron. they; those; those things [ta + āni] ✓

Grammar pron, nt nom pl of ta
Meaning they; those; those things
Construction ta + āni
Sanskrit tvāṇi

Examples

tāni yāva c'aggā yāva ca mūlā sītena vārinā abhisannāni parisannāni paripūrāni paripphuṭāni, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvataṃ uppalānaṃ vā padumānaṃ vā puṇḍarīkānaṃ vā sītena vārinā apphuṭaṃ assa

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
tāni 2

pron. they; those; those things [ta + āni] ✓

Grammar pron, nt acc pl of ta
Meaning they; those; those things
Construction ta + āni
Sanskrit tāni

Examples

yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

annānam'atho pānānaṃ,
khādanīyānaṃ atho'pi vatthānaṃ,
laddhā na sannidhiṃ kayirā,
na ca parittase tāni alabhamāno.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
tāpa

Meaning heat; warmth
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction √tap > tāp + *a

Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym gimha
Sanskrit tāpa
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)
tāpana 1

Construction tāpe + ana

Sanskrit tāpana
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)
tāpana 2

Meaning having the nature to cause pain
Construction tāpana + sabhāva
tāpayati

pr. (+acc) hurts; harms; afflicts; lit. burns [√tap + *aya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of tapati, trans (+acc)
Meaning hurts; harms; afflicts; lit. burns
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 *aya (burn, radiate heat)
Base √tap + *aya > tāpaya (caus)
Construction tāpaya + ti
Synonym khanati, dukkhāpeti, paritāpeti, bādheti, byāpajjati, byābādheti, vihiṃsati, hiṃsati
Commentary (SNa) na tāpaye'ti vippaṭisārena na tāpeyya na vibādheyya
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)
tāpayamāna

prp. scorching, tormenting, heating [√tap] ✗
tāpasa

masc. ascetic; hermit [√tap + as + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from tapas
Meaning ascetic; hermit
Root Family √tap
Root √tap･1 a (burn, radiate heat)
Construction √tap > tāp + as + *a
tapas + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit tāpasa
Sanskrit Root √tap 1 (heat)

Examples

sumedhatāpaso iddhimā'ti jānantā udakabhinn'okāsaṃ sallakkhetvā, tvaṃ imaṃ ṭhānaṃ alaṅ'karohī'ti adaṃsu.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedhakathā

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
tāpasī

fem. female ascetic [√tap] ✗
tāpita

pp. scorched, tormented, heated [√tap] ✗
tāpeti

pr. scorches, torments, heats [√tap] ✗
tāpetvā

abs. having scorched, having tormented, having heated [√tap] ✗
tāpenta

prp. scorching, tormenting, heating [√tap] ✗
tāpesi

aor. scorched, tormented, heated [√tap] ✗
tāmbūlī

fem. betel creeper [tambūla] ✗
tāya 1

pron. by her; with her; with that [ta + āya] ✓

Grammar pron, fem instr sg of ta
Meaning by her; with her; with that
Construction ta + āya
Variant nāya
Sanskrit tayā

Examples

so evaṃ vadeyya, alaṃ me, bho, tāya vīṇāya, tam'eva me saddaṃ āharathā'ti. tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ayaṃ kho, bhante, vīṇā nāma anekasambhārā mahāsambhārā

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

seṭṭhi, sace me dhītā vijāyissati, tāya naṃ saddhiṃ nivesetvā seṭṭhiṭṭhānassa sāmikaṃ karissāmi. sace me putto vijāyissati, māressāmi nan'ti cintetvā taṃ gehe kāresi.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
tāya 2

ind. on account of that; lit. by that [ta + āya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, fem instr sg of ta
Meaning on account of that; lit. by that
Construction ta + āya
Synonym taṃnidānā
Variant nāya
Sanskrit tayā

Examples

tāya naṃ pāricariyāya,
mātāpitūsu paṇḍitā,
idh'eva naṃ pasaṃsanti,
pecca sagge pamodatī'ti.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ

disvā adantaṃ damitaṃ,
manussānaṃ vasaṃ gataṃ,
tato cittaṃ samādhesiṃ,
khalu tāya vanaṃ gatā'ti.

THI 32 dantikātherīgāthā
tāya 3

pron. from her; from that [ta] ✗
tāyati

pr. protects, preserves, nourishes [√tā] ✗
tāyana 1

tāyana 2

SN 2.8 tāyanasuttaṃ

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatarā tāvatiṃsakāyikā devatā nandane vane accharāsaṅghaparivutā dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāriyamānā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

tāyi

abs. having protected, having preserved, having nourished [√tā] ✗
tāyeva

sandhi. by that very; on account of that exact [tāya + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning by that very; on account of that exact
Construction tāya + eva
Sanskrit tayā + eva

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
tāyevappāhāratāya

sandhi. on account of that very same lack of food [tāya + eva + appāhāratāya] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + fem
Meaning on account of that very same lack of food
Construction tāya + eva + appāhāratāya
Sanskrit tayā + eva + alpāhāra +

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, imam'eva kāyaṃ assāsento pāṇinā gattāni anumajjāmi. tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, pāṇinā gattāni anumajjato pūtimūlāni lomāni kāyasmā papatanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

tārakā + a

nt. starlight; twinkling of the stars; lit. shape of the stars [tārakā + rūpa] ✓

Meaning starlight; twinkling of the stars; lit. shape of the stars

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yā kāci tārakarūpānaṃ pabhā, sabbā tā candappabhāya kalaṃ n'āgghanti soḷasiṃ, candappabhā tāsaṃ aggam'akkhāyati

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, māgaṇḍiya, jacc'andho puriso, so na passeyya … mañjiṭṭhakāni rūpāni, na passeyya samavisamaṃ, na passeyya tārakarūpāni, na passeyya candimasūriye.

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, uṭṭhāy'āsanā udakena akkhīni anumajjitvā disā anuvilokeyyāsi nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni ullokeyyāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni. seyyathā'pi nāma osadhitārakā odātā odātavaṇṇā odātanidassanā odātanibhāsā

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
tārakāgaṇa

masc. host of stars ✗
tārakāpati

masc. moon ✗
tārakāpatha

masc. sky ✗
tāragaṇa

masc. constellation; lit. star group [tārā + gaṇa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning constellation; lit. star group
Construction tārā + gaṇa
Variant tārāgaṇa
Commentary (ITIa) tāragaṇā'va sabbe'ti yathā sabbe'pi tārāgaṇā candimasobhāya soḷasim'pi kalaṃ n'āgghanti, evaṃ te assamedhādayo yaññā mettacittassa vuttalakkhaṇena subhāvitassa soḷasim'pi kalaṃ n'ānubhavanti, na pāpuṇanti, n'āgghantī'ti attho.
tārayanta

prp. (+acc) saving; rescuing; helping to cross over; lit. causing to cross [√tar + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of tārayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning saving; rescuing; helping to cross over; lit. causing to cross
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 *aya (cross)
Base √tar + *aya > tāraya (caus)
Construction tāraya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit tarayat
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

samuggatassa jhāyissa,
ananugat'antarassa suddhassa,
asitassa hitassa,
pavivittassa aggappattassa,
tiṇṇassa tārayantassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
tārayamāna

prp. (+acc) making cross, helping over [√tar] ✗
tārayi

aor. (+acc) saved; rescued; helped across; lit. caused to cross [a + √tar + *aya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of tārayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning saved; rescued; helped across; lit. caused to cross
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 *aya (cross)
Base √tar + *aya > tāraya (caus)
Construction a + tāraya + i
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym atāresi, tāresi
Sanskrit tārayati
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

yaṃ me kaṅkhitam'aññāsi,
vicikicchā maṃ tārayi namo te,
muni monapathesu pattipatta,
akhila ādiccabandhu sorato'si.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
tārā

fem. star ~

Meaning star

Variant tāragaṇa
tārita

pp. made cross, helped over, assisted [√tar] ✗
tārituṃ

inf. (+acc) to cross; to cross over [√tar + *ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of tarati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to cross; to cross over
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar > tār + *ituṃ
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ā
Synonym tarituṃ
Sanskrit taritum
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Example

eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
tārukkha

masc. name of a Brahman teacher ~

Meaning name of a Brahman teacher
tāretar

masc. who helps to cross, saviour [√tar] ✗
tāreti

pr. (+acc) saves; rescues; helps across; lit. causes to cross [√tar + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of tarati, trans (+acc)
Meaning saves; rescues; helps across; lit. causes to cross
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 *e (cross)
Base √tar + *e > tāre (caus)
Construction tāre + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym santāreti
Notes sometimes +abl saves (from)

Examples

tuvaṃ mār'ābhibhū muni,
tuvaṃ anusaye chetvā,
tiṇṇo tāresi maṃ pajaṃ.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

satthā ca me lokam'imaṃ adhiṭṭhahi,
aniccato addhuvato asārato,
pakkhanda maṃ citta jinassa sāsane,
tārehi oghā mahatā suduttarā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
tāretuṃ

inf. (+acc) to carry across; to ferry across; lit. to cause to cross [√tar + *e + tuṃ] ~

Grammar inf of tāreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to carry across; to ferry across; lit. to cause to cross
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 *e (cross)
Base √tar + *e > tāre (caus)
Construction tāre + tuṃ
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit tārayitum
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)
tāretvā

abs. having made cross, having helped over, having assisted [√tar] ✗
tārenta

prp. making cross, helping over [√tar] ✗
tāresi

aor. (+acc) saved; rescued; helped across; lit. caused to cross [√tar + *e + si] ~

Grammar aor of tāreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning saved; rescued; helped across; lit. caused to cross
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 *e (cross)
Base √tar + *e > tāre (caus)
Construction tāre + si
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym tārayi
Variant atāresi
Commentary (VINa) atiṇṇe tāresī'ti saṃsārato atiṇṇe iminā jīvitāvoropanena tāresi parimocesī'ti. ayaṃ kira etissā devatāya bālāya dummedhāya laddhi, ye na matā, te saṃsārato na muttā. ye matā, te muttā'ti. tasmā saṃsāramocakamilakkhā viya evaṃladdhikā hutvā tam'pi tattha niyojentī evam'āha.
Notes sometimes +abl saves (from)
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)
tāla 1.1

masc. palm tree; Palmyra [√tal + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning palm tree; Palmyra
Root Family √tal
Root √tal×8 *e (support, rest on)
Construction √tal > tāl + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borassus
Sanskrit tāla
Sanskrit Root √tal 1, 10 (establish)

Examples

ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā

AN 8.11 verañjasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna viruḷhiyā.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
tāla 1.2

adj. one palm tree in height; one palm tree deep [√tal + *a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning one palm tree in height; one palm tree deep
Root Family √tal
Root √tal×8 *e (support, rest on)
Construction √tal > tāl + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant tālamatta
Sanskrit tāla
Sanskrit Root √tal 1, 10 (establish)

Example

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde sattatālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, chattālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, pañcatālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, catuttālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, titālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, dvitālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, tālaṃ'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
tāla 2.1

masc. key; bolt; lit. knocker [√taḷ + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from tāḷeti
Meaning key; bolt; lit. knocker
Root Family √taḷ
Root √taḷ･8 *e (beat)
√ In Comps ttaḷ
Construction √taḷ > tāl + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
ḷ > l
Sanskrit tāla, tāḍaka
Sanskrit Root √taḍ 10 (beat)

Example

atha kho āyasmā mahako vihāraṃ pavisitvā sūcighaṭikaṃ datvā tathārūpaṃ iddh'ābhisaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkhari yathā tālacchiggaḷena ca aggaḷ'antarikāya ca acci nikkhamitvā tiṇāni jhāpesi, uttarāsaṅgaṃ na jhāpesi.

SN 41.4 mahakapāṭihāriyasuttaṃ
tāla 3.1

masc. pigment; orpiment; arsenic trisulphide ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning pigment; orpiment; arsenic trisulphide
Sanskrit tāla

Example

yathā haritālena makkhitaṃ,
addasa cittikaṃ bhittiyā kataṃ,
tamhi te viparītadassanaṃ,
saññā mānusikā niratthikā.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
tālakanda

masc. sprout coming out of a palm nut, (which is eaten when boiled and dried) ✗
tālakkhandha

masc. trunk of a palm tree ✗
tālacchāyā

fem. shadow of a palm tree [tāla + chāyā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning shadow of a palm tree
Construction tāla + chāyā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tālassa + chāyā)
Variant tālacchāti, tālacchādi
Commentary (SNa) yāvatā so tālacchāyaṃ atikkameyya, tāvatā kālena ekacakkavāḷaṃ atikkamāmī'ti attano javasampattiṃ dasseti.
Sanskrit tāla + chāyā

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ
tālacchiggaḷa

nt. keyhole [tāla + chiggaḷa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning keyhole
Construction tāla + chiggaḷa
Compound catutthī tappurisa (tālassa + chiggaḷa)
Commentary (DNt) tāḷacchiggalenā'ti kuñcikāchiddena.
Sanskrit tāla, tāḍaka + chidra

Example

atha kho āyasmā mahako vihāraṃ pavisitvā sūcighaṭikaṃ datvā tathārūpaṃ iddh'ābhisaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkhari yathā tālacchiggaḷena ca aggaḷ'antarikāya ca acci nikkhamitvā tiṇāni jhāpesi, uttarāsaṅgaṃ na jhāpesi.

tālapatta

tālapuṭa

masc. name of a monk; lit. palm leaf wrap [tāla + puṭa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; lit. palm leaf wrap
Construction tāla + puṭa
Variant tālaputta
Commentary (SNa) tālapuṭo'ti evaṃnāmako. tassa kira bandhanā pamuttatālapakkavaṇṇo viya mukhavaṇṇo vippasanno ahosi, ten'assa tālapuṭo'ti nāmaṃ akaṃsu. sv'āyaṃ abhinīhārasampanno pacchimabhavikapuggalo. yasmā pana paṭisandhi nāma aniyatā ākāse khittadaṇḍasadisā, tasmā esa naṭakule nibbatti.
tālapuṭattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 262 (TH262) ✗
tālapuṭasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 42.2 (SN42.2) ✗
tālaputta

masc. name of a monk [tāla + putta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk
Construction tāla + putta
Variant tālapuṭa
Commentary (SNa) tālapuṭo'ti evaṃnāmako. tassa kira bandhanā pamuttatālapakkavaṇṇo viya mukhavaṇṇo vippasanno ahosi, ten'assa tālapuṭo'ti nāmaṃ akaṃsu. sv'āyaṃ abhinīhārasampanno pacchimabhavikapuggalo. yasmā pana paṭisandhi nāma aniyatā ākāse khittadaṇḍasadisā, tasmā esa naṭakule nibbatti.

adj. one palm trees in height; one palm tree deep [tāla + matta] ✓

Meaning one palm trees in height; one palm tree deep

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde sattatālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, chattālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, pañcatālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, catuttālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, titālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, dvitālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, tālamattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
tālavaṇṭa

nt. palm fan; fan; lit. palm stalk [tāla + vaṇṭa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning palm fan; fan; lit. palm stalk
Construction tāla + vaṇṭa
Compound kammadhāraya (tāla + vaṇṭa)
Commentary (VVa) tālavaṇṭan'ti tālapattehi katamaṇḍalabījaniṃ.
Sanskrit tālavṛnta

Example

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ gimhānaṃ pacchime māse tālavaṇṭena'pi vidhūpanena'pi vātaṃ pariyesanti, ossavane'pi tiṇāni na icchanti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
tālavana

nt. grove of palm trees ✗
tālāvatthu

nt. uprooted palm; palmyra stump; lit. groundless palm [tāla + avatthu] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning uprooted palm; palmyra stump; lit. groundless palm
Construction tāla + avatthu
Compound kammadhāraya (tāla + avatthu)
Commentary (SNa) tālāvatthū bhavanti te'ti te bhikkhutejasā daḍḍhā vatthumatt'āvasiṭṭho matthakacchinnatālo viya bhavanti, puttadhīt'ādivasena na vaḍḍhantī'ti attho.
Sanskrit tāla + avastu

Example

yañ'ca kho sīlasampanno,
bhikkhu ḍahati tejasā,
na tassa puttā pasavo,
dāy'ādā vindare dhanaṃ,
anapaccā adāy'ādā,
tāl'āvatthū bhavanti te.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
tālāvatthukata

adj. uprooted like a palm tree; lit. palm made groundless [tāla + avatthu + kata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning uprooted like a palm tree; lit. palm made groundless
Construction tāla + avatthu + kata
Compound kammadhāraya (tāla viya avatthukata)
Commentary (ANa) tāl'āvatthukatānī'ti tālavatthu viya katāni, puna aviruhaṇaṭṭhena matthakacchinnatālo viya samūlaṃ tālaṃ uddharitvā tassa patiṭṭhitaṭṭhānaṃ viya ca katānī'ti attho.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit tāla + avastu + kṛta

Examples

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu rāgo me pahīno ucchinnamūlo tāl'āvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo'ti pajānāti

DN 33.13 saṅgītisuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna viruḷhiyā. evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaṃyojane se ucchinnamūle tāl'āvatthukate anabhāvaṃkate āyatiṃ anuppādadhamme.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
tālīsā

card. forty (40) [catu + dasa + *ā] ~

Grammar card, fem sg, comp, abbrev of cattālīsā
Meaning forty (40)
Construction catu + dasa + *ā
cattālīsā > tālīsā
Derivative taddhita (*ā)
Phonetic Change cattālīsā > tālīsā (contraction)
Variant cattālīsā, cattārīsā, catuttālīsā
Sanskrit catvāriṃśat
tālu

nt. palate ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning palate
Commentary (SNPa) jivhāya tālum'āhacca, udare saññato siyā'ti jivhāya tāluṃ uppīḷetvā'pi rasataṇhaṃ vinodento kiliṭṭhena maggena uppannapaccaye asevanto udare saṃyato siyā.
Sanskrit tālu

Examples

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā dantebhidantam'ādhāya jivhāya tāluṃ āhacca cetasā cittaṃ abhiniggaṇhitabbaṃ abhinippīḷetabbaṃ abhisantāpetabbaṃ.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
khuradhār'ūpamo bhave,
jivhāya tālum'āhacca,
udare saññato siyā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
tāluja

adj. (gram) palatal; lit. born from palate [tālu + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (gram) palatal; lit. born from palate
Construction tālu + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (tālunā + ja)
Sanskrit tāluja, tālusthāna

Example

a kavagga hā kaṇṭhajā, i cavagga yā tālujā, u pavaggā oṭṭhajā, ṭavagga ra ḷā muddhajā, tavagga la sā dantajā, e kaṇṭhatālujo, o kaṇṭh'oṭṭhajo, vo dant'oṭṭhajo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
tāva 1

ind. that much; that far; as long as; to that extent; until; at least ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning that much; that far; as long as; to that extent; until; at least
Synonym yāva
Sanskrit tāvat

Examples

yāv'assa kāyo ṭhassati tāva naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā kāyassa bhedā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā na naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā'ti

DN 1.21 brahmajālasuttaṃ

abhabbo taṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ, yaṃ kammaṃ katvā nirayaṃ vā tiracchānayoniṃ vā pettivisayaṃ vā upapajjeyya, abhabbo'va tāva kālaṃ kātuṃ yāva na sot'āpattiphalaṃ sacchikaroti.

SN 25.1 cakkhusuttaṃ
tāva 2

ind. until later; for a while ~

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning until later; for a while
Sanskrit tāvat
tāva 3

ind. firstly; to begin with [ta] ✗
tāvakālika

adj. temporary, for the time being ✗
tāvakālikaṃ

ind. temporarily ✗
tāvataka 1

adj. just this much; just so much [tāva + aka] ✓

Grammar adj, from tāva
Meaning just this much; just so much
Construction tāva + [t] + aka
Derivative taddhita (aka)
Phonetic Change +t
Antonym yāvataka
Synonym tāvatika
Sanskrit tāvattāt, tāvattakaṃ (bsk)

Examples

ahesuṃ kho, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ yāvatakaṃ tuyhaṃ kasiṇaṃ āyu tāvatakaṃ tesaṃ tapokammam'eva ahosi.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

tāvataken'eva tuṭṭhiṃ āpajjeyyātha

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
tāvataka 2

adj. however many ✗
tāvatakena

ind. with just so much; merely with that ✗
tāvatakeneva

sandhi. with just this much [tāvatakena + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning with just this much
Construction tāvatakena + eva
Sanskrit tāvatāt, tāvattakaṃ (bsk) + eva

Examples

na kho, gahapati, tāvataken'eva tuṭṭhi karaṇīyā, mayaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paccupaṭṭhitā cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārenā'ti.

AN 5.176 pītisuttaṃ

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, tāvataken'eva oṭṭhapahatamattena lapitalāpanamattena ñāṇavādañ'ca vadāmi theravādañ'ca, jānāmi passāmī'ti ca paṭijānāmi, ahañ'c'eva aññe ca.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
tāvatakvassa

sandhi. as that long his; as that much his [tāvatako + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + pron
Meaning as that long his; as that much his
Construction tāvatako > tāvatakv + assa
Phonetic Change o > v (Kacc 18, 20)
Antonym yāvatakvassa
Sanskrit tāvat + kaḥ + asya

Examples

ayañ'hi, deva, kumāro nigrodhaparimaṇḍalo yāvatakv'assa kāyo tāvatakv'assa byāmo, yāvatakv'assa byāmo, tāvatakv'assa kāyo

DN 14.3 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

nigrodhaparimaṇḍalo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, yāvatakv'assa kāyo tāvatakv'assa byāmo, yāvatakv'assa byāmo tāvatakv'assa kāyo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
tāvatā 1

ind. so long; that far; to such an extent [tāva + tā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of tāva
Meaning so long; that far; to such an extent
Construction tāva + tā
Antonym yāvatā
Sanskrit tāvatā

Examples

iti kho, bhikkhave, yāvatā saññāsamāpatti tāvatā aññāpaṭivedho.

AN 9.36 jhānasuttaṃ

yāvatā, āvuso, channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ gati tāvatā papañcassa gati, yāvatā papañcassa gati tāvatā channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ gati.

AN 4.173 mahākoṭṭhikasuttaṃ
tāvatā 2

ind. on that account; because of that [tāva + tā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of tāva
Meaning on that account; because of that
Construction tāva + tā
Antonym yāvatā
Synonym tatonidānaṃ, tatonimittaṃ, tena
Sanskrit tāvatā

Examples

na tāvatā dhammadharo,
yāvatā bahu bhāsati,
yo ca appam'pi sutvāna,
dhammaṃ kāyena passati,
sa ve dhammadharo hoti,
yo dhammaṃ nappamajjati.

DHP 259 dhammaṭṭhavaggo

na tena bhikkhako hoti,
yāvatā bhikkhate pare,
vissaṃ dhammaṃ samādāya,
bhikkhu hoti na tāvatā.

SN 7.20 bhikkhakasuttaṃ
tāvati

ind. that many; so much [tāva + ti] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, in comps, from tāva
Meaning that many; so much
Construction tāva + ti
Antonym yāvati
Commentary (VINa) tāvat'īhan'ti tattakāni ahāni.
Sanskrit tāvat

Example

yesaṃ bhikkhu aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā yāvat'īhaṃ jānaṃ paṭicchādeti, tāvat'īhaṃ tena bhikkhunā akāmā parivatthabbaṃ.

VIN PAT SA saṅghādisesuddeso
tāvatika

adj. just this much; just so much [tāva + ta + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from tāvata
Meaning just this much; just so much
Construction tāva + ta + ika
tāvata + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Synonym tāvataka
Sanskrit tāvatika

Example

cirapaṭik'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamitu'kāmo, n'atthi ca me kāyasmiṃ tāvatikā balamattā, yāvat'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkameyyan'ti

SN 22.87 vakkalisuttaṃ
tāvatihaṃ

ind. for a period of so many days ✗
tāvatiṃsa 1

adj. belonging to the (Heaven of the) Thirty Three [tayo + tiṃsa + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning belonging to the (Heaven of the) Thirty Three
Construction tayo > tāva + tiṃsa + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
v > y
Sanskrit trayastriṃśat

Examples

tena sudaṃ, bhante, devatā tāvatiṃsā attamanā honti pamuditā pītisomanassajātā dibbā vata bho kāyā paripūrenti, hāyanti asurakāyā'ti

DN 18.4 janavasabhasuttaṃ

yadā, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ pātubhavati, na tassaṃ parisāyaṃ koci devo abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti.

DN 18.5 janavasabhasuttaṃ
tāvatiṃsa 2

masc. heaven of the Thirty Three [tayo + tiṃsa + *a] ✓

Meaning heaven of the Thirty Three
Construction tayo > tāva + tiṃsa + *a

Phonetic Change a > ā
v > y
Sanskrit trayastriṃśat

Example

sahassaṃ cātumahārājikānaṃ sahassaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ sahassaṃ yāmānaṃ sahassaṃ tusitānaṃ sahassaṃ nimmānaratīnaṃ sahassaṃ paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ sahassaṃ brahmalokānaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
tāvatiṃsakāya

masc. host of the heaven of the Thirty Three ✗
tāvatiṃsakāyika

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning belonging to the host of the Heaven of Thirty Three
Construction tāvatiṃsa + kāyika
Compound kammadhāraya (tāvatiṃsa + kāyika)
Commentary (SNa) tāvatiṃsakāyikā'ti tāvatiṃsakāye nibbattā.
Sanskrit trayastriṃśat + kāyika

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatarā tāvatiṃsakāyikā devatā nandane vane accharāsaṅghaparivutā dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāriyamānā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

fem. assembly of gods in the Heaven of the Thirty Three [tāvatiṃsa + parisā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning assembly of gods in the Heaven of the Thirty Three
Construction tāvatiṃsa + parisā
Compound kammadhāraya (tāvatiṃsa + parisā)
Sanskrit trayastriṃśat + pariṣad

aṭṭha kho imā, sāriputta, parisā. katamā aṭṭha? khattiyaparisā, brāhmaṇaparisā, gahapatiparisā, samaṇaparisā, cātumahārājikaparisā, tāvatiṃsaparisā, māraparisā, brahmaparisā, imā kho, sāriputta, aṭṭha parisā.

tāvatiṃsabhavana

nt. realm of the 33 gods ✗
tāvatiṃsasadisa

tāvatīhaṃ

ind. for that many days; for so many days [tāvati + aha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of tāvatīha
Meaning for that many days; for so many days
Construction tāvati + aha + aṃ
tāvatīha + aṃ
Antonym yāvatīhaṃ
Commentary (VINa) tāvat'īhan'ti tattakāni ahāni.
Sanskrit tāvat + aha

Example

yesaṃ bhikkhu aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā yāvat'īhaṃ jānaṃ paṭicchādeti, tāvat'īhaṃ tena bhikkhunā akāmā parivatthabbaṃ.

VIN PAT SA saṅghādisesuddeso
tāvatva

nt. just-so-much-ness ✗
tāvad eve

idiom. instantly ✗
tāvade

sandhi. right then; that very instant; instantly; immediately [tāva + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning right then; that very instant; instantly; immediately
Construction tāva + [d] + eva > e
Phonetic Change +d
eva > e
Synonym tāvadeva
Commentary (THIa) tāva'd'e'ti ... tāva'd'eva
Sanskrit tāvat + eva

Examples

avitakkaṃ samāpanno,
sammāsambuddhasāvako,
ariyena tuṇhībhāvena,
upeto hoti tāva'd'e.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

uppāṭiya cārudassanā,
na ca pajjittha asaṅgamānasā,
handa te cakkhuṃ harassu taṃ,
tassa narassa adāsi tāva'd'e.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
tāvadeva 1

sandhi. right then; that very instant; instantly; immediately [tāva + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning right then; that very instant; instantly; immediately
Construction tāva + [d] + eva
Phonetic Change +d
Synonym tāvade
Sanskrit tāvat + eva

Examples

tāva'd'eva anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimucci

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

bhante, idaṃ udakaṃ dārakassa sīse āsiñcāmā'ti āpucchitvā, tena hi āsiñcathā'ti vutte tathā akāsi. sā devatā tāva'd'eva taṃ muñcitvā gantvā leṇadvāre aṭṭhāsi.

DHPa 2.26.21 pabbhāravāsī tissatthera vatthu
tāvadeva 2

sandhi. that very day; the same day [tāva + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning that very day; the same day
Construction tāva + [d] + eva
Phonetic Change +d
Commentary (MNa) tāva'd'eva jātako'ti taṃdivase jātako.
Sanskrit tāvat + eva

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, vacchako taruṇako tāva'd'eva jātako mātugoravakena vuyhamāno, so'pi tiriyaṃ gaṅgāya sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ agamāsi.

MN 34 cūḷagopālakasuttaṃ
tāvadevassa

sandhi. right then for him; that very instant for him; immediately for him [tāva + eva + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind + pron
Meaning right then for him; that very instant for him; immediately for him
Construction tāva + [d] + eva + assa
Phonetic Change +d
Sanskrit tāvat + eva + asmai

Example

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu yaññad'eva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, tāva'd'ev'assa tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti bhikkhūsu bhikkhunīsu upāsakesu upāsikāsu antamaso ārāmikasamaṇuddesesu.

AN 4.73 sappurisasuttaṃ
tāvadevassā

sandhi. right then for her; that very instant for her; immediately for her [tāva + eva + assā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind + pron
Meaning right then for her; that very instant for her; immediately for her
Construction tāva + [d] + eva + assā
Phonetic Change +d
Sanskrit tāvat + eva + asyai

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vadhukā yaññad'eva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā ānītā hoti, tāva'd'ev'assā tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sassuyā'pi sasure'pi sāmike'pi antamaso dāsakammakaraporisesu.

AN 4.73 sappurisasuttaṃ
tāvamahanta

adj. so big, so great ✗
tāvāhaṃ

sandhi. as long as I; until I [tāva + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning as long as I; until I
Construction tāva + ahaṃ
Sanskrit tāvat + aham

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno evaṃ vadeyya, na tāv'āhaṃ, āvuso, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi, yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ paripucchāmī'ti, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 71 sahadhammikasikkhāpadaṃ

na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipannā

DN 16.20 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
tāsa

masc. terror, fear, trembling [√tas] ✗
tāsañca

sandhi. and of those [tāsaṃ + ca] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning and of those
Construction tāsaṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit tānām + ca

Example

yasmiṃ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarati n'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, ujugatam'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti tā devatā ārabbha.

pron. for those; for them [ta] ✗

Synonym tesaṃ, nesaṃ
Sanskrit tānām

Examples

mūlaṃ papañcasaṅkhāya,
mantā asmī'ti sabbam'uparundhe,
yā kāci taṇhā ajjhattaṃ,
tāsaṃ vinayā sadā sato sikkhe.

t'āhaṃ bhadde vareyy'āhe,
evaṃ kāmo daḷho mama.

evaṃ vutte, ahaṃ, bhikkhave, māraṃ pāpimantaṃ etadavocaṃ, jānāmi kho t'āhaṃ, pāpima, mā tvaṃ maññittho, na maṃ jānātī'ti. māro tvam'asi, pāpima.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
tāhaṃ 2

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning I to you; I for you
Construction te + ahaṃ
Sanskrit tvasmai + aham

Examples

taṃ t'āhaṃ, bhikkhu, evaṃ vadāmi, iṅgha tvaṃ, mārisa, yadeva te brahmā āha tadeva tvaṃ karohi, mā tvaṃ brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattittho.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.

Grammar pron, fem abl pl of ta
Meaning from those
Construction ta + āhi
Sanskrit tebhyaḥ

Example

evañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, te bhikkhū tāhi āpattīhi vuṭṭhitā honti, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, ṭhapetvā diṭṭh'āvikammaṃ, ṭhapetvā ye na tattha hontī'ti.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ
tāḷa 1

masc. music; drumming; percussion; lit. beating [√taḷ + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from tāḷeti
Meaning music; drumming; percussion; lit. beating
Root Family √taḷ
Root √taḷ･8 *e (beat)
√ In Comps ttaḷ
Construction √taḷ > tāḷ + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym pāṇissara
Sanskrit tāla
Sanskrit Root √taḍ 10 (beat)

Example

k'āyaṃ eḷagalāgumbe,
karoti ahuhāsiyaṃ,
na'y'idha naccaṃ vā gītaṃ vā,
tāḷaṃ vā susamāhitaṃ,
anamhikāle sussoṇi,
kiṃ nu jagghasi sobhaṇe.

JA 374 cūḷadhanuggaha jātakaṃ
tāḷa 2

nt. drumming; percussion; lit. beaten [√taḷ + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of tāḷeti
Meaning drumming; percussion; lit. beaten
Root Family √taḷ
Root √taḷ･8 *e (beat)
√ In Comps ttaḷ
Base √taḷ + *e > tāḷe
Construction tāḷe + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (ANa) mahātūriyatāḷitavāditenā'ti mahantena tūriyatāḷitavāditena. tattha paṭhamaṃ saṅghaṭṭanaṃ tāḷitaṃ nāma hoti, tato paraṃ vāditaṃ.
Sanskrit tāḍita
Sanskrit Root √taḍ 10 (beat)

Example

tena kho pana samayena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa seto nāma nāgo mahātūriyatāḷitavāditena pubbakoṭṭhakā paccuttarati.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ
tāḷita 3

pp. (+instr) beaten (with); thrashed (with); flogged (with) [√taḷ + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of tāḷeti (+instr)
Meaning beaten (with); thrashed (with); flogged (with)
Root Family √taḷ
Root √taḷ･8 *e (beat)
√ In Comps ttaḷ
Base √taḷ + *e > tāḷe
Construction tāḷe + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym hata
Sanskrit tāḍita
Sanskrit Root √taḍ 10 (beat)

Example

nāsāyaṃ suggahitaṃ gahetvā uparighaṭāyaṃ suniggahitaṃ niggaṇheyya. uparighaṭāyaṃ suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā daṇḍena sutāḷitaṃ tāḷeyya. daṇḍena sutāḷitaṃ tāḷetvā osajjeyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
tāḷī

adj. striking; hitting [√taḷ + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from tāḷeti
Meaning striking; hitting
Root Family √taḷ
Root √taḷ･8 *e (beat)
√ In Comps ttaḷ
Construction √taḷ > tāḷ + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit tāḍī
Sanskrit Root √taḍ 10 (beat)

Example

tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti

MN 13 mahā dukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

Base √taḷ + *e > tāḷe
Construction tāḷe + ti

nāsāyaṃ suggahitaṃ gahetvā uparighaṭāyaṃ suniggahitaṃ niggaṇheyya. uparighaṭāyaṃ suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā daṇḍena sutāḷitaṃ tāḷeyya. daṇḍena sutāḷitaṃ tāḷetvā osajjeyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti, kasāhi'pi tāḷenti, vettehi'pi tāḷenti, aḍḍhadaṇḍakehi'pi tāḷenti, hattham'pi chindanti, pādam'pi chindanti, hatthapādam'pi chindanti, kaṇṇam'pi chindanti, nāsam'pi chindanti, kaṇṇanāsam'pi chindanti

yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo te tayo dhamme abhinivajjetvā, yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo te tayo dhamme samādāya vattissāmā'ti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

Meaning triad; group of three
Construction ti + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym taya
Sanskrit trika

Example

ekaṃ ekakaṃ, dve dukā, tīṇi tikā, cattāri catukkā, pañca pañcakā, cha chakkā, satta sattakā, aṭṭha aṭṭhakā, nava navakā, dasa dasakā'ti, satam'pi mayaṃ, bho gotama, gaṇāpema, bhiyyo'pi gaṇāpema.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

adj. with the third stage (in the sutta system) or the fourth stage (in the abhidhamma system) of meditation [tika + catukka + jhānika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the third stage (in the sutta system) or the fourth stage (in the abhidhamma system) of meditation
Construction tika + catukka + jhānika
Sanskrit trika + catuṣka + dhyānika
tikaṭuka

tikaṇṇasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.59 (AN3.59) ✗
tikanipāta 1

masc. Book 3 of the Itivuttaka; Book of Threes ✗
tikanipāta 2

masc. Chapter 3 of the Theragātha (TH170-185) ✗
tikanipāta 3

masc. Chapter 3 of the Therīgāthā (THI29-36) ✗
tikanipāta 4

masc. Chapter 3 of the Jātaka ✗
tikanipātapāḷi

fem. Book 3 of the Aṅguttara Nikāya; Book of Threes ✗
tikabhojana

nt. eating in a group of (not more than) three [tika + bhojana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning eating in a group of (not more than) three
Construction tika + bhojana
Commentary (VINa) tikabhojanan'ti ettha tīhi janehi bhuñjitabbabhojanaṃ. (SNa) tikabhojanaṃ paññattan'ti, idaṃ gaṇabhojane aññatra samayā pācittiyan'ti (pāci. 211). idaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. tattha hi tiṇṇaṃ janānaṃ akappiyanimantanaṃ sādiyitvā ekato paṭiggaṇhantānam'pi anāpatti, tasmā tikabhojanan'ti vuttaṃ.
tikavagga

masc. Chapter 11 of Chakkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.107-116 ✗
tikicchaka

masc. healer; doctor; physician [√kit + cha + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from tikicchati, desid
Meaning healer; doctor; physician
Root Family √kit
Root √kit･1 cha (heal, cure)
Base √kit + kit + sa > tikiccha (desid)
Construction tikiccha + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change k > t
Synonym bhisakka
Sanskrit cikitsaka
Sanskrit Root √cit 1 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

sabbaññū sabbadassāvī,
jino ācariyo mama,
mahākāruṇiko satthā,
sabbalokatikicchako.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
tikicchakasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.108 (AN10.108) ✗
tikicchati

pr. (+acc) heals; cures [√kit + cha + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, desid of √kit, trans (+acc)
Meaning heals; cures
Root Family √kit
Root √kit･1 cha (heal, cure)
Base √kit + kit + sa > tikiccha (desid)
Construction tikiccha + ti
Phonetic Change k > t
Synonym viruhati
Sanskrit cikitsati
Sanskrit Root √cit 1 (perceive, know, appear)

Examples

addasā kho, bhikkhave, vepacitti asur'indo sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ. disvāna sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ etadavoca, tikiccha maṃ devānam'indā'ti

SN 11.23 sambarimāyāsuttaṃ

tija gupa kita mānu icc'etehi dhātūhi kha cha sa icc'ete paccayā honti vā. titikkhati, jigucchati, tikicchati, vīmaṃsati. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? tejati, gopati, māneti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 433
tikicchanta

prp. (+acc) healing; curing [√kit + cha + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of tikicchati, desid, trans (+acc)
Meaning healing; curing
Root Family √kit
Root √kit･1 cha (heal, cure)
Base √kit + kit + sa > tikiccha (desid)
Construction tikiccha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change k > t
Sanskrit cikitsat
Sanskrit Root √cit 1 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

ubhinnaṃ tikicchantānaṃ,
attano ca parassa ca,
janā maññanti bālo'ti,
ye dhammassa akovidā'ti.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ
tikicchā

fem. medicine; healing [√kit + cha + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from tikicchati, desid
Meaning medicine; healing
Root Family √kit
Root √kit･1 cha (heal, cure)
Base √kit + kit + sa > tikiccha (desid)
Construction tikiccha + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change k > t
Sanskrit cikitsā
Sanskrit Root √cit 1 (perceive, know, appear)

Example

āthabbaṇaṃ supinaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ,
no vidahe atho'pi nakkhattaṃ,
virutañ'ca gabbhakaraṇaṃ,
tikicchaṃ māmako na seveyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

tikuṭika

adj. with three huts; with three houses [ti + kuṭi + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with three huts; with three houses
Construction ti + kuṭi + ka
tikuṭi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (VINa) tattha yasmiṃ gāme ekā eva kuṭi, ekaṃ gehaṃ seyyathā'pi malayajanapade, ayaṃ ekakuṭiko gāmo nāma. etena nayena apare'pi veditabbā.
Sanskrit tri + kuṭi +

Example

gāmo nāma ekakuṭiko'pi gāmo, dvikuṭiko'pi gāmo, tikuṭiko'pi gāmo, catukuṭiko'pi gāmo, samanusso'pi gāmo, amanusso'pi gāmo, parikkhitto'pi gāmo, aparikkhitto'pi gāmo, gonisādiniviṭṭho'pi gāmo, yo'pi sattho atirekacatumāsaniviṭṭho so'pi vuccati gāmo.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
tikoṭika

adj. three-fold, three part ✗
tikoṭiparisuddha

adj. pure in three regards ✗
tikkha 1

adj. sharp; piercing; acute [√tij + kha] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning sharp; piercing; acute
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij + kha
Derivative kita (kha)
Synonym tippa, tibba, teja, nibbedhika
Sanskrit tīkṣṇa
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

paṇḍito, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. mahāpañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. puthupañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. hāsapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. javanapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. tikkhapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ
tikkha 2

adj. (of mind) sharp; quick; keen; penetrating; astute [√tij + kha] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning (of mind) sharp; quick; keen; penetrating; astute
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij + kha
Derivative kita (kha)
Antonym mudu
Synonym tikhiṇa, teja
Commentary (MNa) yesaṃ saddh'ādīni indriyāni tikkhāni, te tikkh'indriyā. yesaṃ tāni mudūni, te mud'indriyā.
Sanskrit tīkṣṇa
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

addasaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, buddhacakkhunā lokaṃ volokento satte apparaj'akkhe mahāraj'akkhe, tikkh'indriye mudindriye, svākāre dvākāre, suviññāpaye duviññāpaye, app'ekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, app'ekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
tikkhatā

fem. sharpness; fact of being piercing [√tij + kha + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from tikkha
Meaning sharpness; fact of being piercing
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij + kha + tā
tikkha + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit tīkṣṇatā
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)
tikkhattuṃ

ind. three times; thrice [ti + kkhattuṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from ti
Meaning three times; thrice
Construction ti + kkhattuṃ
Derivative taddhita (kkhattuṃ)
Sanskrit trikṛtvas

Examples

evaṃ vutte ārāmadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā dakkhiṇaṃ jāṇumaṇḍalaṃ pathaviyaṃ nihantvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ udānaṃ udānesi

AN 2.38 samacittavaggo

evaṃ vutte, brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ udānaṃ udāneti

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
tikkhapañña

adj. with piercing wisdom; with very sharp understanding; with acute intelligence [tikkha + paññā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with piercing wisdom; with very sharp understanding; with acute intelligence
Construction tikkha + paññā + a
tikkhapaññā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (SNa) katamā tikkhapaññā? khippaṃ kilese chindatī'ti tikkhapaññā.
Sanskrit tīkṣṇa + prajña

Example

paṇḍito, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. mahāpañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. puthupañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. hāsapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. javanapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. tikkhapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ
tikkhapaññatā

fem. state of piercing wisdom; fact of having sharp understanding [tikkha + paññatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of piercing wisdom; fact of having sharp understanding
Construction tikkha + paññatā
Commentary (PM) tikkhapaññatāya saṃvattantī'ti katamā tikkhapaññā? khippaṃ kilese chindatī'ti, tikkhapaññā. uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gametī'ti, tikkhapaññā. uppannaṃ byāpādavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gametī'ti, tikkhapaññā. uppannaṃ vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti … uppannuppanne pāpake akusale dhamme n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gametī'ti, tikkhapaññā.
tikkhapaññāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 55.73 (SN55.73) ✗

tikkhindriya

adj. with keen mental faculties; with a sharp mind; lit. sharp faculties [tikkha + indriya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with keen mental faculties; with a sharp mind; lit. sharp faculties
Construction tikkha + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (tikkha + indriya)
Antonym mudindriya
Commentary (MNa) yesaṃ saddh'ādīni indriyāni tikkhāni, te tikkh'indriyā. yesaṃ tāni mudūni, te mud'indriyā.
Sanskrit tīkṣṇa + indriya

Example

addasaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, buddhacakkhunā lokaṃ volokento satte apparaj'akkhe mahāraj'akkhe, tikkh'indriye mud'indriye, svākāre dvākāre, suviññāpaye duviññāpaye, app'ekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, app'ekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
tikhiṇa 1

adj. sharp; pointed; keen [√tij + iṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, from tejati
Meaning sharp; pointed; keen
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 a (be sharp, bitter)
Construction √tij > tikh + iṇa
Derivative kita (iṇa)
Phonetic Change j > kh
Synonym tikkha, teja
Sanskrit tīkṣṇa
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

kadā nu'haṃ bhayajananiṃ dukh'āvahaṃ,
taṇhālataṃ bahuvidh'ānuvattaniṃ,
paññāmayaṃ tikhiṇam'asiṃ gahetvā,
chetvā vase tam'pi kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
tikhiṇa 2

adj. pungent, acrid [√tij] ✗
tikhiṇakasāpatodābhighātādidukkha
