tigāvuta

adj. measuring 3 gāvutas ✗
tigāvutika

adj. measuring three gāvuta; measuring three quarters of a yojana ✗
tiguṇa

adj. threefold; three times; of three thicknesses ✗
ticīvara

nt. set of three robes [ti + cīvara] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning set of three robes
Construction ti + cīvara
Compound digu (tīni + cīvarāni)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.2) ekarattam'pi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyyā'ti saṅghāṭiyā vā uttar'āsaṅgena vā antaravāsakena vā.
Sanskrit tricīvara

Examples

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattam'pi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 2 udositasikkhāpadaṃ

atha kho dasamo gahapati aṭṭhakanāgaro ... ekam'ekañ'ca bhikkhuṃ paccekaṃ dussayugena acchādesi, āyasmantañ'ca ānandaṃ ticīvarena acchādesi, āyasmato ca ānandassa pañcasatavihāraṃ kārāpesī'ti.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ
tiṭṭhati 1

pr. stands [√ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning stands
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + ti
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit tiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, phass'āhāro daṭṭhabbo? seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gāvī niccammā kuḍḍañ'ce nissāya tiṭṭheyya

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

saccā avokkama muni,
thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo,
sabbaṃ so paṭinissajja,
sa ve santo'ti vuccati.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
tiṭṭhati 2

pr. (+loc) stays (in); lives (in) [√ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning stays (in); lives (in)
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + ti
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Synonym ajjhāvasati, paṭivasati, vasati, seti
Sanskrit tiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

yuvā'si tvaṃ pabbajito,
tiṭṭhāhi mama sāsane,
bhuñja mānusake kāme,
ahaṃ vittaṃ dadāmi te,
saccaṃ te paṭijānāmi,
aggiṃ vā te harām'ahaṃ.

TH 224 sundarasamuddattheragāthā

niddaṃ tandiṃ sahe thīnaṃ,
pamādena na saṃvase,
atimāne na tiṭṭheyya,
nibbānamanaso naro.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
tiṭṭhati 3

pr. (+acc) remains; persists; lasts; lit. stands [√ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning remains; persists; lasts; lit. stands
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + ti
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Synonym avatiṭṭhati, saṇṭhāti
Commentary (VIN 1.2.10) tiṭṭheyyā'ti na paṭinissajjeyya.
Sanskrit tiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

yāya devā manussā ca,
sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti,
nirayamhi samappitā.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10

yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'c'āpi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
tiṭṭhati 4

pr. (+acc) exists; lit. stands [√ṭhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+acc)
Meaning exists; lit. stands
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + ti
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Synonym bhavati, hoti
Sanskrit tiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yaṃ tiṭṭhat'eva nibbānaṃ, tiṭṭhati nibbānagāmī maggo, tiṭṭhati bhavaṃ gotamo samādapetā, atha ca pana ... ekacce n'ārādhentī'ti?

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
tiṭṭhatu

imp. never mind that!; let that be!; lit. let it stand [√ṭhā + a + tu] ✓

Grammar imp of tiṭṭhati, intrans
Meaning never mind that!; let that be!; lit. let it stand
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + tu
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit tiṣṭhatu
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

tiṭṭhatha tumhe soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo mayā saddhiṃ paṭimantetū'ti

DN 4.5 soṇadaṇḍasuttaṃ

brāhmaṇo evam'āha, tiṭṭhatu nāgo, mā nāgaṃ ghaṭṭesi, namo karohi nāgassā'ti.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ
tiṭṭhatetaṃ

sandhi. let that be!; enough of that! [tiṭṭhatu + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + pron
Meaning let that be!; enough of that!
Construction tiṭṭhatu + etaṃ
Commentary (ANa) tiṭṭhat'etan'ti tiṭṭhatu etaṃ, mā etaṃ paṭṭhapetha, ko vo etena attho.
Sanskrit tiṣṭhatu + etam

Examples

alaṃ, brāhmaṇā! tiṭṭhat'etaṃ, imesaṃ ubhinnaṃ ñāṇavādānaṃ ubhinnaṃ aññam'aññaṃ vipaccanīkavādānaṃ ko saccaṃ āha ko musā'ti. dhammaṃ vo, brāhmaṇā, desessāmi, taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.

AN 9.38 lokāyatikasuttaṃ

api ca tiṭṭhat'etaṃ, idāni'pi mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ gotamaṃ pucchāma, ko nu kho āyasmantānaṃ sukhavihāritaro rājā vā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro āyasmā vā gotamo'ti?

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
tiṭṭhatesā

sandhi. never mind that!; let that be!; lit. let that stand [tiṭṭhatu + esā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + pron
Meaning never mind that!; let that be!; lit. let that stand
Construction tiṭṭhatu + esā
Sanskrit tiṣṭhatu + etā

Examples

evaṃ vutte poṭṭhapādo paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, tiṭṭhat'esā, bhante, kathā, yāya mayaṃ eta'r'ahi kathāya sannisinnā. n'esā, bhante, kathā bhagavato dullabhā bhavissati pacchā'pi savanāya.

DN 9.2 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, abhisaññānirodhakathā

tiṭṭhat'esā, bho gotama, amhākañ'c'eva aññesañ'ca puthusamaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ vācā. vilāpaṃ vilapitaṃ maññe.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
tiṭṭhana

nt. standing; remaining [√ṭhā + a + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from tiṭṭhati
Meaning standing; remaining
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit sthāna
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
tiṭṭhanaka

adj. lasting; remaining [√ṭhā] ✗
tiṭṭhanta 1

prp. standing; standing still [√ṭhā + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of tiṭṭhati, intrans
Meaning standing; standing still
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit tiṣṭhat
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

viññāṇaṭṭhitiyo sabbā,
abhijānaṃ tathāgato,
tiṭṭhantam'enaṃ jānāti,
vimuttaṃ tapparāyaṇaṃ.

SNP 69 posāla māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 14

majjhe sarasmiṃ tiṭṭhataṃ,
oghe jāte mahabbhaye,
jarāmaccuparetānaṃ,
dīpaṃ pabrūhi mārisa,
tvañ'ca me dīpamakkhāhi,
yathā'y'idaṃ n'āparaṃ siyā.

SNP 65 kappa māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 10
tiṭṭhanta 2

prp. lasting; remaining; persisting; lit. standing [√ṭhā + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of tiṭṭhati, intrans
Meaning lasting; remaining; persisting; lit. standing
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit tiṣṭhat
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

tassa tiṭṭhant'eva pañc'indriyāni yesaṃ avighātattā manāp'āmanāpaṃ paccanubhoti, sukhadukkhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti. tassa yo rāgakkhayo, dosakkhayo, mohakkhayo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, saupādisesā nibbānadhātu.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ

satto guhāyaṃ bahun'ābhichanno,
tiṭṭhaṃ naro mohanasmiṃ pagāḷho,
dūre vivekā hi tathāvidho so,
kāmā hi loke na hi suppahāyā.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
tiṭṭhantu

imp. never mind them! let them be!; lit. let them stand [√ṭhā + a + ntu] ~

Grammar imp 3rd pl of tiṭṭhatu, intrans
Meaning never mind them! let them be!; lit. let them stand
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + ntu
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit tiṣṭhantu
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
tiṭṭhabhadantika

masc. who stops and waits (for a donor when begging) ✗
tiṭṭhabhaddantika

adj. who stays when asked; lit. stand sir [tiṭṭha + bhaddanta + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who stays when asked; lit. stand sir
Construction tiṭṭha + bhaddanta + ika
tiṭṭhabhaddanta + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Antonym natiṭṭhabhaddantika
Commentary (MNa) tena hi tiṭṭha bhaddante'ti vutto'pi na tiṭṭhatī'ti na tiṭṭhabhaddantiko.
Sanskrit tiṣṭha + bhadanta

Example

tatrāssu me idaṃ, sāriputta, tapassitāya hoti, acelako homi muttācāro hatth'āpalekhano, na ehibhaddantiko na tiṭṭhabhaddantiko

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
tiṭṭhamāna

prp. standing; remaining [√ṭhā + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of tiṭṭhati, intrans
Meaning standing; remaining
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit tiṣṭhamāna
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

catukkhattuṃ pañcakkhattuṃ chakkhattu'paramaṃ tuṇhībhūto uddissa tiṭṭhamāno taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, icc'etaṃ kusalaṃ, tato ce uttari vāyamamāno taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ

dissat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, cātumahābhūtiko kāyo ekam'pi vassaṃ tiṭṭhamāno dve'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno tīṇi'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ
tiṭṭhaṃ

prp. standing; staying still [√ṭhā + a + nta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar prp, masc nom sg of tiṭṭhanta, intrans
Meaning standing; staying still
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + nta + aṃ
tiṭṭhanta + aṃ
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit sthāyam
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Example

ṭhitena kāyena ṭhitena cetasā,
tiṭṭhaṃ nisinno uda vā sayāno,
etaṃ satiṃ bhikkhu adhiṭṭhahāno,
labhetha pubb'āpariyaṃ visesaṃ,
laddhāna pubb'āpariyaṃ visesaṃ,
adassanaṃ maccurājassa gacche'ti.

UD 50 cūḷapanthakasuttaṃ
tiṭṭhānika

adj. having three places ✗
tiṭṭhituṃ

inf. to stand [√ṭhā + a + ituṃ] ~

Grammar inf of tiṭṭhati, intrans
Meaning to stand
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + ituṃ
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit sthātum
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)
tiṭṭheyya

opt. (+acc) should remain; should persist; should continue; lit. should stand [√ṭhā + a + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of tiṭṭhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning should remain; should persist; should continue; lit. should stand
Root Family √ṭhā
Root √ṭhā･1 a (stand)
√ In Comps ṭṭhā
Base √ṭhā + ṭhā + a > tiṭṭha
Construction tiṭṭha + eyya
Phonetic Change ṭ > t
Sanskrit tiṣṭhati
Sanskrit Root √sthā 1 (stand)

Examples

kayavikkaye na tiṭṭheyya,
upavādaṃ bhikkhu na kareyya kuhiñci,
gāme ca n'ābhisajjeyya,
lābhakamyā janaṃ na lapayeyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'c'āpi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
tiṭhāna

nt. in reference to Tiṭhānasutta; Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.21 (AN9.21); lit. three facts [ti + ṭhāna] ~

tiṭhānasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.42 (AN3.42) ✗
tiṭhānasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.21 (AN9.21) ✗
tiṇa 1

nt. grass; straw ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning grass; straw
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poaceae
Sanskrit tṛṇa

Examples

tassā evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ

so tattha allāni c'eva tiṇāni pakkhipeyya, allāni ca gomayāni pakkhipeyya, allāni ca kaṭṭhāni pakkhipeyya, udakavātañ'ca dadeyya, paṃsukena ca okireyya.

Meaning weed

rāgadosā ayaṃ pajā,
tasmā hi vītarāgesu,
dinnaṃ hoti mahapphalaṃ.

DHP 356 taṇhāvaggo

yadā paññāya passati,
mamattaṃ so asaṃvindaṃ,
n'atthi me'ti na socati.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
tiṇakaṭṭhanissita

adj. living in the grass and wood [tiṇakaṭṭha + nissita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living in the grass and wood
Construction tiṇakaṭṭha + nissita
tiṇakaṭṭhapaṇṇakasaṭa

masc. pile of dead grass twigs and leaves [tiṇa + kaṭṭha + paṇṇa + kasaṭa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning pile of dead grass twigs and leaves
Construction tiṇa + kaṭṭha + paṇṇa + kasaṭa
Variant tiṇakaṭṭhapaṇṇasaṭa
Commentary (VINa) tiṇakaṭṭhapaṇṇasaṭan'ti tattha tattha patitaṃ tiṇakaṭṭhapaṇṇaṃ. atha vā tiṇañ'ca nissārakaṃ lahukaṃ kaṭṭhañ'ca tiṇakaṭṭhaṃ. paṇṇasaṭan'ti purāṇapaṇṇaṃ.
Sanskrit tṛṇa + kāṣṭha + parṇa + sakaṭa
tiṇakaṭṭhapaṇṇasaṭa

masc. pile of dead grass twigs and leaves [tiṇa + kaṭṭha + paṇṇa + saṭa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning pile of dead grass twigs and leaves
Construction tiṇa + kaṭṭha + paṇṇa + saṭa
Variant tiṇakaṭṭhapaṇṇakasaṭa
Commentary (VINa) tiṇakaṭṭhapaṇṇasaṭan'ti tattha tattha patitaṃ tiṇakaṭṭhapaṇṇaṃ. atha vā tiṇañ'ca nissārakaṃ lahukaṃ kaṭṭhañ'ca tiṇakaṭṭhaṃ. paṇṇasaṭan'ti purāṇapaṇṇaṃ.
Sanskrit tṛṇa + kāṣṭha + parṇa + sakaṭa
tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsa

nt. grass, timber, branches and leaves [tiṇa + kaṭṭha + sākhā + palāsa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning grass, timber, branches and leaves
Construction tiṇa + kaṭṭha + sākhā + palāsa

Sanskrit tṛṇa + kāṣṭha + śākhā + palāśa

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso yaṃ imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ tacchetvā ekajjhaṃ saṃhareyya, ekajjhaṃ saṃharitvā sūlaṃ kareyya

SN 56.36 pāṇasuttaṃ

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ saṃkaḍḍhitvā, kullaṃ bandhitvā, taṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttareyyan'ti.

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro tiṇagahanaṃ vā nissito hoti, rukkhagahanaṃ vā rodhaṃ vā mahāvanasaṇḍaṃ vā.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

Example

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, tiṇ'agge ussāvabindu sūriye uggacchante khippaṃ'y'eva paṭivigacchati, na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, ussāvabind'ūpamaṃ jīvitaṃ manussānaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ bahudukkhaṃ bah'upāyāsaṃ mant'āyaṃ boddhabbaṃ, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ, caritabbaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, n'atthi jātassa amaraṇaṃ.

Grammar adj, comp

Construction tiṇa + bhakkha

Examples

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

te tattha sākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, sāmākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, nīvārabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, daddulabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, haṭabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, kaṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, ācāmabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, piññākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, tiṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, gomayabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, vanamūlaphal'āhārā yāpesuṃ pavattaphalabhojī.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
tiṇabhisi

fem. grass pillow; straw mattress [tiṇa + bhisi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning grass pillow; straw mattress
Construction tiṇa + bhisi
Compound kammadhāraya (tiṇa + bhisi)
Sanskrit tṛṇa + bṛsī

Example

bhisi nāma pañca bhisiyo, uṇṇabhisi, coḷabhisi, vākabhisi, tiṇabhisi, paṇṇabhisi.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
tiṇamuṭṭhi

masc. handful of grass [tiṇa + muṭṭhi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning handful of grass
Construction tiṇa + muṭṭhi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tiṇānaṃ + muṭṭhi)
Sanskrit tṛṇamuṣṭi

Example

migaluddo pure āsiṃ,
araññe kānane ahaṃ,
disvāna taṃ devadevaṃ,
tiṇamuṭṭhiṃ adās'ahaṃ.

APA 523 tiṇamuṭṭhidāyaka therāpadānaṃ
tiṇava

masc. drum ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning drum
Synonym ḍiṇḍima
Commentary (ANa) tiṇavo'ti ḍiṇḍimo
Sanskrit trivalī

Example

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato khamo hoti sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ pharasuppahārānaṃ bheripaṇavasaṅkhatiṇavaninnādasaddānaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khantā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
tiṇavatthāraka

masc. (vinaya) covering with grass; sweeping under the carpet [tiṇa + avatthāraka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (vinaya) covering with grass; sweeping under the carpet
Construction tiṇa + avatthāraka
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (tiṇena + avatthāraka)
Commentary (MNa) tiṇ'avatthārako'ti ettha idaṃ kammaṃ tiṇ'avatthārakasadisattā tiṇ'avatthārako'ti vuttaṃ. yathā hi gūthaṃ vā muttaṃ vā ghaṭṭiyamānaṃ duggandhatāya bādhati, tiṇehi avattharitvā suppaṭicchāditassa panassa so gandho na bādhati. (ANa) bhaṇḍan'ādivasena bahuṃ assāmaṇakaṃ katvā āpattiṃ āpannānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ ṭhapetvā gihipaṭisaṃyuttañ'ca avases'āpattīnaṃ vūpasaman'atthāya tiṇ'avatthārako paññatto.
Sanskrit tṛṇaprastāraka (bsk)

Examples

uppann'uppannānaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ samathāya vūpasamāya sammukhāvinayo dātabbo, sativinayo dātabbo, amūḷhavinayo dātabbo, paṭiññāya kāretabbaṃ, yebhuyyasikā, tassapāpiyasikā, tiṇ'avatthārako'ti.

VIN PAT AS adhikaraṇasamathā

yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ tiṇ'avatthārakena vūpasameyya, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttan'ti.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ
tiṇasantharaka

masc. spread of grass; grass mat [tiṇa + santhara + ka] ~

Grammar masc, comp, from tiṇasanthara
Meaning spread of grass; grass mat
Construction tiṇa + santhara + ka
tiṇasanthara + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (tiṇa + santharaka)
Variant tiṇasantharika, tiṇasanthāraka
Sanskrit tṛṇa + saṃstīrṇa + ka
tiṇasanthāra

masc. grass mat; lit. spread of grass [tiṇa + santhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning grass mat; lit. spread of grass
Construction tiṇa + santhāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tiṇānaṃ + santhāra)
Commentary (VINa) tiṇasanthāro'ti yesaṃ kesañci tiṇānaṃ santhāro. esa nayo paṇṇasanthāre
Sanskrit tṛṇa + saṃstāra

Example

seyyaṃ nāma bhisi, cimilikā uttar'attharaṇaṃ, bhūm'attharaṇaṃ, taṭṭikā, cammakhaṇḍo, nisīdanaṃ, paccattharaṇaṃ, tiṇasanthāro, paṇṇasanthāro.

VIN 2.5.2.5 dutiyasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
tiṇasanthāraka

masc. spread of grass; grass mat [tiṇa + santhāra + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from tiṇasanthāra
Meaning spread of grass; grass mat
Construction tiṇa + santhāra + ka
tiṇasanthāra + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (tiṇa + santhāraka)
Variant tiṇasantharika, tiṇasantharaka
Sanskrit tṛṇa + saṃstīrṇa + ka

Examples

atha kho bhagavā kumbhakār'āvesanaṃ pavisitvā ekam'antaṃ tiṇasanthārakaṃ paññāpetvā nisīdi pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ te tiṇasanthārakasayan'āsanaṃ khāyissati santuṭṭhassa viharato ratiyā aparitassāya phāsuvihārāya okkamanāya nibbānassa

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
tiṇasanthārakasayanāsana

nt. living place made of a grass spread; lit. grass spread lying sitting [tiṇasanthāraka + sayanāsana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning living place made of a grass spread; lit. grass spread lying sitting
Construction tiṇasanthāraka + sayanāsana
Compound kammadhāraya (tiṇasanthāraka + sayanāsana)
Sanskrit tṛṇa + saṃstīrṇa + śayanāsana

Example

evam'evaṃ te tiṇasanthārakasayan'āsanaṃ khāyissati santuṭṭhassa viharato ratiyā aparitassāya phāsuvihārāya okkamanāya nibbānassa.

AN 8.30 anuruddhamahāvitakkasuttaṃ
tiṇasūla

nt. kind of jasmine ✗
tiṇahāraka

masc. grass gatherer [tiṇa + hāraka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning grass gatherer
Construction tiṇa + hāraka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (tiṇāni + hāraka)
Sanskrit tṛṇa + hāraka

Example

yadā passāmi gopālakaṃ vā pasupālakaṃ vā tiṇahārakaṃ vā kaṭṭhahārakaṃ vā vanakammikaṃ vā, vanena vanaṃ gahanena gahanaṃ ninnena ninnaṃ thalena thalaṃ saṃpatāmi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
tiṇahāri

fem. (one) who fetches grass or hay ✗
tiṇāgāra

nt. cottage thatched with grass ✗
tiṇukkā

fem. grass torch [tiṇa + ukkā] ✓

Meaning grass torch
Construction tiṇa + ukkā

Examples

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, puriso ādittaṃ tiṇ'ukkaṃ ādāya paṭivātaṃ gaccheyya.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ

maṃsapes'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo. tiṇ'ukk'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
tiṇukkūpama

adj. like a grass torch; similar to a grass torch [tiṇa + ukkā + upama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a grass torch; similar to a grass torch
Construction tiṇa + ukkā + upama
Compound kammadhāraya (tiṇukkā + upama)
Commentary (MNa) tiṇ'ukk'ūpamā anudahan'aṭṭhena.
Sanskrit tṛṇa + ulkā + upama

Examples

evam'eva kho, gahapati, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, tiṇ'ukk'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo'ti.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ

maṃsapes'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo. tiṇ'ukk'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.

Example

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning bowl of grass and water
Construction tiṇodaka + datti
Commentary (ANa) ekissā vā tiṇ'odakadattiyā vimānito'ti ekadivasaṃ ekena tiṇ'odakadānena vimānito, ekadivasamattaṃ aladdhatiṇ'odako'ti attho.

Meaning depletion of grass and water

Example

tesaṃ gimhānaṃ pacchime māse, tiṇ'odakasaṅkhaye, adhimattakasimānaṃ patto kāyo hoti. tesaṃ adhimattakasimānaṃ pattakāyānaṃ balavīriyaṃ parihāyi.

nt. fruit of the Malabar Ebony tree; Diospyros Malabarica [tiṇḍu + ka] ✓

Meaning fruit of the Malabar Ebony tree; Diospyros Malabarica

Example

āmalakamattiyo hutvā tiṇḍukamattiyo ahesuṃ, tiṇḍukamattiyo hutvā beḷuvasalāṭukamattiyo ahesuṃ, beḷuvasalāṭukamattiyo hutvā billamattiyo ahesuṃ, billamattiyo hutvā pabhijjiṃsu, pubbañ'ca lohitañ'ca pagghariṃsu.

AN 10.89 kokālikasuttaṃ
tiṇṇa 1

pp. (+acc) crossed over; gone beyond [√tar + na] ✓

Grammar pp of tarati (+acc)
Meaning crossed over; gone beyond
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar > tir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change a > i (Kacc 581, 616)
rn > ṇṇ
Antonym atiṇṇa
Sanskrit tīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

cirassaṃ vata passāmi,
brāhmaṇaṃ parinibbutaṃ,
appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhaṃ,
tiṇṇaṃ loke visattikan'ti.

SN 1.1 oghataraṇasuttaṃ

sabbattha upekkhako satimā,
na so hiṃsati kañci sabbaloke,
tiṇṇo samaṇo anāvilo,
ussadā yassa na santi sorato so.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
tiṇṇa 2

pp. (+acc) who has crossed over; who has gone beyond [√tar + na] ✓

Grammar pp of tarati (+acc)
Meaning who has crossed over; who has gone beyond
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar > tir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change a > i (Kacc 581, 616)
rn > ṇṇ
Antonym atiṇṇa
Commentary (ANa) tiṇṇo'ti oghaṃ taritvā ṭhito.
Sanskrit tīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)

Examples

yaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ vedagum'ābhijaññā,
akiñcanaṃ kāmabhave asattaṃ,
addhā hi so ogham'imaṃ atāri,
tiṇṇo ca pāraṃ akhilo akaṅkho.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4

yasmiṃ kāmā na vasanti,
taṇhā yassa na vijjati,
kathaṃkathā ca yo tiṇṇo,
vimokkho tassa n'āparo.

SNP 64 todeyya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 9
tiṇṇakathaṃkatha

adj. free from doubt; gone beyond doubt; lit. crossed asking how? [tiṇṇa + kathaṃkathā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning free from doubt; gone beyond doubt; lit. crossed asking how?
Construction tiṇṇa + kathaṃkathā + a
tiṇṇakathaṃkathā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (tiṇṇa + kathaṃkathaṃ)
Sanskrit tīrṇa + kathaṃkathā

Example

yo nīvaraṇe pahāya pañca,
anigho tiṇṇakathaṃkatho visallo,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1
tiṇṇavicikiccha

adj. crossed beyond doubt; overcome uncertainty [tiṇṇa + vicikicchā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning crossed beyond doubt; overcome uncertainty
Construction tiṇṇa + vicikicchā + a
tiṇṇavicikicchā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (tiṇṇa + vicikicchaṃ)
Variant tiṇṇavicchikiccha
Commentary (ANa) tiṇṇavicikiccho'ti vicikicchaṃ taritvā atikkamitvā ṭhito. (UDa) tattha paṭibhayakantārasadisā soḷasavatthukā ca aṭṭhavatthukā ca tiṇṇā vicikicchā etenā'ti tiṇṇavicikiccho.
Sanskrit tīrṇa + vicikitsā

Examples

atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṃkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

vicikicchaṃ pahāya tiṇṇavicikiccho vihāsiṃ akathaṃkathī kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchāya cittaṃ parisodhesiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
tiṇṇavicikicchatā

fem. fact of being beyond doubt; state without uncertainty [tiṇṇa + vicikicchā + a + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of being beyond doubt; state without uncertainty
Construction tiṇṇa + vicikicchā + a + tā
tiṇṇavicikiccha + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit tīrṇa + vicikitsā +

Examples

etam'ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, tiṇṇavicikicchataṃ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomam'āpādiṃ araññe vihārāya.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

vicikicchissa purisapuggalassa tiṇṇavicikicchatā hoti parikkamanāya, kodhanassa purisapuggalassa akkodho hoti parikkamanāya, upanāhissa purisapuggalassa anupanāho hoti parikkamanāya

tiṇṇavicchikiccha

adj. crossed beyond doubt; overcome uncertainty [tiṇṇa + vicchikicchā + a] ~

tiṇṇasokapariddava

adj. who has gone beyond weeping and wailing; who has overcome grief and mourning [tiṇṇa + soka + pariddava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has gone beyond weeping and wailing; who has overcome grief and mourning
Construction tiṇṇa + soka + pariddava
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (tiṇṇa + sokapariddavaṃ)
Commentary (DHPa) tiṇṇasokapariddave'ti atikkantasokapariddave, ime dve atikkante'ti attho. etehi pūj'ārahattaṃ dassitaṃ.
Sanskrit tīrṇa + śoka + parideva

Example

pūj'ārahe pūjayato,
buddhe yadi va sāvake,
papañcasamatikkante,
tiṇṇasokapariddave.

DHP 195 buddhavaggo
tiṇṇaṃ

card. of three [ti + ānaṃ] ✓

Grammar card, masc and nt gen pl of ti
Meaning of three
Construction ti + ānaṃ
Sanskrit trayāṇām

Examples

yā kho, bhikkhave, imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ saṅgati sannipāto samavāyo, ayaṃ vuccati cakkhusamphasso. cakkhusamphasso'pi anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ

attānañ'ce piyaṃ jaññā,
rakkheyya naṃ surakkhitaṃ,
tiṇṇaṃ aññataraṃ yāmaṃ,
paṭijaggeyya paṇḍito.

DHP 157 attavaggo
tiṇṇāvī

adj. (+acc) who has crossed over; who has gone beyond [√tar + nāvī] ~

Grammar adj, app of tarati (+acc)
Meaning who has crossed over; who has gone beyond
Root Family √tar
Root √tar･1 a (cross)
Construction √tar > tir + nāvī
Derivative kita (nāvī)
Phonetic Change a > i (Kacc 581, 616)
rn > ṇṇ
Sanskrit tīrṇavat
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1 (pass)
tiṇha

adj. (of blade) sharp [√tij + ṇha] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning (of blade) sharp
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 a (be sharp, bitter)
Construction √tij + ṇha
Derivative kita (ṇha)
Sanskrit tigma, tīkṣṇa
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

yadā kho, āvuso, tassa purisassa evam'assa, saṃvissattho kho my'āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā'ti, atha naṃ rahogataṃ viditvā tiṇhena satthena jīvitā voropeyya.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno tiṇhaṃ kuṭhāriṃ ādāya vanaṃ paviseyya.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ
tiṇhadhāra

adj. sharp-edged ✗
tiṇhaphala

adj. sharp bladed; sharp pointed [tiṇha + phala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sharp bladed; sharp pointed
Construction tiṇha + phala
Compound kammadhāraya (tiṇha + phala)
Sanskrit tīkṣṇa + phala

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, satti tiṇhaphalā. atha puriso āgaccheyya, ahaṃ imaṃ sattiṃ tiṇhaphalaṃ pāṇinā vā muṭṭhinā vā paṭileṇissāmi paṭikoṭṭissāmi paṭivaṭṭessāmī'ti.

SN 20.5 sattisuttaṃ
titāla

adj. three palm trees in height; three palm trees deep [ti + tāla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning three palm trees in height; three palm trees deep
Construction ti + tāla
Compound kammadhāraya (ti + tāla)
Sanskrit tri + tāla

Example

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde sattatālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, chattālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, pañcatālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, catuttālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, titālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, dvitālam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, tālamattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
titālaṃ

ind. to the height of three palm trees ✗
titikkha

adj. enduring; tolerating [√tij + kha + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from titikkhati, desid
Meaning enduring; tolerating
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 kha (endure)
Base √tij + tij + sa > titikkha (desid)
Construction titikkha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit titikṣa
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

dukkaraṃ duttitikkhañ'ca,
abyattena ca sāmaññaṃ,
bahūhi tattha sambādhā,
yattha bālo visīdatī'ti.

SN 1.17 dukkarasuttaṃ
titikkhati

pr. (+acc) endures; tolerates; bears; withstands [√tij + kha + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, desid of √tij, trans (+acc)
Meaning endures; tolerates; bears; withstands
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 kha (endure)
Base √tij + tij + sa > titikkha (desid)
Construction titikkha + ti
Synonym abhisambhavati, khamati, sahati
Sanskrit titikṣate
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

ahaṃ nāgo'va saṅgāme,
cāpato patitaṃ saraṃ,
ativākyaṃ titikkhissaṃ,
dussīlo hi bahujjano.

DHP 320 nāgavaggo

yo have balavā santo,
dubbalassa titikkhati,
tam'āhu paramaṃ khantiṃ,
niccaṃ khamati dubbalo.

SN 11.4 vepacittisuttaṃ
titikkhanta

prp. enduring [√tij] ✗
titikkhamāna

prp. enduring [√tij] ✗
titikkhā

fem. endurance; patience; forgiveness [√tij + kha + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from titikkhati, desid
Meaning endurance; patience; forgiveness
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 kha (endure)
Base √tij + tij + sa > titikkha (desid)
Construction titikkha + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Variant tītikkhā
Sanskrit titikṣā
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

jayaṃ ve maññati bālo,
vācāya pharusaṃ bhaṇaṃ,
jayañ'c'ev'assa taṃ hoti,
yā titikkhā vijānato.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ

khantī paramaṃ tapo titikkhā,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ vadanti buddhā,
na hi pabbajito par'ūpaghātī,
na samaṇo hoti paraṃ viheṭhayanto.

DHP 184 buddhavaggo
titikkhācammasannāha

adj. armed with the shield of forbearance ✗
titikkhi

aor. endured [√tij] ✗
titikkhitvā

abs. having endured [√tij] ✗
titta 1.1

adj. bitter [√tij] ✗
titta 1.2

nt. bitter taste [√tij] ✗
titta 2.1

pp. contented, satisfied [√tis] ✗
tittaka 1

adj. bitter; sharp [√tij + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from titta
Meaning bitter; sharp
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 a (be sharp, bitter)
Construction √tij + ta + ka
titta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change j > t
Sanskrit tiktaka

Example

tittaka 2

nt. sharp taste; bitter taste [√tij + ta + ka] ✓

Meaning sharp taste; bitter taste
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 a (be sharp, bitter)

titta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)

Sanskrit tiktaka
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

ambilam'pi vijānāti, tittakam'pi vijānāti, kaṭukam'pi vijānāti, madhuram'pi vijānāti, khārikam'pi vijānāti, akhārikam'pi vijānāti, loṇikam'pi vijānāti, aloṇikam'pi vijānāti. vijānātī'ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā viññāṇan'ti vuccati

Construction √tij + ta + ka + tta
tittaka + tta

Sanskrit tiktaka +
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

ayaṃ tittakālābu visena saṃsaṭṭho, sace ākaṅkhasi piva. tassa te pivato c'eva nacchādessati vaṇṇena'pi gandhena'pi rasena'pi, pivitvā ca pana maraṇaṃ vā nigacchasi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti.

titti 1

Grammar fem, abstr (+loc)

Root Family √tis
Root √tis×1 a (satisfy)

Synonym santuṭṭhi, santosa
Notes PED suggests √tapp tappati sk tṛpyate
Sanskrit tṛpti
Sanskrit Root √tṛp 4, 5, 6 (be pleased)

Example

titti kāmesu vijjati,
app'assādā dukhā kāmā,
iti viññāya paṇḍito.

atha kho tāyano devaputto purāṇatitthakaro abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12

Meaning triple rod; tripod; lit. three sticks
Construction ti + daṇḍa
Compound digu (tayo + daṇḍā)
Sanskrit tridaṇḍa

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchā laṅghati, kubbaraṃ hanati, tidaṇḍaṃ bhañjati. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo assadoso.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

tayo lokā tilokaṃ, tayo daṇḍā tidaṇḍaṃ, tīṇi nayanāni tinayanaṃ, tayo siṅgā tisiṅgaṃ. catasso disā catuddisaṃ, pañca indriyāni pañc'indriyaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 321
tidasa 1

adj. of Tavatimsa heaven; lit. thirty [ti + dasa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of Tavatimsa heaven; lit. thirty
Construction ti + dasa
Commentary (SNa) tidasānan'ti tikkhattuṃ dasannaṃ.

Example

na te sukhaṃ pajānanti,
ye na passanti nandanaṃ,
āvāsaṃ naradevānaṃ,
tidasānaṃ yasassinan'ti.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 321
tinta

pp. wet; moist; soggy; lit. moistened [√tim + ta] ~

Grammar pp of √tim
Meaning wet; moist; soggy; lit. moistened
Root Family √tim
Root √tim･1 *a (be wet)
Construction √tim + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym adda, alla, sasneha, siniddha, sinehavant
Sanskrit stimita
Sanskrit Root √tim √tīm √stim √stīm 4 (be wet)
tintamāsa

masc. wet bean; soggy bean [tinta + māsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wet bean; soggy bean
Construction tinta + māsa
tintiṇa

adj. gluttonous; excessively greedy ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning gluttonous; excessively greedy
Commentary (VIBHt) tintiṇan'ti vā loluppam'icc'eva vuttaṃ hoti. saññā-saddo hi eso loluppavācako'ti.

Example

dhaṃsī ca, pagabbho ca, tintiṇo ca, mahagghaso ca, luddo ca, akāruṇiko ca, dubbalo ca, oravitā ca, muṭṭhassati ca, necayiko ca, imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi asaddhammehi samannāgato kāko. evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dasahi asaddhammehi samannāgato pāpabhikkhu.

AN 10.77 kākasuttaṃ
tintinī

fem. tamarind ✗
tinduka

masc. Malabar Ebony tree; Diospyros Malabarica [tindu + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from tindu
Meaning Malabar Ebony tree; Diospyros Malabarica
Construction tindu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Variant tiṇḍuka
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diospyros_malabarica
Sanskrit tinduka

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, tinduk'ālātaṃ kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭitaṃ bhiyyosomattāya cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako samayappavādake tinduk'ācīre ekasālake mallikāya ārāme paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṃ tiṃsamattehi paribbājakasatehi.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu

tindukakhāṇu

masc. stump of an ebony tree [tinduka + khāṇu] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning stump of an ebony tree
Construction tinduka + khāṇu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tindukassa + khāṇu)
Sanskrit tinduka + sthāṇu

Example

seyyathā'pi, sāriputta, tindukakhāṇu nekavassagaṇiko sannicito hoti papaṭikajāto, evamev'āssu me, sāriputta, nekavassagaṇikaṃ rajojallaṃ kāye sannicitaṃ hoti papaṭikajātaṃ.

masc. three phases; three levels; lit. three circles [ti + parivaṭṭa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning three phases; three levels; lit. three circles
Construction ti + parivaṭṭa
Commentary (SNa) tiparivaṭṭan'ti saccañāṇa-kiccañāṇa-katañāṇa-saṅkhātānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ parivaṭṭānaṃ vasena tiparivaṭṭaṃ. ettha hi idaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ, idaṃ dukkhasamudayan'ti evaṃ catūsu saccesu yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇaṃ saccañāṇaṃ nāma. tesu'y'eva pariññeyyaṃ pahātabban'ti evaṃ kattabbakiccajānanañāṇaṃ kiccañāṇaṃ nāma. pariññātaṃ pahīnan'ti evaṃ tassa tassa kiccassa katabhāvajānanañāṇaṃ katañāṇaṃ nāma.

Meaning tin; lead
Sanskrit trapu (tin)

Example

tipurisa

adj. accompanied by three men; lit. three men [ti + purisa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning accompanied by three men; lit. three men
Construction ti + purisa
Compound kammadhāraya (ti + purisa)
Commentary (VINa) tipuriso asso'ti eko ārohako dve pādarakkhakā'ti evaṃ tipuriso hoti.
Sanskrit tri + puruṣa

Example

senā nāma hatthī assā rathā pattī. dvādasapuriso hatthī, tipuriso asso, catupuriso ratho, cattāro purisā sarahatthā patti. dassanāya gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

adj. measuring three men’s height; three fathoms in depth [ti + porisa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning measuring three men’s height; three fathoms in depth
Construction ti + porisa
Compound kammadhāraya (ti + porisa)
Sanskrit tri + puruṣya

Example

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde sattaporisam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, chapporisam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, pañcaporisam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, catupporisam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, tiporisam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, dviporisam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, porisamattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti.

tiporisaṅga

adj. three fathoms around ✗
tiporisanikhāta

adj. buried three fathoms deep ✗
tiporisaṃ

ind. to the height of three men ✗
tippa

adj. sharp; intense; acute [√tij + ta] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning sharp; intense; acute
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 a (be sharp, bitter)
Construction √tij > tip + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change j > p
t > p
Synonym tikkha
Variant tibba
Sanskrit tīvra
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

khamo assaṃ sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīsapa-samphassānaṃ, duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tippānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātiko assan'ti

AN 10.71 ākaṅkhasuttaṃ
tiphala

nt. three (medicinal) fruits [ti + phala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning three (medicinal) fruits
Construction ti + phala
Compound digu (tīṇi + phalāni)
Sanskrit triphala

Example

tīṇi malāni timalaṃ, tīṇi phalāni tiphalaṃ, tayo lokā tilokaṃ, tayo daṇḍā tidaṇḍaṃ, catasso disā catuddisaṃ, pañca indriyāni pañc'indriyaṃ, satta godāvariyo sattagodāvaraṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 325

Meaning with space for three repairs

tibba 1

adj. sharp; piercing; acute [√tij + ta] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning sharp; piercing; acute
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 a (be sharp, bitter)
Construction √tij > tib + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change jt > bb
Synonym tikkha, tippa, teja, nibbedhika
Commentary (SNa) tibbā'ti bahalā. (ANa) tibbānan'ti bahalānaṃ tāpanasabhāvānaṃ vā.
Sanskrit tigma
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātikā bhavissāmā'ti.

AN 4.157 rogasuttaṃ

so tattha dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedeti, na ca tāva kālaṅ'karoti yāva na taṃ pāpakammaṃ byantīhoti.

MN 130 devadūtasuttaṃ
tibba 2

adj. intense; keen; acute; lit. sharp [√tij + ta] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning intense; keen; acute; lit. sharp
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 a (be sharp, bitter)
Construction √tij > tib + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change jt > bb
Variant tippa
Commentary (ANa) tibban'ti bahalaṃ. (ANa) tibbānan'ti bahalānaṃ tāpanasabhāvānaṃ vā.
Sanskrit tigma
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, tibbo no chando bhavissati adhisīlasikkhāsamādāne, tibbo no chando bhavissati adhicittasikkhāsamādāne, tibbo no chando bhavissati adhipaññāsikkhāsamādāne'ti.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satthāraṃ upanissāya viharati aññataraṃ vā garuṭṭhāniyaṃ sabrahmacāriṃ, yatth'assa tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti pemañ'ca gāravo ca.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
tibba 3

nt. agony; torture; suffering [√tij + ta] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning agony; torture; suffering
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 a (be sharp, bitter)
Construction √tij > tib + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change jt > bb
Sanskrit tigma
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

evaṃ dīgharattaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ paccanubhūtaṃ tibbaṃ paccanubhūtaṃ byasanaṃ paccanubhūtaṃ, kaṭasī vaḍḍhitā.

SN 15.1 tiṇakaṭṭhasuttaṃ
tibba 4

adj. dense; thick; dark [√tij + ta] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning dense; thick; dark
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 a (be sharp, bitter)
Construction √tij > tib + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change jt > bb
Synonym appita, gahana, gāḷha, bahala, sanda
Sanskrit tigma
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre tibbo vanasaṇḍo. tatr'assa rukkho sampannaphalo ca upapannaphalo ca, na c'assu kānici phalāni bhūmiyaṃ patitāni.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sāriputta, pokkharaṇī acch'odakā sātodakā sīt'odakā setakā supatitthā ramaṇīyā. avidūre c'assā tibbo vanasaṇḍo.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
tibbagarava

adj. having a strong respect (for) ✗
tibbagārava

adj. (+loc) with keen respect (for); with intense esteem (for); who highly value; lit. sharp respect [tibba + gārava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning with keen respect (for); with intense esteem (for); who highly value; lit. sharp respect
Construction tibba + gārava
Compound kammadhāraya (tibba + gārava)
Sanskrit tigma + gaurava

Examples

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā ... sāmaññe anapekkhavanto sikkhāya na tibbagāravā bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅ'gamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

ye'dha laddhā manussattaṃ,
vadaññū vītamaccharā,
buddhe pasannā dhamme ca,
saṅghe ca tibbagāravā.

SN 1.49 maccharisuttaṃ
tibbacchanda

masc. intense interest; keen desire [tibba + chanda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning intense interest; keen desire
Construction tibba + chanda
tibbadosajātika

adj. who has strong ill-will; who has intense hatred [tibba + dosa + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has strong ill-will; who has intense hatred
Construction tibba + dosa + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (tibbadosa + jātika)
Commentary (MNa) tibbadosajātiko'ti appamattiken'eva kuppati, daharasāmaṇerehi saddhiṃ hatthaparāmās'ādīni karonto'va katheti. so'pi daṇḍakammapaccayā dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti.
Sanskrit tigma + dveṣa + jātīya, jātika (bsk)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pakatiyā tibbarāgajātiko ... tibbadosajātiko ... tibbamohajātiko hoti, so abhikkhaṇaṃ mohajaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti. so sahā'pi dukkhena, sahā'pi domanassena, assumukho'pi rudamāno paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carati.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
tibbanikkama

adj. with intense energy; with keen effort [tibba + nikkama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with intense energy; with keen effort
Construction tibba + nikkama
Commentary (SNa) tibbanikkamo'ti bāḷhavīriyo.
tibbamohajātika

adj. who has delusion lust; who has intense ignorance [tibba + moha + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has delusion lust; who has intense ignorance
Construction tibba + moha + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (tibbamoha + jātika)
Commentary (MNa) mohajātiko pana idha kataṃ vā katato akataṃ vā akatato na sallakkheti, tāni tāni kiccāni virādheti. so'pi daṇḍakammapaccayā dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti.
Sanskrit tigma + moha + jātīya, jātika (bsk)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pakatiyā tibbarāgajātiko ... tibbadosajātiko ... tibbamohajātiko hoti, so abhikkhaṇaṃ mohajaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti. so sahā'pi dukkhena, sahā'pi domanassena, assumukho'pi rudamāno paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carati.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
tibbarāga

adj. with intense passion; with raging lust [tibba + rāga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with intense passion; with raging lust
Construction tibba + rāga
Compound kammadhāraya (tibba + rāga)
Sanskrit tigma + rāga

Example

vitakkamathitassa jantuno,
tibbarāgassa subh'ānupassino,
bhiyyo taṇhā pavaḍḍhati,
esa kho daḷhaṃ karoti bandhanaṃ.

DHP 349 taṇhāvaggo
tibbarāgajātika

adj. who has strong lust; who has intense desire; lit. sharp lust type [tibba + rāga + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has strong lust; who has intense desire; lit. sharp lust type
Construction tibba + rāga + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (tibbarāga + jātika)
Commentary (MNa) tibbarāgajātiko'ti bahalarāgasabhāvo.
Sanskrit tigma + rāga + jātīya, jātika (bsk)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pakatiyā tibbarāgajātiko ... tibbadosajātiko ... tibbamohajātiko hoti, so abhikkhaṇaṃ mohajaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti. so sahā'pi dukkhena, sahā'pi domanassena, assumukho'pi rudamāno paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carati.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
tibbasārāga

adj. (+loc) with strong desire (for); with intense lust (for) [tibba + sārāga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning with strong desire (for); with intense lust (for)
Construction tibba + sārāga
Compound kammadhāraya (tibba + sārāga)
Commentary (MNa) kāmesu tibbasārāgā'ti vatthukāmesu bahalakilesarāgā
Sanskrit tigma + saṃrāga

Example

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā abhijjhālū kāmesu tibbasārāgā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, abhijjhālukāmesutibbasārāgasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
tibbāpekkha

adj. with strong desire; with intense passion [tibba + apekkhā + a] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with strong desire; with intense passion
Construction tibba + apekkhā + a
tibbāpekkhā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
tibbāpekkhā

fem. (+dat) intense enthusiasm (for); keen interest (in) [tibba + apekkhā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp (+dat)
Meaning intense enthusiasm (for); keen interest (in)
Construction tibba + apekkhā
Compound kammadhāraya (tibba + apekkhā)
Commentary (MNa) tibb'āpekkho hotī'ti bahalapatthano hoti.
Sanskrit tigma + apekṣā

Example

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'c'āpi yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṃ ucc'āvacāni kiṃkaraṇīyāni tattha ussukkaṃ āpanno hoti, atha khv'āssa tibb'āpekkhā hoti adhisīlasikkhāya adhicittasikkhāya adhipaññāsikkhāya.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
tibhavā

masc. three states of existence; three realms of being [ti + bhava + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning three states of existence; three realms of being
Construction ti + bhava + ā
tibhava + ā
Compound digu (tayo + bhavā)
Notes kāmabhava, rūpabhava, and arūpabhava
Sanskrit tribhava (bsk)

Example

nagā samuddā saritā vasun'dharā,
disā catasso vidisā adho divā,
sabbe aniccā tibhavā upaddutā,
kuhiṃ gato citta sukhaṃ ramissasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
tibhāga

masc. one third; lit. three part [ti + bhāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning one third; lit. three part
Construction ti + bhāga
Compound digu (ti + bhāgā)
Notes (MW) three-fourths
Sanskrit tribhāga

Example

yaṃ pan'etaṃ bhavaṃ gotamo abhiññāya sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desesi sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, sabbo vā tena loko nīyati upaḍḍho vā tibhāgo vā'ti?

AN 10.95 uttiyasuttaṃ
timaṇḍala

nt. three circles (of the navel and the knees) ✗
timala 1

adj. with three impurities; having three stains [ti + mala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with three impurities; having three stains
Construction ti + mala
Compound kammadhāraya (ti + mala)
Commentary (SNa) sā ca rāg'ādīhi tīhi malehi timalā. tatr'āssā moho sahajātakoṭiyā malaṃ hoti, rāgadosā upanissayakoṭiyā.
Sanskrit trimala

Example

ekamūlaṃ dvi'r'āvaṭṭaṃ,
timalaṃ pañcapattharaṃ,
samuddaṃ dvādas'āvaṭṭaṃ,
pātālaṃ atarī isī'ti.

SN 1.44 ekamūlasuttaṃ
timala 2

nt. three impurities; three stains [ti + mala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning three impurities; three stains
Construction ti + mala
Compound digu (tīṇi + malāni)
Sanskrit trimala

Example

tīṇi malāni timalaṃ, tīṇi phalāni tiphalaṃ, tayo lokā tilokaṃ, tayo daṇḍā tidaṇḍaṃ, catasso disā catuddisaṃ, pañca indriyāni pañc'indriyaṃ, satta godāvariyo sattagodāvaraṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 325
timi

masc. giant fish; whale ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning giant fish; whale
Sanskrit timi

Example

tatr'ime bhūtā, timi timiṅgalo timitimiṅgalo asurā nāgā gandhabbā

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
timiṅgala

masc. eater of giant fish [timi + gala] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning eater of giant fish
Construction timi + gala
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (timiṃ + gala)
Sanskrit timingila

Example

tatr'ime bhūtā, timi timiṅgalo timitimiṅgalo asurā nāgā gandhabbā

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
timitimiṅgala

masc. eater of eater of giant fish [timi + timiṃ + gala] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning eater of eater of giant fish
Construction timi + timiṃ + gala
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (timitimiṃ + gala)
Variant timirapiṅgala
Sanskrit timingilagila

Example

tatr'ime bhūtā, timi timiṅgalo timitimiṅgalo asurā nāgā gandhabbā

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
timira 1

nt. darkness [timira] ✗
timira 2

adj. dark [timira] ✗
timirapiṅgala

masc. eater of eater of giant fish [timira + gala] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning eater of eater of giant fish
Construction timira + gala
Compound kammadhāraya (timira + piṅgala)
Variant timitimiṅgala
Commentary (APt) vaṇṇena piṅgalatimirasadisatāya timirapiṅgalo.
Notes a corruption of timi-timiṅ-gala, an eater of fish which eat giant fish
Sanskrit timingilagila

Example

tatr'ime bhūtā, timi timiṅgalo timirapiṅgalo asurā nāgā gandhabbā

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
timirāyita

adj. become or appearing dark [timira] ✗
timirāyitatta

nt. cloud of darkness; gloom; lit. become dark state [timira + āya + ita + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from timirāyita, deno
Meaning cloud of darkness; gloom; lit. become dark state
Construction timira + āya + ita + tta
timirāyita + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Commentary (SNa) timirāyitattan'ti timirāyanabhāvaṃ. dhūmavalāhakaṃ viya timiravalāhakaṃ viya cā'ti attho
Sanskrit timirāyita +

Example

tena kho pana samayena dhūmāyitattaṃ timirāyitattaṃ gacchat'eva purimaṃ disaṃ, gacchati pacchimaṃ disaṃ, gacchati uttaraṃ disaṃ, gacchati dakkhiṇaṃ disaṃ, gacchati uddhaṃ, gacchati adho, gacchati anudisaṃ.

SN 4.23 godhikasuttaṃ
timisa 1

adj. black; dark; blind ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning black; dark; blind
Synonym ariṭṭhaka, kaṇha, kāḷa, kiṇha
Sanskrit tamisrā

Example

āneti timbarutthaniṃ,
tassā issā na supati,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

tiyojana 1

nt. three yojanas; approximately sixty kilometres [ti + yojana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning three yojanas; approximately sixty kilometres
Construction ti + yojana
Compound digu (ti + yojanāni)
Sanskrit triyojana

Examples

bhikkhuno pan'eva addhānamaggappaṭipannassa eḷakalomāni uppajjeyyuṃ, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbāni, paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni asante hārake.

VIN PAT NP 16 eḷakalomasikkhāpadaṃ

tato ce uttari hareyya, asante'pi hārake'ti paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ tiyojanaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. dutiyaṃ pādaṃ atikkāmeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN 1.4.2.6 eḷakalomasikkhāpadaṃ
tiyojana 2

adj. measuring three leagues ✗
tiyojanaparamatā

fem. maximum of three yojanas; sixty kilometres at the most [tiyojana + paramatā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning maximum of three yojanas; sixty kilometres at the most
Construction tiyojana + paramatā
Compound kammadhāraya (tiyojana + paramatā)
Sanskrit triyojana + paramatā

Example

paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbānī'ti tiyojanaparamatā sahatthā haritabbāni.

VIN 1.4.2.6 eḷakalomasikkhāpadaṃ
tiyojanaparamaṃ

ind. for three yojanas at the most; not more than sixty kilometres [tiyojana + parama + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of tiyojanaparama
Meaning for three yojanas at the most; not more than sixty kilometres
Construction tiyojana + parama + aṃ
tiyojanaparama + aṃ
Commentary (VIN 1.4.2.6) tiyojanaparamaṃ ... tiyojanaparamatā
Sanskrit triyojana + paramam

Example

bhikkhuno pan'eva addhānamaggappaṭipannassa eḷakalomāni uppajjeyyuṃ, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbāni, paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni asante hārake.

VIN PAT NP 16 eḷakalomasikkhāpadaṃ
tiyojanasatika

adj. three hundred yojanas in measure [ti + yojana + satika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning three hundred yojanas in measure
Construction ti + yojana + satika
Compound kammadhāraya (ti + yojanasatika)
Sanskrit tri + yojana + śatika

Example

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde yojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti, dviyojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti, tiyojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti, catuyojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
tiraccha

masc. going horizontally; animal ✗
tiracchayoni

fem. birth or existence as an animal; animal class ✗
tiracchā

fem. going horizontally; animal ✗
tiracchāna 1

masc. animal; lit. horizontal ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning animal; lit. horizontal
Synonym tiracchānagata, tiracchānagatapāṇa
Notes √tir (cross) + √añch (extend) + ana?
Sanskrit tiryagjana, tiraścīna (horizontal)

Example

so ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṃ byākareyya khīṇanirayo'mhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇ'āpāyaduggativinipāto sot'āpanno'ham'asmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo'ti

AN 5.179 gihisuttaṃ
tiracchāna 2

adj. low; debased; degraded; lit. horizontal ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning low; debased; degraded; lit. horizontal
Sanskrit tiryagjana, tiraścīna (horizontal)

Example

kathañ'carahi, samaṇa, bhuñjasī'ti? ye hi keci, bhagini, samaṇabrāhmaṇā vatthuvijjātiracchānavijjāya micchājīvena jīvikaṃ kappenti, ime vuccanti, bhagini, samaṇabrāhmaṇā adhomukhā bhuñjantī'ti.

SN 28.10 sūcimukhīsuttaṃ
tiracchānakathā

fem. useless talk; pointless speech; worldly talk; low talk; lit. animal talk [tiracchāna + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning useless talk; pointless speech; worldly talk; low talk; lit. animal talk
Construction tiracchāna + kathā
Compound kammadhāraya (tiracchāna + kathā)
Commentary (ANa) tiracchānakathan'ti aniyyānikattā saggamokkhamaggānaṃ tiracchānabhūtaṃ kathaṃ.
Sanskrit tiryaggata + kathaṃ

Examples

tena kho pana samayena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṃ nisinno hoti unnādiniyā uccāsaddamahāsaddāya anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ kathentiyā.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ sannisinnā sannipatitā anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ anuyuttā viharanti

AN 10.69 paṭhamakathāvatthusuttaṃ
tiracchānakathāpavattanika

adj. promoting pointless speech; leading to worldly talk [tiracchānakathā + pavattanika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning promoting pointless speech; leading to worldly talk
Construction tiracchānakathā + pavattanika
tiracchānakathāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.10 (SN56.10) ✗
tiracchānakathika

adj. who talks about vulgar topics; who talks basely ✗
tiracchānagata

masc. animal; lit. going horizontal [tiracchāna + gata] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning animal; lit. going horizontal
Construction tiracchāna + gata
Compound kammadhāraya (tiracchāna + gata)
Synonym tiracchāna, tiracchānagatapāṇa
Sanskrit tiryaggata

Examples

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekanikāyam'pi samanupassāmi evaṃ cittaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā, te'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā citten'eva cittitā, tehi'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatehi pāṇehi cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

sārambhaṃ nāma ... dīpīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, acchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, taracchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, yesaṃ kesañci tiracchānagatānaṃ pāṇānaṃ āsayo hoti, pubb'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, apar'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

Synonym tiracchāna, tiracchānagata
Sanskrit tiryaggata + prāṇa

Example

pāṇo nāma tiracchānagatapāṇo vuccati.

tiracchānagatā

fem. female animal; lit. going horizontal [tiracchāna + gata + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning female animal; lit. going horizontal
Construction tiracchāna + gata + ā
tiracchānagata + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Synonym tiracchānagatitthi
Commentary (VINa) tiracchānagatāya'pī'ti paṭisandhivasena tiracchānesu gatāya'pi.
Sanskrit tiryaggata

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno sikkhaṃ appaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA 1 methunadhammasikkhāpadaṃ

mātugāmo nāma manuss'itthī, na yakkhī na petī, na tiracchānagatā. antamaso tadahujātā'pi dārikā, pag'eva mahattarī.

VIN 1.2.2 kāyasaṃsaggasikkhāpadaṃ
tiracchānagatitthi

fem. female animal; lit. going horizontal woman [tiracchāna + gata + itthi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning female animal; lit. going horizontal woman
Construction tiracchāna + gata + itthi
Compound kammadhāraya (tiracchānagata + itthi)
Synonym tiracchānagatā
Sanskrit tiryaggata + strī

Example

antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pī'ti tiracchānagat'itthiyā'pi methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo, pag'eva manuss'itthiyā. tena vuccati, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pī'ti.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.123-125 (SN56.123-125) ✗

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.120-122 (SN56.120-122) ✗
tiracchānayoni

fem. animal realm; animal birth; lit. animal womb [tiracchāna + yoni] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning animal realm; animal birth; lit. animal womb
Construction tiracchāna + yoni
Compound kammadhāraya (tiracchāna + yoni)
Commentary (THa) tiracchānayoniyan'ti migapakkhiādibhedāya tiracchānayoniyaṃ.
Sanskrit tiryagyoni

Examples

saṃsaraṃ hi nirayaṃ agacchissaṃ,
petalokam'agamaṃ punappunaṃ,
dukkhamamhi'pi tiracchānayoniyaṃ,
n'ekadhā hi vusitaṃ ciraṃ mayā.

TH 183 gotamattheragāthā

abhabbo taṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ, yaṃ kammaṃ katvā nirayaṃ vā tiracchānayoniṃ vā pettivisayaṃ vā upapajjeyya, abhabbo'va tāva kālaṃ kātuṃ yāva na sot'āpattiphalaṃ sacchikaroti.

SN 25.1 cakkhusuttaṃ
tiracchānayonika

adj. born in the animal realm; lit. belonging to the animal womb ✗
tiracchānayonikathā

fem. talk about the animal realm; discussion about animal birth [tiracchānayoni + kathā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk about the animal realm; discussion about animal birth
Construction tiracchānayoni + kathā
tiracchānayonigamanīya

adj. which leads to the animal realm; which is conducive to animal rebirth [tiracchānayoni + gamanīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which leads to the animal realm; which is conducive to animal rebirth
Construction tiracchānayoni + gamanīya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (tiracchānayoniṃ + gamanīya)
Sanskrit tiryagyoni + gamanīya

Example

katamā ca, bhikkhave, āsavānaṃ vemattatā? atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā nirayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā tiracchānayonigamanīyā, atthi āsavā pettivisayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā manussalokagamanīyā, atthi āsavā devalokagamanīyā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
tiracchānayonigāmī

adj. leading to birth as an animal [tiracchānayoni + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to birth as an animal
Construction tiracchānayoni + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (tiracchānayoniṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit tiryagyoni + gāmin

Example

tiracchānayoniñ'c'āhaṃ, sāriputta, pajānāmi, tiracchānayonigāmiñ'ca maggaṃ, tiracchānayonigāminiñ'ca paṭipadaṃ, yathā paṭipanno ca kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā tiracchānayoniṃ upapajjati tañ'ca pajānāmi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
tiracchānayonibandhana

nt. prison of the animal realm; bondage of brute birth [tiracchānayoni + bandhana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning prison of the animal realm; bondage of brute birth
Construction tiracchānayoni + bandhana
tiracchānayonivedanīya

adj. to be experienced in the animal realm [tiracchānayonivedanīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning to be experienced in the animal realm
Construction tiracchānayonivedanīya
Commentary (ANa) nirayavedanīyan'ti niraye vipākadāyakaṃ. sesesu'pi es'eva nayo.
tiracchānayonisaṃvattanika

adj. leading to animal rebirth; conducive to the animal realm; lit. leading to animal womb [tiracchānayoni + saṃvattanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to animal rebirth; conducive to the animal realm; lit. leading to animal womb
Construction tiracchānayoni + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (tiracchānayoniyā + saṃvattanika)
Sanskrit tiryagyoni + saṃvartanīya

Example

pāṇ'ātipāto, bhikkhave, āsevito bhāvito bahulīkato nirayasaṃvattaniko tiracchānayonisaṃvattaniko pettivisayasaṃvattaniko. yo sabbalahusopāṇ'ātipātassa vipāko, manussabhūtassa app'āyukasaṃvattaniko hoti.

AN 8.40 duccaritavipākasuttaṃ
tiracchānavijjā

fem. debased art; pseudo-science; lit. animal knowledge [tiracchāna + vijjā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning debased art; pseudo-science; lit. animal knowledge
Construction tiracchāna + vijjā
Compound kammadhāraya (tiracchāna + vijjā)
Commentary (VIN) tiracchānavijjā nāma yaṃ kiñci bāhirakaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.
Sanskrit tiryagjana + vidyā

Examples

kathañ'carahi, samaṇa, bhuñjasī'ti? ye hi keci, bhagini, samaṇabrāhmaṇā vatthuvijjātiracchānavijjāya micchājīvena jīvikaṃ kappenti, ime vuccanti, bhagini, samaṇabrāhmaṇā adhomukhā bhuñjantī'ti.

SN 28.10 sūcimukhīsuttaṃ

ye hi keci, bhagini, samaṇabrāhmaṇā nakkhattavijjātiracchānavijjāya micchājīvena jīvikaṃ kappenti, ime vuccanti, bhagini, samaṇabrāhmaṇā ubbhamukhā bhuñjantī'ti.

SN 28.10 sūcimukhīsuttaṃ
tiracchānavijjāpariyāpuṇanasikkhāpada

Meaning rule about a pseudo-sciences
Construction tiracchānavijjā + pariyāpuṇana + sikkhāpada
tiracchānavijjāvācanasikkhāpada

nt. rule about teaching a pseudo-science [tiracchānavijjā + vācana + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about teaching a pseudo-science
Construction tiracchānavijjā + vācana + sikkhāpada
tiratana

nt. Triple Gem (Buddha, Dhamma, Saṅgha) ✗
tiratta

nt. three nights; three days [ti + ratta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning three nights; three days
Construction ti + ratta
Compound digu (tīni + rattāni)
Sanskrit trirātra

Example

yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannena uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 5 paṭhamasahaseyyasikkhāpadaṃ
tiriyaṅgama

adj. going sideways; going horizontally ✗
tiriyañca

sandhi. and across; and horizontally [tiriyaṃ + ca] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning and across; and horizontally
Construction tiriyaṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit tiryañc + ca

Examples

mettañ'ca sabbalokasmi,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ,
uddhaṃ adho ca tiriyañ'ca,
asambādhaṃ averamasapattaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'c'āpi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
tiriyato

ind. across; horizontally; width-wise [√tir + iya + to] ~

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of tiriya
Meaning across; horizontally; width-wise
Root Family √tir
Root √tir･1 a (cross)
Construction √tir + iya + to
tiriya + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Sanskrit tiryañc, tiryak
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1, 3, 5, 6, 8 (pass)
tiriyaṃ 1

ind. (+gen) across [√tir + iya + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of tiriya (+gen)
Meaning across
Root Family √tir
Root √tir･1 a (cross)
Construction √tir + iya + aṃ
tiriya + aṃ
Synonym vitthārato
Sanskrit tiryañc, tiryak
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1, 3, 5, 6, 8 (pass)

Examples

so paṭhamaṃ patāresi ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā. te tiriyaṃ gaṅgāya sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ agamaṃsu. ath'āpare patāresi balavagāvo dammagāvo.

MN 34 cūḷagopālakasuttaṃ

iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabb'attatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā viharati.

saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena assāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ satt'antarā

DN 4.3 soṇadaṇḍasuttaṃ
tirokaraṇī

fem. curtain, veil ✗
tirokaraṇīya

nt. curtain; screen [tiro + karaṇīya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning curtain; screen
Construction tiro + karaṇīya
Commentary (VINa) tirokaraṇīyan'ti karaṇ'atthe bhummaṃ, sāṇipākārena parikkhipitvā'ti attho. atha vā tiro karonti etenā'ti tirokaraṇīyaṃ, taṃ parikkhipitvā, samantato katvā'ti attho.
tirokucchigata

adj. within a womb ✗
tirokuṭṭa

masc. beyond the wall; behind the wall [tiro + kuṭṭa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning beyond the wall; behind the wall
Construction tiro + kuṭṭa
Compound kammadhāraya (tiro + kuṭṭa)
Commentary (VIN) tirokuṭṭe'ti kuṭṭassa parato. (PVa) tattha tirokuṭṭesū'ti kuṭṭānaṃ parabhāgesu.
Sanskrit tiras + kuḍya

Example

tirokuṭṭesu tiṭṭhanti,
sandhisiṅghāṭakesu ca,
dvārabāhāsu tiṭṭhanti,
āgantvāna sakaṃ gharaṃ.

tirokuṭṭaṃ

ind. through a wall [tiro + kuṭṭa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of tirokuṭṭa
Meaning through a wall
Construction tiro + kuṭṭa + aṃ
tirokuṭṭa + aṃ
Compound abyayībhāva (tiro + kuṭṭaṃ)
Sanskrit tiraskuḍya

Examples

āvibhāvaṃ tirobhāvaṃ, tirokuṭṭaṃ tiropākāraṃ tiropabbataṃ asajjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi ākāse

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

tasmā akār'antā abyayībhāvasamāsā parāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ kvaci aṃ hoti. adhicittaṃ, yathāvuḍḍhaṃ, upakumbhaṃ, yāvajīvaṃ, tiropabbataṃ, tiropākāraṃ, tirokuṭṭaṃ, antopāsādaṃ.

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

santi kho pana, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, āhārena suddhī'ti. te evam'āhaṃsu, muggehi yāpema ... tilehi yāpema ... taṇḍulehi yāpemā'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
tilaka 1

nt. ornament; lit. sandalwood mark on the forehead [tila + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, from tila
Meaning ornament; lit. sandalwood mark on the forehead
Construction tila + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Notes (MW) a mark or marks made with coloured earths, sandal-wood, or unguents, upon the forehead and between the eyebrows, either as an ornament or a sectarial distinction; the ornament of anything (used in comp. to express greatness or distinction, e. g. trailokya-tilaka, the ornament of the three worlds, i. e. a distinguished personage)
Sanskrit tilaka

Example

sabbaṃ niruttipathapāragataṃ sabuddhaṃ,
buddhaṃ tilokatilakaṃ hatapāpadhammaṃ,
dhammaṃ vimuttisukhadaṃ vihat'āghasaṃghaṃ,
saṃghaṃ ca niccam'abhivandiya dakkhiṇeyyaṃ.

bālāvatāra paṇāma
tilaka 2

nt. mark; spot; grease stain [tila + ka] ~

Grammar nt, from tila
Meaning mark; spot; grease stain
Construction tila + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit tilaka
tilaka 3

nt. freckle; spot; blotch; skin-discolouring [tila + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, from tila
Meaning freckle; spot; blotch; skin-discolouring
Construction tila + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym sabala
Commentary (MNa) tilak'āhatagattan'ti setakāḷatilakehi vikiṇṇasarīraṃ.
Sanskrit tilaka

Example

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattaṃ.

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattiṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.3 bhesajjasikkhāpadaṃ

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning merely the size of a sesame seed; as much a sesame seed; lit. sesame fruit measure
Construction tila + phala + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (tilaphala + matta)
Commentary (VINa) itthiyā aṅgajātena attano aṅgajātaṃ sabb'antimena pamāṇena ekatilabījamattam'pi vātena asamphuṭṭhe allokāse paveseti, eso paṭisevati nāma
Sanskrit tila + phala + mātra

Example

paṭisevati nāma yo nimittena nimittaṃ aṅgajātena aṅgajātaṃ antamaso tilaphalamattam'pi paveseti, eso paṭisevati nāma.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
tilabījakādibheda

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning ?? distinguished by sesame seed, etc.
Construction tila + bījaka + ādi + bheda
tilamuggamāsāparaṇṇa

nt. sesame, mung beans, beans and other grains [tila + mugga + māsa + aparaṇṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning sesame, mung beans, beans and other grains
Construction tila + mugga + māsa + aparaṇṇa
Compound dvanda (tila ca mugga ca māsa ca aparaṇṇa)
Commentary (ANa) tilamuggamāsāparaṇṇan'ti tilamuggamāsā ca ses'āparaṇṇañ'ca.
Sanskrit tila + mudga + māṣa + apara + anna

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño paccantime nagare bahuṃ tilamuggamās'āparaṇṇaṃ sannicitaṃ hoti abbhantarānaṃ ratiyā aparitassāya phāsuvihārāya bāhirānaṃ paṭighātāya.

AN 7.67 nagaropamasuttaṃ
tilamuṭṭhi

masc. handful of sesame ✗
tilamuṭṭhijātaka

tilavaha

masc. cartload of sesame ✗

tilākhetta + smi
tiliṅgika

adj. belonging to the 3 genders ✗
tiloka

nt. three worlds [ti + loka] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning three worlds
Construction ti + loka
Compound digu (tayo + lokā)
Sanskrit trailokya

Examples

gandhatelappadittena,
dīpena tamadhaṃsinā,
tilokadīpaṃ sambuddhaṃ,
pūjayāmi tamonudaṃ.

buddhavandana pūjāgāthā

tayo lokā tilokaṃ, tayo daṇḍā tidaṇḍaṃ, tīṇi nayanāni tinayanaṃ, tayo siṅgā tisiṅgaṃ. catasso disā catuddisaṃ, pañca indriyāni pañc'indriyaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 321
tilokatilaka

nt. ornament of the three worlds [tiloka + tilaka] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning ornament of the three worlds
Construction tiloka + tilaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tilokassa + tilaka)
Sanskrit trailokyatilaka

Example

sabbaṃ niruttipathapāragataṃ sabuddhaṃ,
buddhaṃ tilokatilakaṃ hatapāpadhammaṃ,
dhammaṃ vimuttisukhadaṃ vihat'āghasaṃghaṃ,
saṃghaṃ ca niccam'abhivandiya dakkhiṇeyyaṃ.

bālāvatāra paṇāma
tivagga

adj. consisting of 3 divisions ✗
tivaṅgika

adj. having 3 constituents ✗

masc. name of the people previously living on Vepulla mountain ~

Meaning name of the people previously living on Vepulla mountain
tivassaṃ

ind. for three years ✗
tivassika

adj. three years old ✗
tividha

adj. three kinds of; three-fold; three-way [ti + vidha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning three kinds of; three-fold; three-way
Construction ti + vidha
Compound kammadhāraya (ti + vidha)
Commentary (MNa) tividhan'ti tīhi koṭṭhāsehi.
Sanskrit trivṛt

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhātuso upaparikkhati, āyatanaso upaparikkhati, paṭiccasamuppādaso upaparikkhati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividh'ūpaparikkhī hoti.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

yo yajati tividhaṃ yaññasampadaṃ,
ārādhaye dakkhiṇeyyebhi tādi,
evaṃ yajitvā sammā yācayogo,
upapajjati brahmalokan'ti brūmī'ti.

SNP 31 māghasuttaṃ, mahāvaggo 5
tividhakāyakammantasandosabyāpatti

fem. threefold corruption and failure of physical action [tividha + kāyakammanta + sandosa + byāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning threefold corruption and failure of physical action
Construction tividha + kāyakammanta + sandosa + byāpatti
Compound kammadhāraya (tividha + kāyakammantasandosabyāpatti)
Sanskrit trivṛt + kāya + karmānta + saṃdoṣa (bsk) + vyāpatti

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, apaṇṇako maṇi uddhaṃkhitto yena yen'eva patiṭṭhā'ti suppatiṭṭhitaṃ'y'eva patiṭṭhāti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tividhakāyakammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikāhetu vā sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjanti

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
tividhakāyakammantasandosabyāpattiakusalasañcetanikāhetu

ind. threefold corruption and failure of physical action caused by unwholesome intention [tividha + kāyakammanta + sandosa + byāpatti + akusalasañcetanikāhetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning threefold corruption and failure of physical action caused by unwholesome intention
Construction tividha + kāyakammanta + sandosa + byāpatti + akusalasañcetanikāhetu
tividhakāyakammantasampattikusalasañcetanikāhetu

ind. due to the successful accomplishment of threefold physical action accompanied by wholesome intention [tividha + kāyakammanta + sampatti + kusalasañcetanika + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the successful accomplishment of threefold physical action accompanied by wholesome intention
Construction tividha + kāyakammanta + sampatti + kusalasañcetanika + hetu
Compound abyayībhāva (tividhakāyakammantasampattikusalasañcetanika + hetu)
Sanskrit trivṛt + kāya + karmānta + sampatti + kuśala + saṃcetanika (bsk) + hetu

Example

tividha-kāyakammanta-sampatti-kusalasañcetanikā-hetu vā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjanti, catubbidha-vacīkammanta-sampatti-kusalasañcetanikāhetu vā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjanti, tividha-manokammanta-sampatti-kusalasañcetanikāhetu vā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjanti.

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
tividhaggi

masc. three kinds of fire; three-fold fire [tividha + aggi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning three kinds of fire; three-fold fire
Construction tividha + aggi
Compound kammadhāraya (tividha + aggi)
Sanskrit trivṛt + agni

Example

yathā'pi uṇhe vijjante,
aparaṃ vijjati sītalaṃ,
evaṃ tividh'aggi vijjante,
nibbānaṃ icchitabbakaṃ.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedhakathā
tividhaggipiḷesitanibbāpana

Meaning putting out the three fires which afflict one
Construction tividhaggi + piḷesita + nibbāpana
tividhamanokammantasandosabyāpatti

fem. threefold corruption and failure of mental action [tividha + manokammanta + sandosa + byāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning threefold corruption and failure of mental action
Construction tividha + manokammanta + sandosa + byāpatti
Compound kammadhāraya (tividha + manokammantasandosabyāpatti)
Sanskrit trivṛt + manas + karmānta + saṃdoṣa (bsk) + vyāpatti

Example

tividhamanokammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikāhetu vā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjanti.

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
tividhamanokammantasandosabyāpattiakusalasañcetanikāhetu

ind. threefold corruption and failure of mental action caused by unwholesome intention [tividha + manokammanta + sandosa + byāpatti + akusalasañcetanikāhetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning threefold corruption and failure of mental action caused by unwholesome intention
Construction tividha + manokammanta + sandosa + byāpatti + akusalasañcetanikāhetu
Sanskrit trivṛt + manas + karmānta + saṃdoṣa (bsk) + vyāpatti + akuśala + saṃcetanika (bsk) + hetu
tividhamanokammantasampattikusalasañcetanikāhetu

ind. due to the successful accomplishment of threefold mental action accompanied by wholesome intention [tividha + manokammanta + sampatti + kusalasañcetanika + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the successful accomplishment of threefold mental action accompanied by wholesome intention
Construction tividha + manokammanta + sampatti + kusalasañcetanika + hetu
Compound abyayībhāva (tividhamanokammantasampattikusalasañcetanikā + hetu)
Sanskrit trivṛt + manas + karmānta + sampatti + kuśala + saṃcetanika (bsk) + hetu

Example

tividha-manokammanta-sampatti-kusalasañcetanikāhetu vā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjanti.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 321
tissa 1.1

sandhi. regarding this; lit. thus of this [iti + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning regarding this; lit. thus of this
Construction iti + assa
Sanskrit iti + asya

Examples

yam'pi'ssa taṃ, bhikkhave, khayasmiṃ khayeññāṇaṃ, tam'pi saupanisaṃ vadāmi, no anupanisaṃ. kā ca, bhikkhave, khayeñāṇassa upanisā? vimuttī'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

SN 12.23 upanisasuttaṃ

ko pan'āvuso, hetu ko paccayo yena anuppanno vā doso uppajjati uppanno vā doso bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattatī'ti? paṭighanimittaṃ ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

tisso

card. three (3) ✓

Grammar card, fem nom pl of ti
Meaning three (3)
Sanskrit trāḥ

Examples

ehi sārathi gacchāhi,
rathaṃ niyyādayāh'imaṃ,
ārogyaṃ brāhmaṇiṃ vajja,
pabbaji dāni brāhmaṇo,
sujāto tīhi rattīhi,
tisso vijjā aphassayi.

THI 69 sundarītherīgāthā

tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

Construction ti + dasa + ā + e
tiṃsa + e
Synonym tiṃsa, tiṃsati, tiṃsaṃ, tiṃsā
Commentary (MNa) tiṃse nirayasate'ti tiṃsa nirayasatāni.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit triṃśat

Example

ek'ūnapaññāsa ājīvakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa paribbājakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa nāg'āvāsasate, vīse indriyasate, tiṃse nirayasate, chattiṃsa rajodhātuyo, satta saññīgabbhā, satta asaññīgabbhā, satta nigaṇṭhigabbhā, satta devā

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ
tītikkhā

fem. endurance; patience; forgiveness [√tij + kha + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from titikkhati, desid
Meaning endurance; patience; forgiveness
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 kha (endure)
Base √tij + tij + sa > titikkha (desid)
Construction titikkha + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ī
Variant titikkhā
Sanskrit titikṣā
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

khantī paramaṃ tapo tītikkhā,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ vadanti buddhā,
na hi pabbajito par’ūpaghātī,
na samaṇo hoti paraṃ viheṭhayanto.

Meaning shore; riverbank; beach

Root √tir･1 a (cross)
Construction √tir > tīr + *a

Phonetic Change i > ī
Sanskrit tīra
Sanskrit Root √tṝ √tṛ 1, 3, 5, 6, 8 (pass)

Examples

ye janā pāragāmino,
ath'āyaṃ itarā pajā,
tīram'ev'ānudhāvati.

yaṃ hoti mahāsamudde mataṃ kuṇapaṃ taṃ khippam'eva tīraṃ vāheti, thalaṃ ussāreti.

tīreti 1

pr. decides, judges [√tīr] ✗

pr. finishes, executes [√tīr] ✗
tīretvā 1

Example

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 495
tuṅga

adj. high, prominent ✗
tuṅganāsika

adj. having a prominent nose ✗
tuccha

adj. empty; hollow; void; (comm) with nothing inside ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning empty; hollow; void; (comm) with nothing inside
Synonym aghagata, ākāsagata, ākiñcañña, tucchaka, ritta, suññata
Commentary (MNa) tucchā'ti niccasāra-dhuvasār'āttasāra-virahitattā rittā, na pana n'atthī'ti gahetabbā. na hi tucchamuṭṭhī'ti vutte muṭṭhi nāma n'atthī'ti vuttaṃ hoti. yassa pana abbhantare kiñci n'atthi, so vuccati tuccho.
Sanskrit tuccha

Examples

yam'āhu saccaṃ tathiyan'ti eke,
tam'āhu aññe tucchaṃ musā'ti,
evam'pi vigayha vivādayanti,
kasmā na ekaṃ samaṇā vadanti.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12

passasi no tvaṃ, rāhula, imaṃ udak'ādhānaṃ rittaṃ tucchan'ti? evaṃ, bhante. evaṃ rittaṃ tucchaṃ kho, rāhula, tesaṃ sāmaññaṃ yesaṃ n'atthi sampajānamusāvāde lajjā'ti.

Meaning empty; hollow; void

Examples

tassa taṃ passato nijjhāyato yoniso upaparikkhato rittakaññ'eva khāyeyya, tucchakaññ'eva khāyeyya, asārakaññ'eva khāyeyya.

sace kho, mārisa, sabbassa sabbattena ananubhūtaṃ, tadabhiññāya mā h'eva te rittakam'eva ahosi, tucchakam'eva ahosī'ti.

evaṃvādiṃ kho maṃ, bhikkhave, evam'akkhāyiṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, samaṇo gotamo na kāmānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, na rūpānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, na vedanānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpetī'ti.

Examples

katakicco anāsavo,

mutto āghātanā yathā.

kadā nu'haṃ dubbacanena vutto,
tatonimittaṃ vimano na hessaṃ,
atho pasattho'pi tatonimittaṃ,
tuṭṭho na hessaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.

AN 3.126 gotamakacetiyasuttaṃ

tāvataken'eva tuṭṭhiṃ āpajjeyyātha

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
tuṭṭhi 2

adj. contented; satisfied; pleased [√tus + ti] ~

Grammar adj, in comps, from tussati
Meaning contented; satisfied; pleased

Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Synonym attamana, patīta, sumana

Sanskrit Root √tuṣ 4 (be content)
tuṭṭhī

fem. (+instr) contentment (with); satisfaction (with); happiness (with) [√tus + tī] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from tussati (+instr)
Meaning contentment (with); satisfaction (with); happiness (with)
Root Family √tus
Root √tus･3 ya (be content, pleased)

with metrically lengthened ī

Example
