puññaṃ sukhaṃ jīvitasaṅkhayamhi,
sabbassa dukkhassa sukhaṃ pahānaṃ.

DHP 331 nāgavaggo
tuṇḍa 1

nt. (of an animal) mouth; snout [√tuḍ + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning (of an animal) mouth; snout
Root Family √tuḍ
Root √tuḍ×1 a (prick, stab)
Construction √tuḍ > tuṇḍ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ḍ > ṇḍ (nasalization)
Sanskrit tuṇḍa
Sanskrit Root √tuḍ 6 (strike, split)

Example

ubho hatthe mocessāmi pāde cā'ti tuṇḍena gaṇhāti. so tattha bajjhati.

SN 47.7 makkaṭasuttaṃ
tuṇḍa 2

nt. beak [√tuḍ + a] ~

Grammar nt
Meaning beak
Root Family √tuḍ
Root √tuḍ×1 a (prick, stab)
Construction √tuḍ > tuṇḍ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ḍ > ṇḍ (nasalization)
Synonym tuṇḍaka
Sanskrit tuṇḍa
Sanskrit Root √tuḍ 6 (strike, split)
tuṇḍaka 1

nt. beak [√tuḍ + a + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, from tuṇḍa
Meaning beak
Root Family √tuḍ
Root √tuḍ×1 a (prick, stab)
Construction √tuḍ > tuṇḍ + a + ka
tuṇḍa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change ḍ > ṇḍ (nasalization)
Synonym tuṇḍa
Sanskrit tuṇḍa
Sanskrit Root √tuḍ 6 (strike, split)

Example

yo nu kho tesaṃ kukkuṭacchāpakānaṃ paṭhamataraṃ pādanakhasikhāya vā mukhatuṇḍakena vā aṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyya

AN 8.11 verañjasuttaṃ
tuṇḍaka 2

adj. with gladdened mind [√tuḍ] ✗
tuṇḍikīra

masc. pot on firestones? ✗
tuṇḍilajātaka

nt. Jātaka 388 (JA 388) ✗
tuṇṇakamma

nt. needle-work, tailoring ✗
tuṇṇavāya

masc. tailor ✗
tuṇhassa

opt. one should remain silent [tuṇhi + assa] ✓

Grammar opt of tuṇhībhavati, comp vb
Meaning one should remain silent
Construction tuṇhi + assa
Compound comp verb (tuṇhi + assa)
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃ + syāt

Examples

yass'āyasmato khamati amhākaṃ imāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ saṅghamajjhe tiṇ'avatthārakena desanā, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, so tuṇh'assa. yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ

saṅgho itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāsati tassā diṭṭhiyā paṭinissaggāya. yass'āyasmato khamati itthan'nāmassa bhikkhuno samanubhāsanā, tassā diṭṭhiyā paṭinissaggāya, so tuṇh'assa. yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.

VIN 2.5.7.8 ariṭṭhasikkhāpadaṃ
tuṇhika

adj. silent ✗
tuṇhimāsīna

adj. sitting silently; who is quietly seated [tuṇhiṃ + āsīna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sitting silently; who is quietly seated
Construction tuṇhiṃ + āsīna
Compound comp verb (tuṇhiṃ + āsīna)
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃ + āsīna

Example

porāṇam'etaṃ atula,
n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ,
nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti,
n'atthi loke anindito.

DHP 227 kodhavaggo
tuṇhiṃ

ind. silently; quietly [tuṇhī + iṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of tuṇhī
Meaning silently; quietly
Construction tuṇhī + iṃ
Synonym appasaddena, tuṇhī
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃ

Example

porāṇam'etaṃ atula,
n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ,
nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti,
n'atthi loke anindito.

DHP 227 kodhavaggo
tuṇhī ahesuṃ

idiom. they were quiet; they were silent [tuṇhī + ahesuṃ] ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + aor, aor 3rd pl of tuṇhī ahosi
Meaning they were quiet; they were silent
Construction tuṇhī + ahesuṃ
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃ + bhū

Example

ayaṃ samaṇo gotamo āgacchati. appasaddakāmo kho so āyasmā appasaddassa vaṇṇavādī. app'eva nāma appasaddaṃ parisaṃ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṃ maññeyyā'ti. evaṃ vutte te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṃ.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
tuṇhī ahosi

idiom. was silent; remained quiet [tuṇhī + ahosi] ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + aor, aor of tuṇhībhavati
Meaning was silent; remained quiet
Construction tuṇhī + ahosi
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃ +

Examples

evaṃ vutte, bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ
tuṇhī 1

ind. silence; quiet ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from tuṇhī
Meaning silence; quiet
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃ

Example

tatth'āyasmante pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā, dutiyam'pi pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā, tatiyam'pi pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā, parisuddh'etth'āyasmanto, tasmā tuṇhī, evam'etaṃ dhārayāmī'ti.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso
tuṇhī 2

ind. silently; quietly ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from tuṇhī
Meaning silently; quietly
Synonym appasaddena, tuṇhiṃ
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃ

Example

so bhuttāvī na pattaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipati n'ātidūre n'āccāsanne, na ca anatthiko pattena hoti, na ca ativel'ānurakkhī pattasmiṃ. so bhuttāvī muhuttaṃ tuṇhī nisīdati, na ca anumodanassa kālam'atināmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
tuṇhī 3

ind. silent; quiet ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from tuṇhī
Meaning silent; quiet
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃ

Examples

yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ, tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso

evaṃ vutte, bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
tuṇhī bhavati

idiom. is silent ✗
tuṇhībhavati

pr. keeps silence ✗
tuṇhībhāva

masc. silence; keeping quiet; being silent; (comm) not talking [tuṇhī + bhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp, from tuṇhībhavati
Meaning silence; keeping quiet; being silent; (comm) not talking
Construction tuṇhī + bhāva
Compound comp verb (tuṇhī + bhāva)
Commentary (MNa) tuṇhībhāve'ti akathane.
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃbhāva

Examples

asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī ahosiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

saṅghagato kho pana anānākathiko hoti atiracchānakathiko. sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsati, paraṃ vā ajjhesati, ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvaṃ n'ātimaññati.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
tuṇhībhūta

adj. silent; quiet; mute; lit. became silent [tuṇhī + bhūta] ✓

Grammar pp of tuṇhībhavati, comp
Meaning silent; quiet; mute; lit. became silent
Construction tuṇhī + bhūta
Compound comp verb (tuṇhī + bhūta)
Synonym nigghosa
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃbhūta

Examples

evaṃ vutte, uttaro māṇavo pārāsiviy'antevāsī tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ

addasā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo siṅgālaṃ dūrato'va gocarapasutaṃ. disvāna soṇḍipañcamāni aṅgāni sake kapāle samodahitvā app'ossukko tuṇhībhūto saṅkasāyati.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
tuṇhīyati

pr. is silent; is quiet [tuṇhī + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, deno of tuṇhī, intrans
Meaning is silent; is quiet
Construction tuṇhī + īya + ti
Sanskrit tūṣṇīṃ

Example

taṃ nadīhi vijānātha,
sobbhesu padaresu ca,
saṇantā yanti kusobbhā,
tuṇhīyanti mah'odadhī.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
tutta

nt. pike; spear; lit. stabbed [√tud + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of tudati
Meaning pike; spear; lit. stabbed
Root Family √tud
Root √tud･1 a (prick, stab)
Construction √tud + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > t
Synonym sūla
Notes (MW) a goad for driving cattle or an elephant
Sanskrit tottra
Sanskrit Root √tud 6 (push, thrust)

Example

so bajjhataṃ pāsasatehi chabbhi,
rammā vanā niyyatu rājadhāniṃ,
tuttehi so haññatu pācanehi,
bhisāni te brāhmaṇa yo ahāsi.

JA 488 bhisa jātakaṃ
tuttatomara

masc. spike and spear; pike and lance [tutta + tomara] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning spike and spear; pike and lance
Construction tutta + tomara
tudati

pr. (+acc and +instr) pokes (with); pricks (with); stabs (with) [√tud + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc and +instr)
Meaning pokes (with); pricks (with); stabs (with)
Root Family √tud
Root √tud･1 a (prick, stab)
Base √tud + a > tuda
Construction tuda + ti
Sanskrit tudati
Sanskrit Root √tud 6 (push, thrust)

Example

aṅgulipatodako nāma aṅguliyā'pi tudanti upasampanno upasampannaṃ has'ādhippāyo kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.2 aṅgulipatodakasikkhāpadaṃ
tudana

nt. pricking, piercing [√tud] ✗

pp. pricked, pecked, pierced, instigated [√tud] ✗

abs. having pricked, having pierced [√tud] ✗

masc. name of a independent Brahma ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a independent Brahma
tunna

pp. pricked, pecked, pierced, instigated [√tud] ✗
tunnavāya

masc. tailor ✗
tuma

masc. himself; herself; oneself; itself [ātuma] ✓

Grammar masc, abbrev of ātuma
Meaning himself; herself; oneself; itself
Construction ātuma > tuma
Phonetic Change ātuma > tuma (contraction)
Commentary (ANa) yaṃ tumo karissati tumo'va tena paññāyissatī'ti yaṃ esa karissati, eso'va tena kammena pākaṭo bhavissati.
Sanskrit ātman

Examples

parassa ce hi vacasā nihīno,
tumo sahā hoti nihīnapañño,
atha ce sayaṃ vedagū hoti dhīro,
na koci bālo samaṇesu atthi.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12

jānāmi passāmi tath'eva etaṃ,
diṭṭhiyā eke paccenti suddhiṃ,
addakkhi ce kiñ'hi tumassa tena,
atisitvā aññena vadanti suddhiṃ.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
tumanta

masc. (gram) infinitive ✗
tumicchattha

Meaning (gram) desiderative verb; lit. meaning wanting to
Construction tuṃ + icchā + attha
Compound kammadhāraya (tumiccha + attha)
Sanskrit tuṃ + iṣṭa + artha

bhuja ghasa hara su pā'icc'evam'ādīhi dhātūhi tum'icch'atthesu kha cha sa'icc'ete paccayā honti vā. bhottum'icchati, bubhukkhati, ghasitum'icchati, jighacchati, haritum'icchati, jigīsati, sotum'icchati, sussusati, pātum'icchati, pivāsati.

tumha

pron. you ✓

Grammar pron, base of tvaṃ
Meaning you
Variant tavaṃ, taṃ, tuvaṃ, tvaṃ
Sanskrit tva

Examples

samaṇā samaṇā'ti vo, bhikkhave, jano sañjānāti. tumhe ca pana, ke tumhe'ti puṭṭhā samānā, samaṇ'āmhā'ti paṭijānātha.

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha. yato tvaṃ bāhiya na tattha tato tvaṃ bāhiya n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
tumhaṃ 1

pron. for you all, to you all [tvaṃ] ✗
tumhaṃ 2

pron. your [tvaṃ] ✗

Grammar pron, 2nd dat pl of tvaṃ, irreg
Meaning for you all; to you all

Synonym tumhaṃ, tumhākaṃ, vo
tumhākampi

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning for you all too
Construction tumhākaṃ + api
Sanskrit yuṣmabhyam + api

Example

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, tumhākam'pi ye te pañca kāmaguṇā cetaso samphuṭṭhapubbā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā, tatra vo attarūpehi appamādo sati cetaso ārakkho karaṇīyo.

suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.

rājā satthu vacanaṃ sutvā, aho, bhante, bhāriyaṃ kammaṃ, ettake nāma bhoge vijjamāne n'eva attanā paribhuñji, na tumhādise buddhe dhuravihāre viharante puññakammaṃ akāsī'ti āha.

DHPa 2.24.11 aputtakaseṭṭhi vatthu
tumhe 1

pron. you all; you (royal plural) [tumha + e] ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd nom pl of tvaṃ
Meaning you all; you (royal plural)
Construction tumha + e
Sanskrit yūyam

Examples

yato tumhe, bhikkhave, indriyesu guttadvārā viharissatha, atha tumhehipi māro pāpimā nibbijja pakkamissati, otāraṃ alabhamāno, kummamhāva siṅgālo'ti.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

samaṇā samaṇā'ti vo, bhikkhave, jano sañjānāti. tumhe ca pana, ke tumhe'ti puṭṭhā samānā, samaṇ'āmhā'ti paṭijānātha.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
tumhe 2

Construction tumha + e
Variant tumhākaṃ, vo
Sanskrit yuṣmān

Example

deva, idāni ṭhapetvā saccakiriyaṃ añño mama sakkhi n'atthi, sac'āyaṃ dārako tumhe paṭicca jāto, ākāse tiṭṭhatu, no ce, bhūmiyaṃ patitvā maratū'ti bodhisattassa pāde gahetvā ākāse khipi.

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning even you all
Construction tumhe + api
Sanskrit yūyam + api

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi māro pāpimā satataṃ samitaṃ paccupaṭṭhito, app'eva nām'āhaṃ imesaṃ cakkhuto vā otāraṃ labheyyaṃ

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.

Examples

akkhātāro tathāgatā,
paṭipannā pamokkhanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.

sace me gataṭṭhāne dhītu doso uppajjati, tumhehi sodhetabbo.

DHPa 1.4.8 visākhā vatthu

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

tattha devamanussā gandhamāl'ādīhi pūjayamānā, mahāpurisa, idha tumhehi sadiso añño n'atthi, kut'ettha uttaritaro'ti āhaṃsu.

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidāna kathā
tuyha

pron. your; yours [tuyha(m)] ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd gen sg of tvaṃ, abbrev of tuyaṃ
Meaning your; yours
Construction tuyha(m) > tuyha
Synonym tava, tuyhaṃ, te
Sanskrit tava, te

Examples

na te idaṃ citta yathā purāṇakaṃ,
n'āhaṃ alaṃ tuyha vase nivattituṃ,
mah'esino pabbajito'mhi sāsane,
na mādisā honti vināsadhārino.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

ye tuyha chandena vasena vattino,
narā ca nārī ca anubhonti yaṃ sukhaṃ,
aviddasū māravas'ānuvattino,
bhav'ābhinandī tava citta sāvakā'ti.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
tuyhañhi

sandhi. for you certainly [tuyhaṃ + hi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning for you certainly
Construction tuyhaṃ + hi
Sanskrit tubhyam + hi

Example

tuyhañ'hi, pāpima, evaṃ hoti, eso'pi me assa hatthagato, eso'pi me assa vasaṃgato'ti. ahaṃ kho pana, pāpima, n'eva tava hatthagato n'eva tava vasaṃgato'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

Meaning just for you; all yours
Construction tuyhaṃ + eva
Sanskrit tubhyam + eva

Example

alaṃ, bhaṇe jīvaka, tuyham'eva hotu. amhākaññ'eva antepure nivesanaṃ māpehī'ti.

VIN 4.8.203 seṭṭhibhariyā vatthu
tuyhampi

Sanskrit tubhyam + api

Example

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ
tuyhaṃ 1

pron. for you; to you ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd dat sg of tvaṃ
Meaning for you; to you
Variant tava, te
Sanskrit tubhyam

Examples

sace kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattissasi, seyyathā'pi nāma puriso siriṃ āgacchantiṃ daṇḍena paṭippaṇāmeyya ... evaṃ sampadam'idaṃ, bhikkhu, tuyhaṃ bhavissati.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

disā catasso vidisā catasso,
uddhaṃ adho dasa disā imāyo,
na tuyhaṃ adiṭṭhaṃ asutaṃ amutaṃ,
atho aviññātaṃ kiñcanam'atthi loke,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16
tuyhaṃ 2

pron. your; yours ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd gen sg of tvaṃ
Meaning your; yours
Synonym tava, tuyha, te
Sanskrit tava, te

Examples

yattakaṃ tulitā esā,
tuyhaṃ dhītā anopamā,
tato aṭṭhaguṇaṃ dassaṃ,
hiraññaṃ ratanāni ca.

THI 54 anopamātherīgāthā

pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ,
vāc'ābhikaṅkhāmi mahesi tuyhaṃ,
tava sutvāna nigghosaṃ,
sikkhe nibbānam'attano.

SNP 60 dhotaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 5
tuyhiminā

sandhi. for you with this; to you by this [tuyhaṃ + iminā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning for you with this; to you by this
Construction tuyhaṃ + iminā
Sanskrit tvasmai + anena

Example

ambho purisa kiṃ tuyh'iminā pāpakena dujjīvitena, mataṃ te jīvitā seyyo'ti, iti cittamano cittasaṅkappo anekapariyāyena maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya

VIN PAT PA 3 manussaviggahasikkhāpadaṃ
turaga

masc. horse ✗

masc. horse ✗
turaṅgama

masc. horse ✗
turati

pr. is in a hurry, makes haste; runs [√tur] ✗
turi

fem. (comm) doe; young deer; lit. quick [√tur + i] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning (comm) doe; young deer; lit. quick
Root Family √tur
Root √tur･1 a (hurry, be quick)
Construction √tur + i
Derivative kita (i)
Variant kori
Commentary (THIa) akkhīni ca tūriyā'r'ivā'ti tūri vuccati migī, ca-saddo nipātamattaṃ, migacchāpāya viya te akkhīnī'ti attho. koriyā'r'ivā'ti vā pāḷi, kuñcakārakukkuṭiyā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit rohī
Sanskrit Root √tur √tvar √tṛ 6 (hasten)

Example

akkhīni ca turiyā'r'iva,
kinnariyā'r'iva pabbat'antare,
tava me nayanāni dakkhiya,
bhiyyo kāmaratī pavaḍḍhati.

DN 30.21 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ

na monena munī hoti,
mūḷharūpo aviddasu,
yo ca tulaṃ'va paggayha,
varam'ādāya paṇḍito.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 324
tuvañhi

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning you indeed
Construction tuvaṃ + hi
Sanskrit tvaḥ + hi

Example

ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.

sahassaṃ cātumahārājikānaṃ sahassaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ sahassaṃ yāmānaṃ sahassaṃ tusitānaṃ sahassaṃ nimmānaratīnaṃ sahassaṃ paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ sahassaṃ brahmalokānaṃ.

Construction √tus + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit tuṣita
Sanskrit Root √tuṣ 4 (be content)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, ariyasāvako devat'ānussatiṃ bhāveti, santi devā cātumahārājikā, santi devā tāvatiṃsā, santi devā yāmā, santi devā tusitā, santi devā nimmānaratino, santi devā paranimmitavasavattino, santi devā brahmakāyikā, santi devā tat'uttari.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ

bhummānaṃ devānaṃ saddaṃ sutvā cātumahārājikā devā ... tāvatiṃsā devā ... yāmā devā ... tusitā devā ... nimmānaratī devā ... paranimmitavasavattī devā ... brahmakāyikā devā saddam'anussāvesuṃ

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
tusita 3

adj. satisfied; fulfilled; content [√tus + ita] ✓

Grammar adj, from tussati
Meaning satisfied; fulfilled; content
Root Family √tus
Root √tus･3 ya (be content, pleased)
Construction √tus + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym avighātavant
Commentary (MNa) tusitassā'ti tuṭṭhacittassa.
Sanskrit tuṣita
Sanskrit Root √tuṣ 4 (be content)

Example

akathaṃkathissa tusitassa,
vantalok'āmisassa muditassa,
katasamaṇassa manujassa,
antimasārīrassa narassa,
anopamassa virajassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
tusitakāya

masc. host of Tusita heaven ✗

tusitā

masc. name of a group of deities; from Tusita heaven [√tus] ✗
tussati

pr. (+instr) is pleased (with); is satisfied (with); is content (with) [√tus + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning is pleased (with); is satisfied (with); is content (with)
Root Family √tus
Root √tus･3 ya (be content, pleased)
Base √tus + ya > tussa (pass)
Construction tussa + ti
Phonetic Change y > s
Sanskrit tuṣyati
Sanskrit Root √tuṣ 4 (be content)

Example

kulamhi mitte ca piye ca ñātake,
khiḍḍāratiṃ kāmaguṇañ'ca loke,
sabbaṃ pahāya imam'ajjhupāgato,
atho'pi tvaṃ citta na mayha tussasi.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sakko devānam'indo ekapuṇḍarīke uyyāne dibbehi pañcahi tūriyasatehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāreti.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ

Sanskrit tūrya + aṅga

Example

kaccāyana samāsakappa 322

Meaning one hundred musicians
Construction tūriya + sata

tena kho pana samayena sakko devānam'indo ekapuṇḍarīke uyyāne dibbehi pañcahi tūriyasatehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāreti.

tūla

nt. cotton; cotton-wool [√tūl + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning cotton; cotton-wool
Root Family √tūl
Root √tūl×1 a (be light)
Construction √tūl + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.9.8) tūlaṃ nāma tīṇi tūlāni, rukkhatūlaṃ, latātūlaṃ, poṭakitūlaṃ.
Sanskrit tūla
Sanskrit Root √tūl 10 (extract)

Examples

vuṭṭhamhi deve caturaṅgule tiṇe,
saṃpupphite meghanibhamhi kānane,
nag'antare viṭapisamo sayissaṃ,
taṃ me mudū hehiti tūlasannibhaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ licchavī sukhumālā mudutalunahatthapādā te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabimbohanāsu yāvasūriy'uggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.

Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij > tej + *as + to
tejas + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit tejāt
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

tejaṃ tejato sañjānāti, tejaṃ tejato saññatvā tejaṃ maññati, tejasmiṃ maññati, tejato maññati, tejaṃ me'ti maññati, tejaṃ abhinandati. taṃ kissa hetu? apariññātaṃ tassā'ti vadāmi.

MN 1 mūlapariyāyasuttaṃ
tejatta

nt. fieriness; fact of being fire [√tij + *as + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from tejas
Meaning fieriness; fact of being fire
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij > tej + *as + tta
tejas + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit tejastva
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

viññāṇaṃ anidassanaṃ anantaṃ sabbato pabhaṃ, taṃ pathaviyā pathavattena ananubhūtaṃ, āpassa āpattena ananubhūtaṃ, tejassa tejattena ananubhūtaṃ, vāyassa vāyattena ananubhūtaṃ

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
tejadhātu

fem. element of fire ✗
tejana 1

nt. arrow; shaft of an arrow; lit. burning [√tij + *ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from tejeti
Meaning arrow; shaft of an arrow; lit. burning
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij > tej + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit tejana
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

phandanaṃ capalaṃ cittaṃ,
dūrakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ,
ujuṃ karoti medhāvī,
usukāro'va tejanaṃ.

DHP 33 cittavaggo

udakañ'hi nayanti nettikā,
usukārā namayanti tejanaṃ,
dāruṃ namayanti tacchakā,
attānaṃ damayanti paṇḍitā.

DHP 80 paṇḍitavaggo
tejana 2

nt. sharpening [√tij] ✗
tejapasaṃsaka

adj. who praises fire; who approves of fire [tejas + pasaṃsaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who praises fire; who approves of fire
Construction tejas + pasaṃsaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (tejaṃ + pasaṃsaka)
Sanskrit tejas + praśaṃsaka

Example

ye pana, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ pathavīpasaṃsakā pathav'ābhinandino, āpapasaṃsakā āp'ābhinandino, tejapasaṃsakā tej'ābhinandino, vāyapasaṃsakā vāy'ābhinandino ... te kāyassa bhedā pāṇupacchedā paṇīte kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
tejavant

adj. majestic, glorious, generating heat [√tij] ✗
tejas 1

masc. flame; fire; heat [√tij + *as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, from tejeti
Meaning flame; fire; heat
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij > tej + *as
Derivative kita (*as)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym teja, tejo, santāpa
Notes tejo in comps
Sanskrit tejas
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti?

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ udake nikkhittaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya, aggiṃ abhinibbattessāmi, tejo pātukarissāmī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
tejas 2

masc. radiance; glory; splendour; power [√tij + *as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, from tejeti
Meaning radiance; glory; splendour; power
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij > tej + *as
Derivative kita (*as)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym obhāsa
Notes tejo in comps
Sanskrit tejas
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Examples

imesam'pi candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmah'iddhikānaṃ evaṃmah'ānubhāvānaṃ tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyeyyātha, ko pana vādo aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānan'ti!

AN 10.69 paṭhamakathāvatthusuttaṃ

bhagavā hi kāme abhibhuyya iriyati,
ādicco'va pathaviṃ tejī tejasā,
parittapaññassa me bhūripañña,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11

masc. poison; lit. heat [√tij + *as] ~

Phonetic Change i > e
Notes tejo in comps
Sanskrit tejas
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)
tejasā

ind. radiantly; gloriously; powerfully; lit. with fire [√tij + *as + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of tejas
Meaning radiantly; gloriously; powerfully; lit. with fire
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij > tej + *as + ā
tejas + ā
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit tejasena
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

divā tapati ādicco,
rattim'ābhāti candimā,
sannaddho khattiyo tapati,
jhāyī tapati brāhmaṇo,
atha sabbam'ahorattiṃ,
buddho tapati tejasā.

DHP 387 brāhmaṇavaggo
tejasāyuta

Meaning fiery hot; blazing hot
Construction tejasā + yuta

Grammar adj, from tejas
Meaning poisonous; venomous; lit. having fire

Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)

Sanskrit tejasvin
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

urago carati tejasī,

naraṃ nāriñ'ca ekadā,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11
tejeti

pr. heats, sharpens [√tij] ✗
tejetvā

abs. having heat, having sharpened [√tij] ✗
tejenta

prp. heating, sharpening [√tij] ✗
tejesi

aor. heat, sharpened [√tij] ✗
tejo

masc. fire; heat [√tij + *as + o] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps, mano group, from tejas
Meaning fire; heat
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･8 *e (be sharp, hot)
Construction √tij > tej + *as + o
tejas + o
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym tejas, santāpa
Sanskrit tejas
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ yathāṭhitaṃ yathāpaṇihitaṃ dhātuso paccavekkhati atthi imasmiṃ kāye pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū'ti

DN 22.6 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
tejokasiṇa

nt. fire kasina; total fire [tejo + kasiṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fire kasina; total fire
Construction tejo + kasiṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (tejo + kasiṇa)
Sanskrit tejas + kṛtsna

Example

āpokasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ. tejokasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
tejokasiṇasamāpattiparama

adj. regarding the attainment of fire kasina as the ultimate [tejokasiṇa + samāpatti + parama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning regarding the attainment of fire kasina as the ultimate
Construction tejokasiṇa + samāpatti + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (tejokasiṇasamāpatti + parama)
Sanskrit tejas + kṛtsna + samāpatti + parama

Example

tejokasiṇasamāpattiparamā kho, bhagini … viññāṇakasiṇasamāpattiparamā kho, bhagini, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā attho'ti abhinibbattesuṃ. yāvatā kho, bhagini, viññāṇakasiṇasamāpattiparamatā, tadabhiññāsi bhagavā.

AN 10.26 kāḷīsuttaṃ
tejokāya

masc. mass of fire; lit. fire body [tejo + kāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mass of fire; lit. fire body
Construction tejo + kāya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tejaso + kāya)
Synonym tejokhandha
Commentary (MNa) pathavīkāyo'tiādīsu pathavī'y'eva pathavīkāyo, pathavīsamūho vā.
Sanskrit tejas + kāya

Example

katame satta? pathavīkāyo āpokāyo tejokāyo vāyokāyo sukhe dukkhe jīve sattame, ime sattakāyā akaṭā akaṭavidhā animmitā animmātā vañjhā kūṭaṭṭhā esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā.

MN 76 sandakasuttaṃ
tejokhandha

masc. mass of fire [tejo + khandha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mass of fire
Construction tejo + khandha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tejaso + khandha)
Synonym tejokāya
Sanskrit tejas + skandha

Example

sinerussa, bhikkhave, pabbatarājassa jhāyamānassa dayhamānassa vinassamānassa mahatā tejokhandhena abhibhūtassa yojanasatikāni'pi kūṭāni palujjanti dviyojanasatikāni'pi, tiyojanasatikāni'pi, catuyojanasatikāni'pi, pañcayojanasatikāni'pi kūṭāni palujjanti.

AN 7.66 sattasūriyasuttaṃ
tejogata

adj. fiery; hot; lit. fire state [tejo + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning fiery; hot; lit. fire state
Construction tejo + gata
Compound kammadhāraya (tejo + gata)
Sanskrit tejas + gata

Example

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ tejo tejogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, yena ca santappati yena ca jīrīyati yena ca pariḍayhati yena ca asitapītakhāyitasāyitaṃ sammā pariṇāmaṃ gacchati … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā tejodhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
tejodhātu

fem. fiery state; lit. fire state [tejo + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning fiery state; lit. fire state
Construction tejo + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (tejo + dhātu)
Commentary (DNa) tejodhātū'ti paripācanadhātu.
Sanskrit tejas + dhātu

Example

atha kho bhagavā tassa brahmuno upari vehāsaṃ pallaṅkena nisīdi tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā

SN 6.5 aññatarabrahmasuttaṃ
tejodhātukusala

adj. skilled in the fire element [tejodhātu + kusala] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning skilled in the fire element
Construction tejodhātu + kusala
Commentary (ANa) tejodhātukusalānan'ti tejodhātuṃ samāpajjituṃ kusalānaṃ sāgatatthero aggo'ti dasseti. ayañ'hi thero tejodhātusamāpattiyā ambatitthanāgassa tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyitvā taṃ nāgaṃ nibbisevanaṃ akāsi. tasmā tejodhātukusalānaṃ aggo nāma jāto.
tejosaññā

fem. (+loc) recognition of fire (in); perception of heat (in) [tejo + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp (+loc)
Meaning recognition of fire (in); perception of heat (in)
Construction tejo + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tejaso + saññā)
Sanskrit tejas + saṃjñā

Example

idha, sandha, bhadrassa puris'ājānīyassa pathaviyaṃ pathavisaññā vibhūtā hoti, āpasmiṃ āposaññā vibhūtā hoti, tejasmiṃ tejosaññā vibhūtā hoti, vāyasmiṃ vāyosaññā vibhūtā hoti

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
tejosaññī

adj. (+loc) aware of fire (in); percipient of heat (in) [tejo + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning aware of fire (in); percipient of heat (in)
Construction tejo + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tejaso + saññī)
Sanskrit tejas + saṃjñin

Example

siyā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno tathārūpo samādhipaṭilābho yathā n'eva pathaviyaṃ pathavisaññī assa, na āpasmiṃ āposaññī assa, na tejasmiṃ tejosaññī assa, na vāyasmiṃ vāyosaññī assa

AN 10.6 samādhisuttaṃ
tejosama

adj. like fire [tejo + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like fire
Construction tejo + sama
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (tejasā + sama)
Sanskrit tejas + sama

Examples

tejosamaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. tejosamañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato uppannā manāp'āmanāpā phassā cittaṃ na pariyādāya ṭhassanti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, tejo sucim'pi ... ḍahati, na ca tena tejo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā. evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, tejosamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.

Meaning having fire; with heat

teti

Examples

UD 71 paṭhamanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti,
idam'eva saccan'ti ca vādayanti,
te tvaṃ vadassū na hi te'dha atthi,
vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
tedhā

ind. in three ways; threefold ✗
tena upāyena

idiom. in this way, thus; by this means ✗
tena khaṇena

idiom. at that moment; lit. with that moment ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + masc
Meaning at that moment; lit. with that moment
Synonym tasmiṃ khaṇe
Sanskrit tena + kṣaṇena

Example

itiha te āyasmanto tena khaṇena tena muhuttena yāvabrahmalokā viditā ahesuṃ

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
tena kho pana samayena

idiom. now at that time; now on that occasion ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + ind + ind + masc, instr for loc sg
Meaning now at that time; now on that occasion

Examples

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākassapo pāvāya kusināraṃ addhānamaggappaṭippanno hoti mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi

DN 16.39 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena kasibhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa pañcamattāni naṅgalasatāni payuttāni honti vappakāle.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
tena 1

pron. with him; by him; with that; by that [ta + ena] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt instr sg of ta
Meaning with him; by him; with that; by that
Construction ta + ena
Antonym yena
Sanskrit tena

Examples

atha te, jarasakko amhe matte katvā mahāsamuddapiṭṭhe khipitvā amhākaṃ devanagaraṃ gaṇhi, te mayaṃ tena saddhiṃ yujjhitvā amhākaṃ devanagaram'eva gaṇhissāmā'ti kipillikā viya thambhaṃ sineruṃ anusañcaramānā uṭṭhahiṃsu.

JAa 31 kulāvaka jātakavaṇṇanā

sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.

VIN 4.8.207 pajjotarāja vatthu
tena ca pana

idiom. and in that case when; and when ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + ind + ind
Meaning and in that case when; and when
Sanskrit tena + ca + punar

Example

tena ca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā imesu pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya cattāro dhammā uttari bhāvetabbā. asubhā bhāvetabbā rāgassa pahānāya, mettā bhāvetabbā byāpādassa pahānāya

AN 9.1 sambodhisuttaṃ
tena 2

ind. thereby; because of that; on that account; lit. by that; with that [ta + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of ta
Meaning thereby; because of that; on that account; lit. by that; with that
Construction ta + ena
Synonym tato, tatonidānaṃ, tatonimittaṃ, tāvatā
Sanskrit tena

Examples

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃ'y'eva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca karaṇīyaṃ.

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ

yo bālo maññati bālyaṃ,
paṇḍito v'āpi tena so,
bālo ca paṇḍitamānī,
sa ve bālo'ti vuccati.

DHP 63 bālavaggo
tena tena

idiom. here and there, everywhere; lit. by that with that ✗
tena 3

ind. there [ta + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of ta
Meaning there
Construction ta + ena
Sanskrit tena

Examples

yena yena subhikkhāni,
sivāni abhayāni ca,
tena puttaka gacchassu,
mā sokāpahato bhavā'ti.

TH 82 kassapattheragāthā

atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. vivari bhagavā dvāraṃ.

DN 3.3 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ
tena muhuttaṃ gacchati

idiom. goes along for a while; travels for a short time; lit. goes with that for a moment ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + adv + pr
Meaning goes along for a while; travels for a short time; lit. goes with that for a moment
Sanskrit tena + muhūrta + gacchati

Example

tam'enaṃ tvaṃ evaṃ vadeyyāsi, eh'ambho purisa, ayaṃ maggo rājagahaṃ gacchati. tena muhuttaṃ gaccha, tena muhuttaṃ gantvā dakkhissasi amukaṃ nāma gāmaṃ

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
tena hi

idiom. therefore; in that case; well then; if that’s so; because of that; lit. by that indeed ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + ind
Meaning therefore; in that case; well then; if that’s so; because of that; lit. by that indeed
Sanskrit tena + hi

Examples

tena hi, cunda, suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti kho cundo kammāraputto bhagavato paccassosi

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

tenah'ātappaṃ karohi,
idh'eva nipako sato,
ito sutvāna nigghosaṃ,
sikkhe nibbānam'attano.

SNP 60 dhotaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 5
tenaṅgena

ind. on account of that; in that respect; in that regard; lit. with that quality [tena + aṅga + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of tenaṅga
Meaning on account of that; in that respect; in that regard; lit. with that quality
Construction tena + aṅga + ena
tenaṅga + ena
Compound abyayībhāva (tena + aṅgena)
Synonym tadaṅgena
Sanskrit tena + aṅgena

Examples

sace hi, bho gotama, imaṃ dhammaṃ bhavaṃ'y'eva gotamo ārādhako abhavissa, no ca kho bhikkhū ārādhakā abhavissaṃsu, evam'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ aparipūraṃ abhavissa ten'aṅgena.

MN 73 mahāvacchasuttaṃ

saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti, no ca sīlavā. evaṃ so ten'aṅgena aparipūro hoti. tena taṃ aṅgaṃ paripūretabbaṃ, kin't'āhaṃ saddho ca assaṃ, sīlavā cā'ti!

AN 10.8 jhānasuttaṃ
tenañjaliṃ

sandhi. hands in reverential salutation towards someone [tena + añjaliṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + fem
Meaning hands in reverential salutation towards someone
Construction tena + añjaliṃ
Sanskrit tena + añjalim

Examples

atha kho candanaṅgaliko upāsako uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, paṭibhāti maṃ bhagavā, paṭibhāti maṃ sugatā'ti.

SN 3.12 pañcarājasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ udānaṃ udāneti

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā

idiom. having stretched out hands in reverential salutation towards [tena + añjaliṃ + paṇāmetvā] ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + fem + abs
Meaning having stretched out hands in reverential salutation towards
Construction tena + añjaliṃ + paṇāmetvā
Sanskrit tena + añjalim + pratinam

Examples

uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ sammukhā sāruppāhi gāthāhi abhitthavi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ udānaṃ udāneti

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
tenatthika

adj. wanting that; in need of that; having any use for that; lit. need with that [tena + atthika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting that; in need of that; having any use for that; lit. need with that
Construction tena + atthika
Commentary (SNa) ten'atthikā'ti n'āhaṃ tena atthikā.
tenapi

sandhi. just with that; with that alone [tena + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning just with that; with that alone
Construction tena + api
Sanskrit tena + api

Examples

tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
na t'āhaṃ kassāmi yathā atandito,
biḷārabhastaṃ'va yathā sumadditaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

diṭṭhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, caraṇaṃ nāma cittan'ti? evaṃ, bhante. tam'pi kho, bhikkhave, caraṇaṃ nāma cittaṃ citten'eva cittitaṃ. tena'pi kho, bhikkhave, caraṇena cittena cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
tenavuti

fem. ninety-three ✗
tenahāyasmā

sandhi. therefore venerable; in that case venerable [tena + hi + āyasmā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind + masc
Meaning therefore venerable; in that case venerable
Construction tena + hi + āyasmā
Sanskrit tena + hi + āyuṣmān

Example

no ce kir'āyasmā khemako imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu kiñci attaṃ vā attaniyaṃ vā samanupassati. tenah'āyasmā khemako arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo'ti.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
tenahāvuso

sandhi. therefore friend; in that case brother; well then friend [tena + hi + āvuso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind + masc
Meaning therefore friend; in that case brother; well then friend
Construction tena + hi + āvuso
Sanskrit tena + hi + āyusmanto

Examples

yathā kathaṃ pan'āvuso sāriputta, imassa bhāsitassa attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? tenah'āvuso, upamaṃ te karissāmi. upamāya'p'idh'ekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṃ jānanti.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ

sādhu kho taṃ, āvuso isidatta, eso pañho paṭibhāsi, n'eso pañho maṃ paṭibhāsi. tenah'āvuso isidatta, yadā aññathā'pi evarūpo pañho āgaccheyya, taññ'ev'ettha paṭibhāseyyā'ti.

SN 41.2 paṭhamaisidattasuttaṃ
tenahi

sandhi. therefore; in that case; well then; if that’s so [tena + hi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning therefore; in that case; well then; if that’s so
Construction tena + hi
Sanskrit tena + hi

Example

tenahi-ānanda, yāvatikā bhikkhū vesāliṃ upanissāya viharanti te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ sannipātehī'ti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ
tenākārena

ind. by that means [tena + ākāra + ena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning by that means
Construction tena + ākāra + ena
Sanskrit tena + ākārena
tenāyaṃ

sandhi. by him this [tena + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning by him this
Construction tena + ayaṃ
Sanskrit tena + ayam

Example

ten'āyaṃ desito dhammo,
khayagāmī anuttaro,
tassa sāsanam'āgamma,
labbhate taṃ asokatā.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
tenāha

sandhi. because of that, one said [tena + āha] ~

Grammar sandhi, adv + perf
Meaning because of that, one said
Construction tena + āha
tenāhaṃ

sandhi. by that I [tena + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning by that I
Construction tena + ahaṃ
Sanskrit tena + aham

Example

evaṃ abhisaddahati, ime kho te dhammā ye me pubbe sutavā ahesuṃ, ten'āhaṃ eta'r'ahi kāyena ca phusitvā viharāmi, paññāya ca ativijjha passāmī'ti.

SN 48.50 āpaṇasuttaṃ
tenāhu

sandhi. because of that they said [tena + āhu] ~

Grammar sandhi, adv + perf
Meaning because of that they said
Construction tena + āhu
tenupasaṅkanta

pp. approached there; drew near to that place [tena + upasaṅkanta] ~

Grammar pp of tenupasaṅkamati, comp vb
Meaning approached there; drew near to that place
Construction tena + upasaṅkanta
tenupasaṅkamati

pr. goes there; approaches that place [tena + upasaṅkamati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning goes there; approaches that place
Construction tena + upasaṅkamati
Compound comp verb (tena + upasaṅkamati)
Sanskrit tena + upasaṃkrāmati

Examples

so tassā rattiyā accayena pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya yena tassa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā nivesanaṃ ten'upasaṅkamati.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ

te suṇanti, samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo amukaṃ nāma gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā osaṭo'ti. te yena samaṇo gotamo ten'upasaṅkamanti.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
tenupasaṅkamanta

prp. approaching there; drawing near to that place [tena + upasaṅkamanta] ~

Grammar prp, comp vb
Meaning approaching there; drawing near to that place
Construction tena + upasaṅkamanta
Sanskrit tena + upasaṃkramat
tenupasaṅkami

aor. approached there; went to that place [tena + upasaṅkami] ✓

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning approached there; went to that place
Construction tena + upasaṅkami
Sanskrit tena + upasaṃ + akramīt

Examples

siṅgālo'pi kho, bhikkhave, addasa kummaṃ kacchapaṃ dūrato'va gocarapasutaṃ. disvāna yena kummo kacchapo ten'upasaṅkami.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, kiṃkusalagavesī anuttaraṃ santivarapadaṃ pariyesamāno yena udako rāmaputto ten'upasaṅkamiṃ, upasaṅkamitvā udakaṃ rāmaputtaṃ etadavocaṃ

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
teneva

sandhi. just by that; because of that very thing; by that alone [tena + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning just by that; because of that very thing; by that alone
Construction tena + eva
Sanskrit tena + eva

Examples

ādānataṇhaṃ vinayetha sabbaṃ,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'c'āpi majjhe,
yaṃ yañ'hi lokasmim'upādiyanti,
ten'eva māro anveti jantuṃ.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12

no ce āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇāti ten'eva dhammarāgena tāya dhammanandiyā pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā

MN 64 mahāmālukyasuttaṃ
tenevantaravassena

sandhi. during that very rainy season; within that very rains retreat [tena + eva + antaravassena] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + masc
Meaning during that very rainy season; within that very rains retreat
Construction tena + eva + antaravassena
Sanskrit tena + ava + antara + varṣeṇa

Example

atha kho āyasmā puṇṇo ten'ev'antaravassena pañcamattāni upāsakasatāni paṭivedesi. ten'ev'antaravassena pañcamattāni upāsikāsatāni paṭivedesi. ten'ev'antaravassena tisso vijjā sacchākāsi. ten'ev'antaravassena parinibbāyi.

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ
tenevāha

sandhi. on account of that it was said [tena + eva + āha] ~

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + perf
Meaning on account of that it was said
Construction tena + eva + āha
tepaññasati

fem. fifty-three ✗
tepaññasā

card. fifty three (53) ✗
tepaññāsama

ordin. fifty-third (53rd) ✗
tepare

sandhi. they (are) the other (two) [te + pare] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning they (are) the other (two)
Construction te + pare
Variant tyāpare
Commentary (THa) ty'āpare'ti vā pāṭho. te aparetv'eva padavibhāgo.
Sanskrit te + parāḥ

Example

sati ca sampajaññañ'ca,
caraṇā nāgassa tepare,
saddhāhattho mahānāgo,
upekkhāsetadantavā.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
tepi

sandhi. they too; and those too [te + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning they too; and those too
Construction te + api
Antonym yepi
Sanskrit te + api

Examples

evaṃ bhāvitāya, rāhula, ānāpānassatiyā, evaṃ bahulīkatāya ye'pi te carimakā assāsā te'pi viditā'va nirujjhanti no aviditā'ti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

ye tattha anumodanti,
veyyāvaccaṃ karonti vā,
na tena dakkhiṇā ūnā,
te'pi puññassa bhāgino.

tepiṭaka 1

Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit tripiṭaka
tepiṭaka 2

nt. three baskets of scripture ✗
tepime

sandhi. they too these [te + api + ime] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pron
Meaning they too these
Construction te + api + ime
Sanskrit te + api + ime

Example

ye'pi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṃ ukkalā vassabhaññā ahetukavādā akiriyavādā natthikavādā, te'p'ime tayo niruttipathe adhivacanapathe paññattipathe na garahitabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ amaññiṃsu.

temati

pr. (+acc) is wet [√tim + *a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning is wet
Root Family √tim
Root √tim･1 *a (be wet)
Base √tim + *a > tema
Construction tema + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit timyati
Sanskrit Root √tim √tīm √stim √stīm 4 (be wet)
temana

nt. wetting; moistening [√tim + *e + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from temeti, caus
Meaning wetting; moistening
Root Family √tim
Root √tim･1 *e (be wet)
Base √tim + *e > teme (caus)
Construction teme + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit temana
Sanskrit Root √tim √tīm √stim √stīm 4 (be wet)

Example

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo, yaṃ mahāsamudde aṅgulipabbatemanamattam'pi udakaṃ na hoti.

DHPa 1.1.1 cakkhupālattheravatthu

VIN PAT NP 28 accekacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

temesi

aor. made wet, moistened [√tim] ✗
terasa 1

card. thirteen (13) [ti + dasa + *a] ✓

Grammar card, x pl, comp
Meaning thirteen (13)
Construction ti > te + dasa > rasa + *a
tirasa + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Compound dvanda (ti ca dasa ca)
Variant telasa, teḷasa
Sanskrit trayodaśa

Examples

ime kho pan'āyasmanto terasa saṅghādisesā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.

VIN PAT SA saṅghādisesuddeso

saṅghādisesenā'ti terasannaṃ aññatarena.

terovassika

adj. more than a year old; many years old; lit. beyond a year [tiro + vassa + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from tirovassa
Meaning more than a year old; many years old; lit. beyond a year
Construction tiro > tero + vassa + *ika
tirovassa + *ika

Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (DNa) terovassikānī'ti atikkantasaṃvaccharāni.
Sanskrit tiras + varṣika

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikāni puñjakitāni terovassikāni

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
tela

nt. (sesame) oil; lit. from sesame [tila + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from tila
Meaning (sesame) oil; lit. from sesame
Construction tila > tela + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (VIN 1.4.3.3) telaṃ nāma tilatelaṃ sāsapatelaṃ madhukatelaṃ eraṇḍatelaṃ vasātelaṃ.
Sanskrit taila

Examples

tatra y'āssa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa, yañ'ca khv'assa tatra sappi vā telaṃ vā taṃ uddhaṃ gāmi assa.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā nānābhesajjāni seyyath'idaṃ sappi navanītaṃ telaṃ madhu phāṇitaṃ

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
telaka

masc. medicine snuffed through the nose, or inserted in the nose [tila] ✗
telakānittheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 250 (TH250) ✗
telakumbha

masc. clay pot of oil [tela + kumbha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning clay pot of oil
Construction tela + kumbha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (telassa + kumbha)
Sanskrit taila + kumbha

Example

seyyathā'pi, gāmaṇi, puriso sappikumbhaṃ vā telakumbhaṃ vā gambhīre udakarahade ogāhetvā bhindeyya.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ
telagavesī

adj. seeking oil; searching for oil [tela + gavesī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning seeking oil; searching for oil
Construction tela + gavesī
telaghaṭa

masc. oil jar ✗
telacāṭi

fem. pot of oil ✗
telatthika

adj. wanting oil; in need of oil; seeking oil [tela + atthika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting oil; in need of oil; seeking oil
Construction tela + atthika
teladoṇi

fem. trough of oil [tela + doṇi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning trough of oil
Construction tela + doṇi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (telassa + doṇi)
Sanskrit taila + droṇī
teladhārā

fem. stream of oil [tela + dhārā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning stream of oil
Construction tela + dhārā
Commentary (THa) siniddhā teladhārā'vā'ti yathā anivattitā kusalajan'ābhisiñcitā savantī teladhārā avicchinnā siniddhā maṭṭhā dassanīyā pāsādikā hoti, evaṃ tesaṃ ākappasampannānaṃ iriyāpatho acchiddo saṇho maṭṭho dassanīyo pāsādiko ahosi.
Sanskrit taila + dhārā

Example

tato pāsādikaṃ āsi,
gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ.
siniddhā teladhārā'va,
ahosi iriyāpatho.

TH 257 pārāpariyattheragāthā
teladhūpita

adj. flavoured with oil ✗
teladhota

adj. oil sharpened; whetted with an oilstone [tela + dhota] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning oil sharpened; whetted with an oilstone
Construction tela + dhota
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (telena + dhota)
Commentary (VISMa) teladhotāyā'ti telena nisitāya.
Sanskrit taila + dhauta

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, katamaṃ nu kho varaṃ, yaṃ balavā puriso tiṇhāya sattiyā teladhotāya paccorasmiṃ pahareyya, yaṃ vā khattiyamahāsālānaṃ vā brāhmaṇamahāsālānaṃ vā gahapatimahāsālānaṃ vā añjalikammaṃ sādiyeyyā'ti?

Meaning tube of oil

masc. oil-lamp [tela + pajjota] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning oil-lamp
Construction tela + pajjota
Compound kammadhāraya (tela + pajjota)
Sanskrit tailapradīpa

Example

seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, telappadīpassa jhāyato acciṃ paṭicca ābhā paññāyati, ābhaṃ paṭicca acci paññāyati, evam'eva kho, āvuso, āyu usmaṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhati, usmā āyuṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhatī'ti.

Sanskrit taila + mala + kṛta

Example

tam'enaṃ aññataro puriso telamalikatena sāhuḷicīrena vañceyya, idaṃ te, ambho purisa, odātaṃ vatthaṃ abhirūpaṃ nimmalaṃ sucī'ti. so taṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, paṭiggahetvā pārupeyya.

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhisikkhāpadaṃ
telasa

Construction ti > te + dasa + *a > telasa
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
d > l
Variant terasa
Sanskrit trayodaśa
telasampāka

masc. medicine cooked with oil [tela + sampāka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning medicine cooked with oil
Construction tela + sampāka
Commentary (VINa) telaṃ pana vātabhesajj'atthaṃ majjena saddhiṃ pacanti, tasmim'pi anatikkhittamajje'y'eva anāpatti, yaṃ pana atikkhittamajjaṃ hoti, ettha majjassa vaṇṇagandharasā paññāyanti, tasmiṃ āpatti'y'eva.
telahoma

nt. oil oblation ✗
telika

masc. dealer in oil [tila] ✗
teva

sandhi. they just; only those; those same; (comm) they [te + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning they just; only those; those same; (comm) they
Construction te + eva
Variant te ca, ye ca
Commentary (MNa) t'eva ariyasāvakassā'ti te ariyasāvakassa. vakāro āgamasandhimattaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit te + eva

Examples

etth'ete pāpakā akusalā mānasā abhijjhā'pi byāpādā'pi sārambhā'pi saṃvattanti. t'eva ariyasāvakassa idha'm'anusikkhato antarāyāya sambhavanti.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ

t'eva, mahārāja, rūpā ekaccassa manāpā honti, t'eva rūpā ekaccassa amanāpā honti. yehi ca yo rūpehi attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo, so tehi rūpehi aññaṃ rūpaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.

SN 3.12 pañcarājasuttaṃ
tevācika

adj. using or involving three utterances or proclamations ✗
tevijja 1

adj. knowing the three Vedas [ti + vijjā + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from tivijjā
Meaning knowing the three Vedas
Construction ti > te + vijjā + *a
tivijjā + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit trividyā, trayīvida

Example

kathaṃ kho brāhmaṇo hoti,
kathaṃ bhavati vedagū,
tevijjo bho kathaṃ hoti,
sotthiyo kin'ti vuccati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
tevijja 2

Grammar adj, comp, from tivijjā
Meaning possessing the three knowledges
Construction ti > te + vijjā + *a
tivijjā + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit trividyā, trayīvida

Example

isisattamassa akuhassa,
tevijjassa brahmapattassa,
nhātakassa padakassa,
passaddhassa viditavedassa,
purindadassa sakkassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

tesa

Grammar pron, masc gen pl of ta
Meaning their
Construction ta + esāna(ṃ) > tesa
tesakuṇajātaka

nt. Jātaka 521 (JA 521) ✗
tesañca

sandhi. and of them; and of those; and their [tesaṃ + ca] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning and of them; and of those; and their
Construction tesaṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit tānām + ca

Example

saḷ'eva phass'āyatanāni bhikkhavo,
asaṃvuto yattha dukkhaṃ nigacchati,
tesañ'ca ye saṃvaraṇaṃ avedisuṃ,
saddhādutiyā viharant'ānavassutā.

Phonetic Change +y
ṃ > ñ
Variant tesaṃyeva
Sanskrit tānām + eva

Example

dadhi nāma tesaññ'eva dadhi.

VIN 2.5.4.9 paṇītabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ
tesaṭṭhi

Meaning seventy-three (73)

Sanskrit trisaptati
tesantakaro

sandhi. who puts an end to those [tesaṃ + antakaro] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + adj
Meaning who puts an end to those
Construction tesaṃ + antakaro
Phonetic Change ṃ > n
Sanskrit tebhyaḥ + antakara

Example

kaṅkhī vecikicchī āgamaṃ,
pañhe pucchituṃ abhikaṅkhamāno,
tes'antakaro bhavāhi pañhe me puṭṭho,
anupubbaṃ anudhammaṃ byākarohi me.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
tesamahaṃ aññataro

idiom. I am one of them [tesaṃ + ahaṃ + aññataro] ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + pron + adj
Meaning I am one of them
Construction tesaṃ + ahaṃ + aññataro
Synonym ahaṃ tesaṃ aññataro
Commentary (MNa) tesam'ahaṃ aññataro'ti tesaṃ aham'pi eko aññataro
Sanskrit tānām + aham + anyataraḥ

Example

ye hi vo ariyā parisuddhakāyakammantā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti tesam'ahaṃ aññataro'ti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
tesampi 1

sandhi. for them too [tesaṃ + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning for them too
Construction tesaṃ + api
Phonetic Change ṃ > m
Sanskrit tebhyaḥ + api

Example

cel'aṇḍukena ce'pi sabrahmacārī āyasmantaṃ puṇṇaṃ mantāṇiputtaṃ muddhanā pariharantā labheyyuṃ dassanāya, labheyyuṃ payirūpāsanāya, tesam'pi lābhā tesam'pi suladdhaṃ

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
tesampi 2

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning just their; just of them
Construction tesaṃ + api
Phonetic Change ṃ > m
Sanskrit tānām + api

Example

sandiṭṭhiyā c'eva vīvadātā,
saṃsuddhapaññā kusalā mutīmā,
na tesaṃ koci parihīnapañño,
diṭṭhī hi tesam'pi tathā samattā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
tesaṃ 1

pron. for them; to them; to those [ta + esānaṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt dat pl of ta
Meaning for them; to them; to those
Construction ta + esānaṃ > esaṃ
Synonym nesaṃ
Sanskrit tebhyaḥ

Examples

nānājanā janapadehi saṅgatā,
tava vīra vākyaṃ abhikaṅkhamānā,
tesaṃ tuvaṃ sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12

apārutā tesaṃ amatassa dvārā,
ye sotavanto pamuñcantu saddhaṃ,
vihiṃsasaññī paguṇaṃ na bhāsiṃ,
dhammaṃ paṇītaṃ manujesu brahme'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
tesaṃ 2

pron. their; of these; of them; of those [ta + esānaṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt gen pl of ta
Meaning their; of these; of them; of those
Construction ta + esānaṃ > esaṃ
Synonym imesaṃ, etesaṃ, esānaṃ, tāsaṃ, nesaṃ
Sanskrit tānām

Examples

yesaṃ sannicayo n'atthi,
ye pariññātabhojanā,
suññato animitto ca,
vimokkho yesaṃ gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ,
gati tesaṃ durannayā.

DHP 92 arahantavaggo

yāni sotāni lokasmiṃ,
sati tesaṃ nivāraṇaṃ,
sotānaṃ saṃvaraṃ brūmi,
paññāy'ete pidhiyyare.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1
tesaṃ 3

pron. when they; when these [ta + esānaṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt gen pl of ta, gen abs
Meaning when they; when these
Construction ta + esānaṃ > esaṃ
Sanskrit tānām

Example

tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ, yā samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadā taṃ paṭipajjissāma. evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
tesaṃyeva

sandhi. of those very; of those exact [tesaṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning of those very; of those exact
Construction tesaṃ + [y] + eva
Phonetic Change +y
Variant tesaññeva
Sanskrit tānām + eva

Examples

yā tesaṃ'y'eva dhammānaṃ āsevanā bhāvanā bahulīkammaṃ, ayaṃ ettha samādhibhāvanā'ti.

MN 44 cūḷavedallasuttaṃ

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃ'y'eva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca karaṇīyaṃ.

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ
tesāhaṃ

sandhi. their I; I of them; to them; for them [tesaṃ + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning their I; I of them; to them; for them
Construction tesaṃ + ahaṃ
Commentary (MNa) tes'āhaṃ tesaṃ ahaṃ.
Sanskrit tānām + aham

Examples

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchābhūmakā kamaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā aggiparicārikā udak'orohakā soceyyāni paññapenti, tes'āhaṃ soceyyāni rocemī'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

pubb'eva nu kho, etaṃ, bhante, bhagavato cetaso parivitakkitaṃ hoti ye maṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ pucchissanti tes'āhaṃ evaṃ puṭṭho evaṃ byākarissāmī'ti, udāhu ṭhānaso'v'etaṃ tathāgataṃ paṭibhātī'ti?

MN 58 abhayarājakumārasuttaṃ
tesu

pron. in those; in them; among them; among those [ta + esu] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt loc pl of ta
Meaning in those; in them; among them; among those
Construction ta + esu
Sanskrit teṣu

Examples

visenikatvā pana ye caranti,
diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra,
yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

iti yathā yathā naṃ tesu tesu janapadesu sañjānanti tathā tathā thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharati, idam'eva saccaṃ, mogham'aññan'ti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
tehi 1

pron. with them; with those; by them [ta + ehi] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt instr pl of ta
Meaning with them; with those; by them
Construction ta + ehi
Sanskrit taiḥ

Examples

atha kho te bhikkhū yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ

tiṇalat'ādigahanacchanne caṅkame caṅkamanto andhakāravelāyaṃ uragādike pāṇe akkamitvā vā māreti, tehi vā daṭṭho dukkhaṃ āpajjatī'ti gahanacchannatā tatiyo doso.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
tehi 2

pron. than them; from them [ta + ehi] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt abl pl of ta
Meaning than them; from them
Construction ta + ehi
Sanskrit tebhyaḥ

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekanikāyam'pi samanupassāmi evaṃ cittaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā, te'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā citten'eva cittitā, tehi'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatehi pāṇehi cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
teḷasa

card. thirteen (13) [ti + dasa + *a] ~

Grammar card, comp
Meaning thirteen (13)
Construction ti > te + dasa + *a > teḷasa
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
d > ḷ
Variant terasa
Sanskrit trayodaśa
to 1

suffix. from; by means of; through ✓

Grammar suffix, abl sg
Meaning from; by means of; through
Sanskrit -tāt

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi māro pāpimā satataṃ samitaṃ paccupaṭṭhito, app'eva nām'āhaṃ imesaṃ cakkhuto vā otāraṃ labheyyaṃ, sotato vā otāraṃ labheyyaṃ

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

pāṭaliputtassa kho, ānanda, tayo antarāyā bhavissanti, aggito vā udakato vā mithubhedā vā'ti.

DN 16.8 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
to 2

suffix. as ✓

Grammar suffix, abl sg
Meaning as
Sanskrit -tāt

Examples

suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu,
mogharāja sadā sato,
att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca,
evaṃ maccutaro siyā,
evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ,
maccurājā na passatī'ti.

SNP 70 mogharāja māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 15

diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno,
samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā,
ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ,
tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
todaka

adj. poking; pricking; stabbing [√tud + *aka] ~

Grammar adj, in comps, from tudati
Meaning poking; pricking; stabbing
Root Family √tud
Root √tud･1 a (prick, stab)
Construction √tud > tod + *aka
Derivative kita (*aka)
Sanskrit toda
Sanskrit Root √tud 6 (push, thrust)
todeyya

masc. name of a rich Brahmin ✗
todeyyaputta

masc. son of Todeyya ✗
todeyyamāṇavapucchā

fem. Sutta Nipāta 5.10 (SNP 64) ✗
tomara

masc. spear; lance (for controlling elephants) ~

Grammar masc
Meaning spear; lance (for controlling elephants)
Commentary (DNa) tomaran'ti pād'ādīsu vijjhanadaṇḍatomaraṃ.
Sanskrit tomara
tomarahattha

adj. with lance in hand ✗
toya

nt. water ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning water
Synonym ambu, daka, jala, ka, oda, odaka, oka, salila, uda, udaka, vāri
Notes only occurs in verse
Sanskrit toya

Examples

kadā nu maṃ pāvusakālamegho,
navena toyena sacīvaraṃ vane,
isippayātamhi pathe vajantaṃ,
ovassate taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

puṇḍarīkaṃ yathā vaggu,
toye na upalimpati,
evaṃ puññe ca pāpe ca,
ubhaye tvaṃ na limpasi,
pāde vīra pasārehi,
sabhiyo vandati satthuno'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
toraṇa

nt. arched entrance; gateway; portal; (comm) bulwark ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning arched entrance; gateway; portal; (comm) bulwark
Commentary (SNa) toraṇāni nāma hi puris'ubbedhāni nagarassa alaṅkār'atthaṃ karīyanti, coranivāraṇatthāni'pi honti'y'eva. atha vā toraṇan'ti piṭṭhasaṅghāṭass'etaṃ nāmaṃ, thirapiṭṭhasaṅghāṭan'ti'pi attho.
Sanskrit toraṇa

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, rañño paccantimaṃ nagaraṃ daḷh'uddāpaṃ daḷhapākāratoraṇaṃ ekadvāraṃ, tatr'assa dovāriko paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī aññātānaṃ nivāretā ñātānaṃ pavesetā

DN 16.5 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
toraṇavatthu

nt. name of a town [toraṇa + vatthu] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a town
Construction toraṇa + vatthu
tosa

masc. joy, satisfaction [√tus] ✗
tosana

nt. contenting; pleasing; contentment; satisfaction [√tus] ✗
tosanattha

adj. to be content; for satisfaction; lit. for the purpose of satisfying [tosanā + attha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning to be content; for satisfaction; lit. for the purpose of satisfying
Construction tosanā + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (tosanāya + attha)
Sanskrit toṣaṇa + artha

Example

annañ'ca laddhā vasanañ'ca kāle,
mattaṃ so jaññā idha tosan'atthaṃ,
so tesu gutto yatacāri gāme,
rusito'pi vācaṃ pharusaṃ na vajjā.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
tosanā 1

fem. satisfying; gratifying; making content [√tus + *anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from tussati
Meaning satisfying; gratifying; making content
Root Family √tus
Root √tus･3 ya (be content, pleased)
Construction √tus > tos + *anā
Derivative kita (*anā)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ārādhanā
Sanskrit toṣaṇa
Sanskrit Root √tuṣ 4 (be content)

Example

annañ'ca laddhā vasanañ'ca kāle,
mattaṃ so jaññā idha tosanā-atthaṃ,
so tesu gutto yatacāri gāme,
rusito'pi vācaṃ pharusaṃ na vajjā.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
tosanā 2

fem. act of making joyful or giving pleasure [√tus] ✗
tosayanta

prp. (+acc) pleasing; giving pleasure; giving satisfaction; lit. causing to be content [√tus + *aya + nta] ~

Grammar prp of tosayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning pleasing; giving pleasure; giving satisfaction; lit. causing to be content
Root Family √tus
Root √tus･3 *aya (be content, pleased)
Base √tus + *aya > tosaya (caus)
Construction tosaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit toṣayat
Sanskrit Root √tuṣ 4 (be content)
tosayamāna

prp. pleasing [√tus] ✗
tosayi

aor. pleased [√tus] ✗
tosāpana

nt. act of making joyful or giving pleasure [√tus] ✗
tosāpita

pp. made joyful, pleased [√tus] ✗
tosāpeti

pr. makes joyful, pleases [√tus] ✗
tosāpesi

aor. made joyful, pleased [√tus] ✗
tosita

pp. pleased [√tus] ✗
toseti 1

pr. (+acc) soothes; calms; comforts; consoles; lit. causes to be pleased [√tus + *e + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of tussati, trans (+acc)
Meaning soothes; calms; comforts; consoles; lit. causes to be pleased
Root Family √tus
Root √tus･3 *e (be content, pleased)
Base √tus + *e > tose (caus)
Construction tose + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym samassāseti
Commentary (NIDD2a) tosesī'ti tuṭṭhiṃ āpādesi.
Sanskrit Root √tuṣ 4 (be content)
toseti 2

pr. (+acc) pleases [√tus] ✗
tosetvā

abs. having pleased [√tus] ✗
tosenta

prp. pleasing [√tus] ✗
tosesi

aor. pleased [√tus] ✗
ty

ind. sometimes represents ti, te (or taṃ) before an initial vowel, which may be lengthened ✗
tyassa

sandhi. they his [te + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning they his
Construction te > ty + assa
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Sanskrit te + asya

Example

ty'assa sīlavato sīlaṃ,
cāgaṃ sucaritāni ca,
passamān'ānukubbanti,
ye bhavanti vicakkhaṇā.

AN 5.40 mahāsālaputtasuttaṃ
tyassu

sandhi. they may be; they should be [te + assu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + opt
Meaning they may be; they should be
Construction te > ty + assu
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Sanskrit te + syuḥ

Example

tesu na mānaṃ kayirātha,
tesu assa sagāravo,
ty'assa apacitā assu,
ty'assu sādhu supūjitā.

SN 7.15 mānatthaddhasuttaṃ
tyāpare

sandhi. they (are) the other (two) [te + apare] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning they (are) the other (two)
Construction te > ty + apare
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Variant tepare
Commentary (ANa) caraṇā nāgassa ty'āpare'ti te buddhanāgassa apare dve pacchimapādā.
Sanskrit te + parāḥ

Example

tapo ca brahmacariyaṃ,
caraṇā nāgassa ty'āpare,
saddhāhattho mahānāgo,
upekkhāsetadantavā.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ
tyāssa

sandhi. they his; they for him [te + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning they his; they for him
Construction te > ty + assa
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Sanskrit te + asya

Examples

sace naṃ koci kiñci āha, ty'āssa rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇanti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

tass'eva kho pana pubbe aviddasuno upadhī honti samattā samādinnā. ty'āssa pahīnā honti ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
tyāhaṃ 1

sandhi. I them [te + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning I them
Construction te > ty + ahaṃ
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Commentary (MNa) ty'āhan'ti te ahaṃ.
Sanskrit te + aham

Examples

ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, ahaṃ kho'mhi bhikkhave bhuttāvī pavārito paripuṇṇo pariyosito suhito yāva'd'attho, atthi ca me ayaṃ piṇḍapāto atirekadhammo chaḍḍanīyadhammo

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ

ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
tyāhaṃ 2

sandhi. I (am) your [te + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning I (am) your
Construction te > ty + ahaṃ
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Sanskrit tvasya + aham

Example

putto ty'āhaṃ mahārāja,
tvaṃ maṃ posa janādhipa,
aññe'pi devo poseti,
kiñ'ca devo sakaṃ pajanti.

JA 7 kaṭṭhahāri jātakaṃ
tyāhaṃ 3

sandhi. I to you; I you [te + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning I to you; I you
Construction te > ty + ahaṃ
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Commentary (ANa) apica ty'āhaṃ byākarissāmī'ti apica te aham'eva kathessāmī'ti.
Sanskrit tvam + aham

Example

addhā kho tvaṃ, gahapati, yaṃ paṭhamaṃ pucchitabbaṃ taṃ pucchasi. api ca ty'āhaṃ byākarissāmi. saññāvedayitanirodhasamāpattiyā kho, gahapati, dve dhammā bah'ūpakārā, samatho ca vipassanā cā'ti.

SN 41.6 dutiyakāmabhūsuttaṃ
tv

ind. sometimes represents ti, tu (or taṃ) before eva ✗
tvañca

sandhi. and you; but you [tvaṃ + ca] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning and you; but you
Construction tvaṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit tvam + ca

Examples

tvañ'ca me dhammam'akkhāhi,
taṇhānigghātanaṃ muni,
yaṃ viditvā sato caraṃ,
tare loke visattikaṃ.

SNP 63 hemaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 8

majjhe sarasmiṃ tiṭṭhataṃ,
oghe jāte mahabbhaye,
jarāmaccuparetānaṃ,
dīpaṃ pabrūhi mārisa,
tvañ'ca me dīpam'akkhāhi,
yathā'y'idaṃ n'āparaṃ siyā.

SNP 65 kappa māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 10
tvaññeva

sandhi. you alone; only you [tvaṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning you alone; only you
Construction tvaṃ + eva
Sanskrit tvam + eva

Example

tvaññ'eva no citta karosi brāhmaṇo,
tvaṃ khattiyo rājadasī karosi,
vessā ca suddā ca bhavāma ekadā,
devattanaṃ v'āpi tav'eva vāhasā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
tvamasi

sandhi. you are [tvaṃ + asi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pr
Meaning you are
Construction tvaṃ + asi
Antonym ahamasmi
Sanskrit tvam + asi

Examples

evaṃ vutte, ahaṃ, bhikkhave, māraṃ pāpimantaṃ etadavocaṃ, jānāmi kho t'āhaṃ, pāpima, mā tvaṃ maññittho, na maṃ jānātī'ti. māro tvam'asi, pāpima.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

na tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāsi, ahaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāmi. kiṃ tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānissasi? micchāpaṭipanno tvam'asi, aham'asmi sammāpaṭipanno

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ
tvampi

sandhi. you too [tvaṃ + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning you too
Construction tvaṃ + api
Sanskrit tvam + api

Examples

catuppado ahaṃ samma,
tvam'pi samma catuppado,
ehi samma nivattassu,
kiṃ nu bhīto palāyasi.

JA 153 sūkarajātakaṃ

ahaṃ kho, samaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi. tvam'pi, samaṇa, kasassu ca vapassu ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjassū'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
tvaṃ 1

pron. you (subject) [tumha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, 2nd nom sg of tumha
Meaning you (subject)
Construction tumha + aṃ > tuvaṃ > tvaṃ
Variant tavaṃ, taṃ, tumha, tuvaṃ
Sanskrit tvam

Examples

yato kho tvaṃ anuruddha ime aṭṭha mahāpurisavitakke vitakkessasi, tato tvaṃ anuruddha yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhissasi …

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā jātam'eva naṃ saṅghāṭikaṃ kareyyuṃ, saṅghāṭikattam'eva samādapeyyuṃ, ehi tvaṃ, bhadramukha, saṅghāṭiko hohi, saṅghāṭikassa te sato saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīyissati

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
tvaṃ 2

pron. you (object) [tvaṃ] ✗
tvaṃ mūlakaṃ

idiom. because of you ✗
tvaṃyeva

sandhi. (+gen) you alone (of) [tvaṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind (+gen)
Meaning you alone (of)
Construction tvaṃ + [y] + eva
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit tvam + eva

Example

sabb'eva kho ete, poṭṭhapāda, paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā, tvaṃ'y'eva nesaṃ eko cakkhumā. ek'aṃsikā'pi hi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā dhammā desitā paññattā, anek'aṃsikā'pi hi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā dhammā desitā paññattā.

DN 9.5 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, cittahatthisāriputtapoṭṭhapādavatthu
tvāpaccaya

masc. (gram) tvā suffix; used to form absolutive verbs ✗
tvāpaccayanta

adj. (gram) ending with the tvā suffix ✗
tveva 1

sandhi. however; but; rather; rather than [tu + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning however; but; rather; rather than
Construction tu + eva
Phonetic Change u > v
Sanskrit tu + eva

Examples

varaṃ bhikkhave assutavā puthujjano imaṃ cātumahābhūtikaṃ kāyaṃ attato upagaccheyya na tv'eva cittaṃ

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

no ca khv'assa evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti, ettakaṃ vata me ajja vāsijaṭassa khīṇaṃ, ettakaṃ hiyyo, ettakaṃ pare'ti. atha khv'assa khīṇe khīṇaṃtv'eva ñāṇaṃ hoti.

SN 22.101 vāsijaṭasuttaṃ
tveva 2

sandhi. just as [tu + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning just as
Construction tu > tv + eva
Phonetic Change u > v (Kacc 18, 20)
Sanskrit tu + eva

Examples

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṭṭhañ'ca paṭicca valliñ'ca paṭicca tiṇañ'ca paṭicca mattikañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito agāraṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati, evam'eva kho, āvuso, aṭṭhiñ'ca paṭicca nhāruñ'ca paṭicca maṃsañ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito rūpaṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

ko nāmo ayaṃ, bhante, dhammapariyāyo'ti? tasmā't'iha tvaṃ, ānanda, imaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ madhupiṇḍikapariyāyo tv'eva naṃ dhārehī'ti

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ
tveva 3

sandhi. but even then [tu + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning but even then
Construction tu > tv + eva
Phonetic Change u > v (Kacc 18, 20)
Sanskrit tu + eva

Examples

sac'assa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpema, na tv'eva mayaṃ, bhante, tappaccayā vācaṃ bhindāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

osāne'tv'eva byāruddhe,
disvā me aratī ahu,
ath'ettha sallam'addakkhiṃ,
duddasaṃ hadayanissitaṃ.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
tvevāhaṃ

sandhi. but even then I; certainly I just [tu + eva + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + pron
Meaning but even then I; certainly I just
Construction tu > tv + eva + ahaṃ
Phonetic Change u > v (Kacc 18, 20)
Sanskrit tu + eva + aham

Examples

hoti so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ mahāsamuddo ussussati visussati na bhavati, na tv'ev'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi.

SN 22.99 gaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

iti kho, bhikkhave, paripūraṃ paripūrakārī ārādheti padesaṃ padesakārī. avañjhānitv'ev'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sikkhāpadāni vadāmī'ti.
